Quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The ego is nothing other than the focus of conscious attention.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Never pretend to a love which you do not actually feel, for love is not ours to command.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: You don't look out there for God, something in the sky, you look in you.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: I owe my solitude to other people.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: You and I are all as much continuous with the physical universe as a wave is continuous with the ocean.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: But I'll tell you what hermits realize. If you go off into a far, far forest and get very quiet, you'll come to understand that you're connected with everything.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: We cannot be more sensitive to pleasure without being more sensitive to pain.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Things are as they are. Looking out into it the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The reason we want to go on and on is because we live in an impoverished present.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: So then, the relationship of self to other is the complete realization that loving yourself is impossible without loving everything defined as other than yourself.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Technology is destructive only in the hands of people who do not realize that they are one and the same process as the universe.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Reality is only a Rorschach ink-blot, you know.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Saints need sinners.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Some believe all that parents, tutors, and kindred believe. They take their principles by inheritance, and defend them as they would their estates, because they are born heirs to them.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The reason we have poverty is that we have no imagination. There are a great many people accumulating what they think is vast wealth, but it's only money... they don't know how to enjoy it, because they have no imagination.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The style of God venerated in the church, mosque, or synagogue seems completely different from the style of the natural universe.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: But at any rate, the point is that God is what nobody admits to being, and everybody really is.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: We identify in our experience a differentiation between what we do and what happens to us.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: And the attitude of faith is the very opposite of clinging to belief, of holding on.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Unless one is able to live fully in the present, the future is a hoax.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: So what is discord at one level of your being is harmony at another level.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Zen does not confuse spirituality with thinking about God while one is peeling potatoes. Zen spirituality is just to peel the potatoes.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: What the devil is the point of surviving, going on living, when it's a drag? But you see, that's what people do.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: But to me nothing - the negative, the empty - is exceedingly powerful.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Faith is a state of openness or trust.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Omnipotence is not knowing how everything is done; it's just doing it.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The difficulty for most of us in the modern world is that the old-fashioned idea of God has become incredible or implausible.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: So the bodhisattva saves all beings, not by preaching sermons to them, but by showing them that they are delivered, they are liberated, by the act of not being able to stop changing.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: In known history, nobody has had such capacity for altering the universe than the people of the United States of America. And nobody has gone about it in such an aggressive way.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: A myth is an image in terms of which we try to make sense of the world.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: But we try to pretend, you see, that the external world exists altogether independently of us.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: You are that vast thing that you see far, far off with great telescopes.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The religious idea of God cannot do full duty for the metaphysical infinity.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The myths underlying our culture and underlying our common sense have not taught us to feel identical with the universe, but only parts of it, only in it, only confronting it - aliens.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: In other words, a person who is fanatic in matters of religion, and clings to certain ideas about the nature of God and the universe, becomes a person who has no faith at all.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Wars based on principle are far more destructive... the attacker will not destroy that which he is after.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The moralist is the person who tells people that they ought to be unselfish, when they still feel like egos, and his efforts are always and invariably futile.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Religion is not a department of life; it is something that enters into the whole of it.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: And although our bodies are bounded with skin, and we can differentiate between outside and inside, they cannot exist except in a certain kind of natural environment.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Buddhism has in it no idea of there being a moral law laid down by somekind of cosmic lawgiver.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: If you study the writings of the mystics, you will always find things in them that appear to be paradoxes, as in Zen, particularly.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I would rather live my life as if there is a God and die to find out there isn't, than live as if there isn't and to die to find out that there is.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: A man without ethics is a wild beast loosed upon this world.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Nothing is more despicable than respect based on fear.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The struggle itself towards the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To know oneself, one should assert oneself.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward, but he who has hope for it is a fool.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Truth, like light, blinds. Falsehood, on the contrary, is a beautiful twilight that enhances every object.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Those who lack the courage will always find a philosophy to justify it.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: There is no love of life without despair of life.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: All great deeds and all great thoughts have a ridiculous beginning. Great works are often born on a street corner or in a restaurant's revolving door.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: You cannot create experience. You must undergo it.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To be happy we must not be too concerned with others.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Integrity has no need of rules.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Every act of rebellion expresses a nostalgia for innocence and an appeal to the essence of being.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The need to be right is the sign of a vulgar mind.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The evil that is in the world almost always comes of ignorance, and good intentions may do as much harm as malevolence if they lack understanding.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The modern mind is in complete disarray. Knowledge has stretched itself to the point where neither the world nor our intelligence can find any foot-hold. It is a fact that we are suffering from nihilism.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Basically, at the very bottom of life, which seduces us all, there is only absurdity, and more absurdity. And maybe that's what gives us our joy for living, because the only thing that can defeat absurdity is lucidity.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of tyrants.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Without work, all life goes rotten. But when work is soulless, life stifles and dies.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Alas, after a certain age every man is responsible for his face.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads?
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Truth is mysterious, elusive, always to be conquered. Liberty is dangerous, as hard to live with as it is elating. We must march toward these two goals, painfully but resolutely, certain in advance of our failings on so long a road.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We always deceive ourselves twice about the people we love - first to their advantage, then to their disadvantage.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: In order to exist, man must rebel, but rebellion must respect the limits that it discovers in itself - limits where minds meet, and in meeting, begin to exist.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Man is the only creature that refuses to be what he is.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: It is necessary to fall in love... if only to provide an alibi for all the random despair you are going to feel anyway.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: There is no fate that cannot be surmounted by scorn.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Truly fertile Music, the only kind that will move us, that we shall truly appreciate, will be a Music conducive to Dream, which banishes all reason and analysis. One must not wish first to understand and then to feel. Art does not tolerate Reason.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I should like to be able to love my country and still love justice.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We continue to shape our personality all our life. If we knew ourselves perfectly, we should die.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Some people talk in their sleep. Lecturers talk while other people sleep.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Charm is a way of getting the answer 'Yes' without asking a clear question.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: No cause justifies the deaths of innocent people.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The myth of unlimited production brings war in its train as inevitably as clouds announce a storm.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Without culture, and the relative freedom it implies, society, even when perfect, is but a jungle. This is why any authentic creation is a gift to the future.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Each generation doubtless feels called upon to reform the world. Mine knows that it will not reform it, but its task is perhaps even greater. It consists in preventing the world from destroying itself.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: A free press can, of course, be good or bad, but, most certainly without freedom, the press will never be anything but bad.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Judging whether life is or is not worth living amounts to answering the fundamental question of philosophy.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Lying is not only saying what isn't true. It is also, in fact especially, saying more than is true and, in the case of the human heart, saying more than one feels. We all do it, every day, to make life simpler.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: At any street corner the feeling of absurdity can strike any man in the face.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: In order to understand the world, one has to turn away from it on occasion.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I grew up with the sea, and poverty for me was sumptuous; then I lost the sea and found all luxuries gray and poverty unbearable.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: For if there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: There is in me an anarchy and frightful disorder. Creating makes me die a thousand deaths, because it means making order, and my entire being rebels against order. But without it I would die, scattered to the winds.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We get into the habit of living before acquiring the habit of thinking. In that race which daily hastens us towards death, the body maintains its irreparable lead.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Real nobility is based on scorn, courage, and profound indifference.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: By definition, a government has no conscience. Sometimes it has a policy, but nothing more.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: It is not your paintings I like, it is your painting.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Your successes and happiness are forgiven you only if you generously consent to share them.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To insure the adoration of a theorem for any length of time, faith is not enough, a police force is needed as well.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Men are convinced of your arguments, your sincerity, and the seriousness of your efforts only by your death.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: As a remedy to life in society I would suggest the big city. Nowadays, it is the only desert within our means.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To abandon oneself to principles is really to die - and to die for an impossible love which is the contrary of love.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I draw from the Absurd three consequences: my revolt, my liberty, my passion.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Stupidity has a knack of getting its way.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: All that I know most surely about morality and obligations I owe to football.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Against eternal injustice, man must assert justice, and to protest against the universe of grief, he must create happiness.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: There will be no lasting peace either in the heart of individuals or in social customs until death is outlawed.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: At 30 a man should know himself like the palm of his hand, know the exact number of his defects and qualities, know how far he can go, foretell his failures - be what he is. And, above all, accept these things.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The world is never quiet, even its silence eternally resounds with the same notes, in vibrations which escape our ears. As for those that we perceive, they carry sounds to us, occasionally a chord, never a melody.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: After all manner of professors have done their best for us, the place we are to get knowledge is in books. The true university of these days is a collection of books.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To cut short the question of the law of retaliation, we must note that even in its primitive form it can operate only between two individuals of whom one is absolutely innocent, and the other absolutely guilty. The victim, to be sure, is innocent. But can the society that is supposed to represent the victim lay claim to innocence?
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The desire for possession is insatiable, to such a point that it can survive even love itself. To love, therefore, is to sterilize the person one loves.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We are all special cases.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The role of the intellectual cannot be to excuse the violence of one side and condemn that of the other.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To correct a natural indifference I was placed half-way between misery and the sun. Misery kept me from believing that all was well under the sun, and the sun taught me that history wasn't everything.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Those who write clearly have readers, those who write obscurely have commentators.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Without freedom, no art; art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Don't wait for the last judgment - it takes place every day.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The artist forges himself to the others, midway between the beauty he cannot do without and the community he cannot tear himself away from. That is why true artists scorn nothing: they are obliged to understand rather than to judge.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Culture: the cry of men in face of their destiny.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Note, besides, that it is no more immoral to directly rob citizens than to slip indirect taxes into the price of goods that they cannot do without.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Every revolutionary ends up either by becoming an oppressor or a heretic.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Retaliation is related to nature and instinct, not to law. Law, by definition, cannot obey the same rules as nature.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: One leader, one people, signifies one master and millions of slaves.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: All modern revolutions have ended in a reinforcement of the power of the State.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Don't believe your friends when they ask you to be honest with them. All they really want is to be maintained in the good opinion they have of themselves.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Too many have dispensed with generosity in order to practice charity.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We rarely confide in those who are better than we are.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Virtue cannot separate itself from reality without becoming a principle of evil.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To assert in any case that a man must be absolutely cut off from society because he is absolutely evil amounts to saying that society is absolutely good, and no-one in his right mind will believe this today.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Only a philosophy of eternity, in the world today, could justify non-violence.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Violence is both unavoidable and unjustifiable.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Every man, and for stronger reasons, every artist, wants to be recognized. So do I.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: You have to be very rich or very poor to live without a trade.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Ah, mon cher, for anyone who is alone, without God and without a master, the weight of days is dreadful.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: There is the good and the bad, the great and the low, the just and the unjust. I swear to you that all that will never change.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: What is a rebel? A man who says no: but whose refusal does not imply a renunciation.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The society based on production is only productive, not creative.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We turn toward God only to obtain the impossible.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Heroism is accessible. Happiness is more difficult.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The gods had condemned Sisyphus to ceaselessly rolling a rock to the top of a mountain, whence the stone would fall back of its own weight. They had thought with some reason that there is no more dreadful punishment than futile and hopeless labor.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The real passion of the twentieth century is servitude.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Every time somebody speaks of my honesty, there is someone who quivers inside me.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: In order to speak about all and to all, one has to speak of what all know and of the reality common to us all. The sea, rains, necessity, desire, the struggle against death... these are things that unite us all.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: No matter what cause one defends, it will suffer permanent disgrace if one resorts to blind attacks on crowds of innocent people.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Men are never really willing to die except for the sake of freedom: therefore they do not believe in dying completely.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Conscious of not being able to separate myself from my time, I have decided to become part of it.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Man wants to live, but it is useless to hope that this desire will dictate all his actions.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Why should it be essential to love rarely in order to love much?
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We used to wonder where war lived, what it was that made it so vile. And now we realize that we know where it lives... inside ourselves.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Methods of thought which claim to give the lead to our world in the name of revolution have become, in reality, ideologies of consent and not of rebellion.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I am not made for politics because I am incapable of wanting or accepting the death of the adversary.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: There is but one truly serious philosophical problem and that is suicide.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: After all, every murderer when he kills runs the risk of the most dreadful of deaths, whereas those who kill him risk nothing except promotion.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The only really committed artist is he who, without refusing to take part in the combat, at least refuses to join the regular armies and remains a freelance.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Martyrs, my friend, have to choose between being forgotten, mocked or used. As for being understood - never.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Every artist preserves deep within him a single source from which, throughout his lifetime, he draws what he is, and what he says. When the source dries up, the work withers and crumbles.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I have never been able to renounce the light, the pleasure of being, and the freedom in which I grew up.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: In order to exist just once in the world, it is necessary never again to exist.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Every great work makes the human face more admirable and richer, and that is its whole secret.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We call first truths those we discover after all the others.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I was born poor and without religion, under a happy sky, feeling harmony, not hostility, in nature. I began not by feeling torn, but in plenitude.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Working conditions for me have always been those of the monastic life: solitude and frugality. Except for frugality, they are contrary to my nature, so much so that work is a violence I do to myself.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: How hard, how bitter it is to become a man!
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: It is normal to give away a little of one's life in order not to lose it all.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Those who weep for the happy periods which they encounter in history acknowledge what they want; not the alleviation but the silencing of misery.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Every man needs slaves like he needs clean air. To rule is to breathe, is it not? And even the most disenfranchised get to breathe. The lowest on the social scale have their spouses or their children.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Man is an idea, and a precious small idea once he turns his back on love.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: What the world requires of the Christians is that they should continue to be Christians.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The absurd depends as much on man as on the world. For the moment, it is all that links them together.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: For centuries the death penalty, often accompanied by barbarous refinements, has been trying to hold crime in check; yet crime persists. Why? Because the instincts that are warring in man are not, as the law claims, constant forces in a state of equilibrium.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Rebellion cannot exist without the feeling that somewhere, in some way, you are justified.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: When you have really exhausted an experience you always reverence and love it.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To govern means to pillage, as everyone knows.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: To be famous, in fact, one has only to kill one's landlady.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The day when I am no more than a writer I shall cease to be a writer.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Maybe this world is another planet's hell.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age, which means never losing your enthusiasm.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: There are things known and there are things unknown, and in between are the doors of perception.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons of history.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Dream in a pragmatic way.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: You shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you mad.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The propagandist's purpose is to make one set of people forget that certain other sets of people are human.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backwards.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The more powerful and original a mind, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: I'm afraid of losing my obscurity. Genuineness only thrives in the dark. Like celery.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Experience teaches only the teachable.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: It is a bit embarrassing to have been concerned with the human problem all one's life and find at the end that one has no more to offer by way of advice than 'try to be a little kinder.'
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: My father considered a walk among the mountains as the equivalent of churchgoing.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The most valuable of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do, when it has to be done, whether you like it or not.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Great is truth, but still greater, from a practical point of view, is silence about truth. By simply not mentioning certain subjects... totalitarian propagandists have influenced opinion much more effectively than they could have by the most eloquent denunciations.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: An intellectual is a person who's found one thing that's more interesting than sex.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The charm of history and its enigmatic lesson consist in the fact that, from age to age, nothing changes and yet everything is completely different.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Sons have always a rebellious wish to be disillusioned by that which charmed their fathers.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: A fanatic is a man who consciously over compensates a secret doubt.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The worst enemy of life, freedom and the common decencies is total anarchy; their second worst enemy is total efficiency.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: There isn't any formula or method. You learn to love by loving - by paying attention and doing what one thereby discovers has to be done.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The most shocking fact about war is that its victims and its instruments are individual human beings, and that these individual beings are condemned by the monstrous conventions of politics to murder or be murdered in quarrels not their own.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Every man's memory is his private literature.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumor.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: There's only one effectively redemptive sacrifice, the sacrifice of self-will to make room for the knowledge of God.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Several excuses are always less convincing than one.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: People intoxicate themselves with work so they won't see how they really are.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Perhaps it's good for one to suffer. Can an artist do anything if he's happy? Would he ever want to do anything? What is art, after all, but a protest against the horrible inclemency of life?
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: We participate in a tragedy; at a comedy we only look.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: What is absurd and monstrous about war is that men who have no personal quarrel should be trained to murder one another in cold blood.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: A child-like man is not a man whose development has been arrested; on the contrary, he is a man who has given himself a chance of continuing to develop long after most adults have muffled themselves in the cocoon of middle-aged habit and convention.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Hell isn't merely paved with good intentions; it's walled and roofed with them. Yes, and furnished too.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: It takes two to make a murder. There are born victims, born to have their throats cut, as the cut-throats are born to be hanged.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Most ignorance is vincible ignorance. We don't know because we don't want to know.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Speed provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Most of one's life is one prolonged effort to prevent oneself thinking.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: My fate cannot be mastered; it can only be collaborated with and thereby, to some extent, directed. Nor am I the captain of my soul; I am only its noisiest passenger.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Cynical realism is the intelligent man's best excuse for doing nothing in an intolerable situation.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Feasts must be solemn and rare, or else they cease to be feasts.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: One of the great attractions of patriotism - it fulfills our worst wishes. In the person of our nation we are able, vicariously, to bully and cheat. Bully and cheat, what's more, with a feeling that we are profoundly virtuous.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Every man who knows how to read has it in his power to magnify himself, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: God isn't compatible with machinery and scientific medicine and universal happiness. You must make your choice. Our civilization has chosen machinery and medicine and happiness.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Chastity - the most unnatural of all the sexual perversions.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Science has explained nothing; the more we know the more fantastic the world becomes and the profounder the surrounding darkness.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Proverbs are always platitudes until you have personally experienced the truth of them.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Children are remarkable for their intelligence and ardor, for their curiosity, their intolerance of shams, the clarity and ruthlessness of their vision.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: An unexciting truth may be eclipsed by a thrilling lie.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Like every man of sense and good feeling, I abominate work.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The finest works of art are precious, among other reasons, because they make it possible for us to know, if only imperfectly and for a little while, what it actually feels like to think subtly and feel nobly.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: There is something curiously boring about somebody else's happiness.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: All gods are homemade, and it is we who pull their strings, and so, give them the power to pull ours.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The proper study of mankind is books.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The vast majority of human beings dislike and even actually dread all notions with which they are not familiar... Hence it comes about that at their first appearance innovators have generally been persecuted, and always derided as fools and madmen.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Everyone who wants to do good to the human race always ends in universal bullying.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Habit converts luxurious enjoyments into dull and daily necessities.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: A man may be a pessimistic determinist before lunch and an optimistic believer in the will's freedom after it.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Men do not learn much from the lessons of history and that is the most important of all the lessons of history.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: A democracy which makes or even effectively prepares for modern, scientific war must necessarily cease to be democratic. No country can be really well prepared for modern war unless it is governed by a tyrant, at the head of a highly trained and perfectly obedient bureaucracy.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Defined in psychological terms, a fanatic is a man who consciously over-compensates a secret doubt.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Man is an intelligence in servitude to his organs.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: We are all geniuses up to the age of ten.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The impulse to cruelty is, in many people, almost as violent as the impulse to sexual love - almost as violent and much more mischievous.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Your true traveller finds boredom rather agreeable than painful. It is the symbol of his liberty - his excessive freedom. He accepts his boredom, when it comes, not merely philosophically, but almost with pleasure.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: If human beings were shown what they're really like, they'd either kill one another as vermin, or hang themselves.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: There is no substitute for talent. Industry and all its virtues are of no avail.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Words, words, words! They shut one off from the universe. Three quarters of the time one's never in contact with things, only with the beastly words that stand for them.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Bondage is the life of personality, and for bondage the personal self will fight with tireless resourcefulness and the most stubborn cunning.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: It was one of those evenings when men feel that truth, goodness and beauty are one. In the morning, when they commit their discovery to paper, when others read it written there, it looks wholly ridiculous.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Idealism is the noble toga that political gentlemen drape over their will to power.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Speed, it seems to me, provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Happiness is a hard master, particularly other people's happiness.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: So long as men worship the Caesars and Napoleons, Caesars and Napoleons will duly arise and make them miserable.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The quality of moral behavior varies in inverse ratio to the number of human beings involved.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Europe is so well gardened that it resembles a work of art, a scientific theory, a neat metaphysical system. Man has re-created Europe in his own image.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Like every other good thing in this world, leisure and culture have to be paid for. Fortunately, however, it is not the leisured and the cultured who have to pay.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: That all men are equal is a proposition to which, at ordinary times, no sane human being has ever given his assent.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: From their experience or from the recorded experience of others (history), men learn only what their passions and their metaphysical prejudices allow them to learn.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Official dignity tends to increase in inverse ratio to the importance of the country in which the office is held.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Specialized meaninglessness has come to be regarded, in certain circles, as a kind of hallmark of true science.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: What with making their way and enjoying what they have won, heroes have no time to think. But the sons of heroes - ah, they have all the necessary leisure.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The most distressing thing that can happen to a prophet is to be proved wrong. The next most distressing thing is to be proved right.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Uncontrolled, the hunger and thirst after God may become an obstacle, cutting off the soul from what it desires. If a man would travel far along the mystic road, he must learn to desire God intensely but in stillness, passively and yet with all his heart and mind and strength.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: De Sade is the one completely consistent and thoroughgoing revolutionary of history.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Writers write to influence their readers, their preachers, their auditors, but always, at bottom, to be more themselves.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Orthodoxy is the diehard of the world of thought. It learns not, neither can it forget.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: What we feel and think and are is to a great extent determined by the state of our ductless glands and viscera.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: You should hurry up and acquire the cigar habit. It's one of the major happinesses. And so much more lasting than love, so much less costly in emotional wear and tear.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Amour is the one human activity of any importance in which laughter and pleasure preponderate, if ever so slightly, over misery and pain.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: A bad book is as much of a labor to write as a good one, it comes as sincerely from the author's soul.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: The author of the Iliad is either Homer or, if not Homer, somebody else of the same name.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Thought must be divided against itself before it can come to any knowledge of itself.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Those who believe that they are exclusively in the right are generally those who achieve something.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: That we are not much sicker and much madder than we are is due exclusively to that most blessed and blessing of all natural graces, sleep.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: It's with bad sentiments that one makes good novels.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Anybody can become angry - that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way - that is not within everybody's power and is not easy.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Whosoever is delighted in solitude is either a wild beast or a god.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: At his best, man is the noblest of all animals; separated from law and justice he is the worst.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Well begun is half done.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Good habits formed at youth make all the difference.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Hope is a waking dream.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Republics decline into democracies and democracies degenerate into despotisms.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies; for the hardest victory is over self.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Education is the best provision for old age.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The law is reason, free from passion.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The ultimate value of life depends upon awareness and the power of contemplation rather than upon mere survival.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Democracy is when the indigent, and not the men of property, are the rulers.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The aim of the wise is not to secure pleasure, but to avoid pain.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Jealousy is both reasonable and belongs to reasonable men, while envy is base and belongs to the base, for the one makes himself get good things by jealousy, while the other does not allow his neighbour to have them through envy.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living from the dead.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Probable impossibilities are to be preferred to improbable possibilities.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The secret to humor is surprise.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The end of labor is to gain leisure.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Change in all things is sweet.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Education is an ornament in prosperity and a refuge in adversity.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The soul never thinks without a picture.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We make war that we may live in peace.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: What it lies in our power to do, it lies in our power not to do.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: To run away from trouble is a form of cowardice and, while it is true that the suicide braves death, he does it not for some noble object but to escape some ill.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: If one way be better than another, that you may be sure is nature's way.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Suffering becomes beautiful when anyone bears great calamities with cheerfulness, not through insensibility but through greatness of mind.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Fear is pain arising from the anticipation of evil.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: All paid jobs absorb and degrade the mind.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Dignity does not consist in possessing honors, but in deserving them.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: A great city is not to be confounded with a populous one.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Wit is educated insolence.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is best to rise from life as from a banquet, neither thirsty nor drunken.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Mothers are fonder than fathers of their children because they are more certain they are their own.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The most perfect political community is one in which the middle class is in control, and outnumbers both of the other classes.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Youth is easily deceived because it is quick to hope.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: For one swallow does not make a summer, nor does one day; and so too one day, or a short time, does not make a man blessed and happy.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is just that we should be grateful, not only to those with whose views we may agree, but also to those who have expressed more superficial views; for these also contributed something, by developing before us the powers of thought.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The greatest virtues are those which are most useful to other persons.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Character may almost be called the most effective means of persuasion.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The state comes into existence for the sake of life and continues to exist for the sake of good life.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Plato is dear to me, but dearer still is truth.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We become just by performing just action, temperate by performing temperate actions, brave by performing brave action.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Friendship is essentially a partnership.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: A tyrant must put on the appearance of uncommon devotion to religion. Subjects are less apprehensive of illegal treatment from a ruler whom they consider god-fearing and pious. On the other hand, they do less easily move against him, believing that he has the gods on his side.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The whole is more than the sum of its parts.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: He who hath many friends hath none.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Without friends no one would choose to live, though he had all other goods.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: All men by nature desire knowledge.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: I have gained this from philosophy: that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The gods too are fond of a joke.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Every art and every inquiry, and similarly every action and choice, is thought to aim at some good; and for this reason the good has rightly been declared to be that at which all things aim.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Men create gods after their own image, not only with regard to their form but with regard to their mode of life.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: If liberty and equality, as is thought by some, are chiefly to be found in democracy, they will be best attained when all persons alike share in government to the utmost.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The wise man does not expose himself needlessly to danger, since there are few things for which he cares sufficiently; but he is willing, in great crises, to give even his life - knowing that under certain conditions it is not worthwhile to live.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Both oligarch and tyrant mistrust the people, and therefore deprive them of their arms.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: For as the eyes of bats are to the blaze of day, so is the reason in our soul to the things which are by nature most evident of all.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Persuasion is achieved by the speaker's personal character when the speech is so spoken as to make us think him credible. We believe good men more fully and more readily than others: this is true generally whatever the question is, and absolutely true where exact certainty is impossible and opinions are divided.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: In poverty and other misfortunes of life, true friends are a sure refuge. The young they keep out of mischief; to the old they are a comfort and aid in their weakness, and those in the prime of life they incite to noble deeds.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: There was never a genius without a tincture of madness.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Some animals are cunning and evil-disposed, as the fox; others, as the dog, are fierce, friendly, and fawning. Some are gentle and easily tamed, as the elephant; some are susceptible of shame, and watchful, as the goose. Some are jealous and fond of ornament, as the peacock.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: In a democracy the poor will have more power than the rich, because there are more of them, and the will of the majority is supreme.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Man is the only animal capable of reasoning, though many others possess the faculty of memory and instruction in common with him.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The least initial deviation from the truth is multiplied later a thousandfold.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: In making a speech one must study three points: first, the means of producing persuasion; second, the language; third the proper arrangement of the various parts of the speech.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Nature does nothing in vain.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Courage is a mean with regard to fear and confidence.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: No excellent soul is exempt from a mixture of madness.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We must no more ask whether the soul and body are one than ask whether the wax and the figure impressed on it are one.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Most people would rather give than get affection.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Those who excel in virtue have the best right of all to rebel, but then they are of all men the least inclined to do so.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: A statement is persuasive and credible either because it is directly self-evident or because it appears to be proved from other statements that are so.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Bashfulness is an ornament to youth, but a reproach to old age.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Perfect friendship is the friendship of men who are good, and alike in excellence; for these wish well alike to each other qua good, and they are good in themselves.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is unbecoming for young men to utter maxims.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Therefore, the good of man must be the end of the science of politics.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Different men seek after happiness in different ways and by different means, and so make for themselves different modes of life and forms of government.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The duty of rhetoric is to deal with such matters as we deliberate upon without arts or systems to guide us, in the hearing of persons who cannot take in at a glance a complicated argument or follow a long chain of reasoning.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Inferiors revolt in order that they may be equal, and equals that they may be superior. Such is the state of mind which creates revolutions.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: No notice is taken of a little evil, but when it increases it strikes the eye.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Bad men are full of repentance.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Of all the varieties of virtues, liberalism is the most beloved.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: He who is to be a good ruler must have first been ruled.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Men are swayed more by fear than by reverence.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: No one loves the man whom he fears.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: No one would choose a friendless existence on condition of having all the other things in the world.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting in a particular way.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Law is mind without reason.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The true and the approximately true are apprehended by the same faculty; it may also be noted that men have a sufficient natural instinct for what is true, and usually do arrive at the truth. Hence the man who makes a good guess at truth is likely to make a good guess at probabilities.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is not once nor twice but times without number that the same ideas make their appearance in the world.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: In constructing the plot and working it out with the proper diction, the poet should place the scene, as far as possible, before his eyes. In this way, seeing everything with the utmost vividness, as if he were a spectator of the action, he will discover what is in keeping with it, and be most unlikely to overlook inconsistencies.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The moral virtues, then, are produced in us neither by nature nor against nature. Nature, indeed, prepares in us the ground for their reception, but their complete formation is the product of habit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Democracy arises out of the notion that those who are equal in any respect are equal in all respects; because men are equally free, they claim to be absolutely equal.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The eyes of some persons are large, others small, and others of a moderate size; the last-mentioned are the best. And some eyes are projecting, some deep-set, and some moderate, and those which are deep-set have the most acute vision in all animals; the middle position is a sign of the best disposition.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: A constitution is the arrangement of magistracies in a state.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Some kinds of animals burrow in the ground; others do not. Some animals are nocturnal, as the owl and the bat; others use the hours of daylight. There are tame animals and wild animals. Man and the mule are always tame; the leopard and the wolf are invariably wild, and others, as the elephant, are easily tamed.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The generality of men are naturally apt to be swayed by fear rather than reverence, and to refrain from evil rather because of the punishment that it brings than because of its own foulness.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Some animals utter a loud cry. Some are silent, and others have a voice, which in some cases may be expressed by a word; in others, it cannot. There are also noisy animals and silent animals, musical and unmusical kinds, but they are mostly noisy about the breeding season.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Poetry is finer and more philosophical than history; for poetry expresses the universal, and history only the particular.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: What the statesman is most anxious to produce is a certain moral character in his fellow citizens, namely a disposition to virtue and the performance of virtuous actions.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Excellence, then, is a state concerned with choice, lying in a mean, relative to us, this being determined by reason and in the way in which the man of practical wisdom would determine it.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Bring your desires down to your present means. Increase them only when your increased means permit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: A tragedy is a representation of an action that is whole and complete and of a certain magnitude. A whole is what has a beginning and middle and end.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Persuasion is clearly a sort of demonstration, since we are most fully persuaded when we consider a thing to have been demonstrated.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Politicians also have no leisure, because they are always aiming at something beyond political life itself, power and glory, or happiness.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Even when laws have been written down, they ought not always to remain unaltered.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The young are permanently in a state resembling intoxication.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Homer has taught all other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Whether if soul did not exist time would exist or not, is a question that may fairly be asked; for if there cannot be someone to count there cannot be anything that can be counted, so that evidently there cannot be number; for number is either what has been, or what can be, counted.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is clearly better that property should be private, but the use of it common; and the special business of the legislator is to create in men this benevolent disposition.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Piety requires us to honor truth above our friends.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: He who can be, and therefore is, another's, and he who participates in reason enough to apprehend, but not to have, is a slave by nature.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Our judgments when we are pleased and friendly are not the same as when we are pained and hostile.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The beginning of reform is not so much to equalize property as to train the noble sort of natures not to desire more, and to prevent the lower from getting more.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: For though we love both the truth and our friends, piety requires us to honor the truth first.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Rhetoric may be defined as the faculty of observing in any given case the available means of persuasion. This is not a function of any other art.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: But if nothing but soul, or in soul mind, is qualified to count, it is impossible for there to be time unless there is soul, but only that of which time is an attribute, i.e. if change can exist without soul.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Hence poetry is something more philosophic and of graver import than history, since its statements are rather of the nature of universals, whereas those of history are singulars.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Temperance is a mean with regard to pleasures.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: All virtue is summed up in dealing justly.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: A sense is what has the power of receiving into itself the sensible forms of things without the matter, in the way in which a piece of wax takes on the impress of a signet-ring without the iron or gold.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The poet, being an imitator like a painter or any other artist, must of necessity imitate one of three objects - things as they were or are, things as they are said or thought to be, or things as they ought to be. The vehicle of expression is language - either current terms or, it may be, rare words or metaphors.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Thou wilt find rest from vain fancies if thou doest every act in life as though it were thy last.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We praise a man who feels angry on the right grounds and against the right persons and also in the right manner at the right moment and for the right length of time.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Long-lived persons have one or two lines which extend through the whole hand; short-lived persons have two lines not extending through the whole hand.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is Homer who has chiefly taught other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We are not angry with people we fear or respect, as long as we fear or respect them; you cannot be afraid of a person and also at the same time angry with him.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: To attain any assured knowledge about the soul is one of the most difficult things in the world.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Milk is for babies. When you grow up you have to drink beer.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The future is green energy, sustainability, renewable energy.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The worst thing I can be is the same as everybody else. I hate that.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: For me life is continuously being hungry. The meaning of life is not simply to exist, to survive, but to move ahead, to go up, to achieve, to conquer.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: It's simple, if it jiggles, it's fat.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The mind is the limit. As long as the mind can envision the fact that you can do something, you can do it, as long as you really believe 100 percent.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Just remember, you can't climb the ladder of success with your hands in your pockets.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Help others and give something back. I guarantee you will discover that while public service improves the lives and the world around you, its greatest reward is the enrichment and new meaning it will bring your own life.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I think that gay marriage should be between a man and a woman.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The last three or four reps is what makes the muscle grow. This area of pain divides the champion from someone else who is not a champion. That's what most people lack, having the guts to go on and just say they'll go through the pain no matter what happens.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Failure is not an option. Everyone has to succeed.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Start wide, expand further, and never look back.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The resistance that you fight physically in the gym and the resistance that you fight in life can only build a strong character.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Money doesn't make you happy. I now have $50 million but I was just as happy when I had $48 million.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: My body is like breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I don't think about it, I just have it.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Bodybuilding is much like any other sport. To be successful, you must dedicate yourself 100% to your training, diet and mental approach.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: In our society, the women who break down barriers are those who ignore limits.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: As long as I live, I will never forget that day 21 years ago when I raised my hand and took the oath of citizenship. Do you know how proud I was? I was so proud that I walked around with an American flag around my shoulders all day long.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I knew I was a winner back in the late sixties. I knew I was destined for great things. People will say that kind of thinking is totally immodest. I agree. Modesty is not a word that applies to me in any way - I hope it never will.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: What we face may look insurmountable. But I learned something from all those years of training and competing. I learned something from all those sets and reps when I didn't think I could lift another ounce of weight. What I learned is that we are always stronger than we know.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: If it bleeds, we can kill it.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Training gives us an outlet for suppressed energies created by stress and thus tones the spirit just as exercise conditions the body.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I'll be back.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: If it's hard to remember, it'll be difficult to forget.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I have a love interest in every one of my films: a gun.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Learned helplessness is the giving-up reaction, the quitting response that follows from the belief that whatever you do doesn't matter.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I saw a woman wearing a sweatshirt with Guess on it. I said, Thyroid problem?
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I'm addicted to exercising and I have to do something every day.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I'm not perfect.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I had this child, and it destroyed my family.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: No matter the nationality, no matter the religion, no matter the ethnic background, America brings out the best in people.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: My own dreams fortunately came true in this great state. I became Mr. Universe; I became a successful businessman. And even though some people say I still speak with a slight accent, I have reached the top of the acting profession.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Government's first duty and highest obligation is public safety.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I was born in Europe... and I've traveled all over the world. I can tell you that there is no place, no country, that is more compassionate, more generous, more accepting, and more welcoming than the United States of America.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: You know, nothing is more important than education, because nowhere are our stakes higher; our future depends on the quality of education of our children today.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I believe with all my heart that America remains 'the great idea' that inspires the world. It is a privilege to be born here. It is an honor to become a citizen here. It is a gift to raise your family here, to vote here, and to live here.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I have a private plane. But I fly commercial when I go to environmental conferences.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I don't suffer of anything that I've lost.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I went from being the Terminator to being the governator.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: As you know, I'm an immigrant. I came over here as an immigrant, and what gave me the opportunities, what made me to be here today, is the open arms of Americans. I have been received. I have been adopted by America.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I'm not looking for sympathy at all.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: My relationship to power and authority is that I'm all for it. People need somebody to watch over them. Ninety-five percent of the people in the world need to be told what to do and how to behave.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I welcome and seek your ideas, but do not bring me small ideas; bring me big ideas to match our future.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: To restore the trust of the people, we must reform the way the government operates.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I am the most helpful and open up doors for everyone and I like to share.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I'm sure a lot of people out there make mistakes.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Well, you know, I'm the forever optimist.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: 'I'll be back' always sounded a little girly to me.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I have inhaled, exhaled everything.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: If you work hard and play by the rules, this country is truly open to you. You can achieve anything.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Political courage is not political suicide.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The success I have achieved in bodybuilding, motion pictures, and business would not have been possible without the generosity of the American people and the freedom here to pursue your dreams.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: People should make up their own mind about what they think of me.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I just use my muscles as a conversation piece, like someone walking a cheetah down 42nd Street.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: For 20 years, Simon & Schuster asked me, 'Why don't you write your autobiography?'
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: And now, of course this is another thing I didn't count on, that now as the governor of the state of California, I am selling California worldwide. You see that? Selling.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: When you campaign and have to participate in so many debates just to the win the nomination of your party, you've had a lot of practice. You get to figure out as you go from one debate to another where you made your mistakes. By the time you get to the big debate you're pretty polished.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Women are the engine driving the growth in California's economy. Women make California's economy unique.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I do the same exercises I did 50 years ago and they still work. I eat the same food I ate 50 years ago and it still works.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I feel good because I believe I have made progress in rebuilding the people's trust in their government.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I speak directly to the people, and I know that the people of California want to have better leadership. They want to have great leadership. They want to have somebody that will represent them. And it doesn't matter if you're a Democrat or a Republican, young or old.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I made my fair share of mistakes.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I didn't leave bodybuilding until I felt that I had gone as far as I could go. It will be the same with my film career. When I feel the time is right, I will then consider public service. I feel that the highest honor comes from serving people and your country.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Freedom is a right ultimately defended by the sacrifice of America's servicemen and women.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I would never exchange my life with anybody else's.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I told Warren if he mentions Prop. 13 one more time, he has to do 500 push-ups.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: There is no place, no country, more compassionate more generous more accepting and more welcoming than the United States of America.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I have plenty of money, unlike other Hollywood celebrities or athletes that have not invested well.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I think Americans are very patriotic.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I am a big believer in education, because when I grew up in Austria - when I grew up in Austria I had a great education. I had great teachers.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Everything I have, my career, my success, my family, I owe to America.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I think that people are interested seeing me on the screen.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: People need to be insured so when you have an accident out there, or when something catastrophic happens to you, that you're covered and there's not someone else has to pay for you. That is as simple as that.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Even with my divorce and with everything, I don't need money.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: What's fascinating is, people in Washington would rather spend time in Hollywood, and people in Hollywood would rather spend time in Washington.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I know a lot of athletes and models are written off as just bodies. I never felt used for my body.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Politically there were failures. And also on the personal level, there were tremendous failures.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Gray Davis can run a dirty campaign better than anyone, but he can't run a state.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: If my life was a movie, no one would believe it.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: You can scream at me, call me for a shoot at midnight, keep me waiting for hours - as long as what ends up on the screen is perfect.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: In this country, it doesn't make any difference where you were born. It doesn't make any difference who your parents were. It doesn't make any difference if, like me, you couldn't even speak English until you were in your twenties.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: My friend James Cameron and I made three films together - True Lies, The Terminator and Terminator 2. Of course, that was during his early, low-budget, art-house period.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The writing is important, but the way you say the line and the pause you give it, the facial expression - all of that is very important.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Teddy Roosevelt is still a hero among environmentalists for his conservationist policies.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I can promise you that when I go to Sacramento, I will pump up Sacramento.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Well, I think that California has had a history of always spending more money than it takes in.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: As president, Reagan worked very well with Democrats to do big things. It is true that he worked to reduce the size of government and cut federal taxes and he eliminated many regulations, but he also raised taxes when necessary.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: When the people become involved in their government, government becomes more accountable, and our society is stronger, more compassionate, and better prepared for the challenges of the future.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: One of my movies was called 'True Lies.' It's what the Democrats should have called their convention.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I came to Hollywood and within a decade I was one of the biggest action stars of all time.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: The biggest problem that we have is that California is being run now by special interests. All of the politicians are not anymore making the moves for the people, but for special interests and we have to stop that.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: We are a forward-looking people, and we must have a forward-looking government.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: Maria is the best reason to come home.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I was striving to be the most muscular man, and it got me into the movies. It got me everything that I have.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: It's time to stop thinking of the Republican Party as an exclusive club where your ideological card is checked at the door, and start thinking about how we can attract more solution-based leaders like Nathan Fletcher and Anthony Adams.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: To live alone is the fate of all great souls.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The doctor sees all the weakness of mankind; the lawyer all the wickedness, the theologian all the stupidity.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Just remember, once you're over the hill you begin to pick up speed.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Each day is a little life: every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone, and if he does not love solitude, he will not love freedom, for it is only when he is alone that he is really free.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: A man can do what he wants, but not want what he wants.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Satisfaction consists in freedom from pain, which is the positive element of life.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Men are by nature merely indifferent to one another; but women are by nature enemies.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Money is human happiness in the abstract; he, then, who is no longer capable of enjoying human happiness in the concrete devotes himself utterly to money.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Wealth is like sea-water; the more we drink, the thirstier we become; and the same is true of fame.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Every parting gives a foretaste of death, every reunion a hint of the resurrection.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The greatest of follies is to sacrifice health for any other kind of happiness.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
