Quote: People who have given us their complete confidence believe that they have a right to ours. The inference is false, a gift confers no rights.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: There are slavish souls who carry their appreciation for favors done them so far that they strangle themselves with the rope of gratitude.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: We do not hate as long as we still attach a lesser value, but only when we attach an equal or a greater value.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: There are no moral phenomena at all, but only a moral interpretation of phenomena.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: One often contradicts an opinion when what is uncongenial is really the tone in which it was conveyed.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: He who laughs best today, will also laughs last.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Regarding life, the wisest men of all ages have judged alike: it is worthless.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: It is the most sensual men who need to flee women and torment their bodies.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Of all that is written, I love only what a person has written with his own blood.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: In everything one thing is impossible: rationality.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Judgments, value judgments concerning life, for or against, can in the last resort never be true: they possess value only as symptoms, they come into consideration only as symptoms - in themselves such judgments are stupidities.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Sing me a new song; the world is transfigured; all the Heavens are rejoicing.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Plato was a bore.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: In the last analysis, even the best man is evil: in the last analysis, even the best woman is bad.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: The best author will be the one who is ashamed to become a writer.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Before the effect one believes in different causes than one does after the effect.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: In Christianity neither morality nor religion come into contact with reality at any point.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: There is a rollicking kindness that looks like malice.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: The Christian resolution to find the world ugly and bad has made the world ugly and bad.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Art is not merely an imitation of the reality of nature, but in truth a metaphysical supplement to the reality of nature, placed alongside thereof for its conquest.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Fanatics are picturesque, mankind would rather see gestures than listen to reasons.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I do not know what the spirit of a philosopher could more wish to be than a good dancer. For the dance is his ideal, also his fine art, finally also the only kind of piety he knows, his 'divine service.'
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: A friend should be a master at guessing and keeping still: you must not want to see everything.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Whoever feels predestined to see and not to believe will find all believers too noisy and pushy: he guards against them.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: It says nothing against the ripeness of a spirit that it has a few worms.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Undeserved praise causes more pangs of conscience later than undeserved blame, but probably only for this reason, that our power of judgment are more completely exposed by being over praised than by being unjustly underestimated.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: At times one remains faithful to a cause only because its opponents do not cease to be insipid.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: In the course of history, men come to see that iron necessity is neither iron nor necessary.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: This is what is hardest: to close the open hand because one loves.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: A great value of antiquity lies in the fact that its writings are the only ones that modern men still read with exactness.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: What is good? All that heightens the feeling of power, the will to power, power itself in man.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Many a man fails as an original thinker simply because his memory it too good.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: What then in the last resort are the truths of mankind? They are the irrefutable errors of mankind.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: You say it is the good cause that hallows even war? I say unto you: it is the good war that hallows any cause.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Whoever has witnessed another's ideal becomes his inexorable judge and as it were his evil conscience.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: The press, the machine, the railway, the telegraph are premises whose thousand-year conclusion no one has yet dared to draw.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: When one does away with oneself one does the most estimable thing possible: one thereby almost deserves to live.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: A subject for a great poet would be God's boredom after the seventh day of creation.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Admiration for a quality or an art can be so strong that it deters us from striving to possess it.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: All sciences are now under the obligation to prepare the ground for the future task of the philosopher, which is to solve the problem of value, to determine the true hierarchy of values.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: What do I care about the purring of one who cannot love, like the cat?
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Every man is a creative cause of what happens, a primum mobile with an original movement.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Today I love myself as I love my god: who could charge me with a sin today? I know only sins against my god; but who knows my god?
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Nothing has been purchased more dearly than the little bit of reason and sense of freedom which now constitutes our pride.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Experience, as a desire for experience, does not come off. We must not study ourselves while having an experience.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, does the enlightened man dislike to wade into its waters.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: There is in general good reason to suppose that in several respects the gods could all benefit from instruction by us human beings. We humans are - more humane.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Genteel women suppose that those things do not really exist about which it is impossible to talk in polite company.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: There is nothing we like to communicate to others as much as the seal of secrecy together with what lies under it.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I ain't giving up on myself, so if you give up on me, I ain't got nothing else to say for you.
Author: Future

Quote: You got one life to live. So I'm living it the way I want to live it.
Author: Future

Quote: At the end of the day, I'm out of here - above anything.
Author: Future

Quote: You gotta catch the sauce. Move with me... I'm dripping sauce.
Author: Future

Quote: You want to create your own path, no matter what situation you're in.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm just really a free spirit. You gotta be like that. 'Cause life ain't that complicated. It's only that complicated when you make it that way. I just wanna wake up and move with the way it goes. If it's meant to happen, it will happen.
Author: Future

Quote: I know I haven't always done things the right way. I'm just trying to reflect on how to make myself better, how to become a better man, a better father, a better person, a better artist.
Author: Future

Quote: You don't question magic.
Author: Future

Quote: Don't ask for a million dollars. Ask for the stuff that'll get you a million dollars - your health, your brain, your sanity, wisdom. Prepare me for when I do get that million. Make sure I don't go crazy, make sure I help my family.
Author: Future

Quote: Every mistake you make allows you to be honest because what's in the dark will come to light, so it's better to be truthful about it.
Author: Future

Quote: I like all types of women. I accept them as they are when they come into my life... But I'm not a romantic. I'm just up-front. I like to be a part of something real, not make-believe. I tell women to tell me the truth, to just lay it out. Let me be the judge and decide if I want you around or not. Let me have my choice.
Author: Future

Quote: If you behind me, I'm not going to look back and try and figure out what you're doing behind me.
Author: Future

Quote: I'll always keep you guessing. I'm living up to the name. It's powerful. That's just what I do.
Author: Future

Quote: I feel like I just wanna go back to being more underground.
Author: Future

Quote: Quality is everything to me, and I perfect everything I do.
Author: Future

Quote: Don't matter if you're rich, poor or whatever, you just want to be able to have your own experiences in life and listen and learn from other people.
Author: Future

Quote: Just wanna have plaques on plaques. That's what we goin' for.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm always a fan of good business moves.
Author: Future

Quote: I just like being versatile, giving new styles and being creative.
Author: Future

Quote: The weirdest place I ever actually woke up in was a villa on the beach in Mexico. It was burning hot, and there were all these crabs walking around me. But I was feeling good, so I went with the vibe.
Author: Future

Quote: When you grow up in something, you don't even know if it's bad or good. You just know that's how it is.
Author: Future

Quote: Rumours are rumours. The Internet is going to report whatever they have to speculate on.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm just not going to settle for anything, you know?
Author: Future

Quote: I don't read blogs. I'm living the life they're writing about. So why read about it?
Author: Future

Quote: I've always been into fashion since I was a kid. I love fashion. I appreciate it. I just enjoy dressing up and getting all the new sneakers and all the hot exclusive clothes - I did even when I was young.
Author: Future

Quote: Everybody can relate to being real or true. Somehow, someway, you want to be real and true.
Author: Future

Quote: I want my money to be different. I'm not trying to have rapper money. My goal is to be able to get everything from the world that I can get.
Author: Future

Quote: Even if it comes off natural, everyone has a fashion sense.
Author: Future

Quote: That's the time that I enjoy: away from the cameras, away from the audience, the scenery of going out to eat and everybody's staring at me.
Author: Future

Quote: When you're a man, you want to make decisions for your family, and sometimes the lady doesn't see what you see.
Author: Future

Quote: I feel a responsibility for telling the truth.
Author: Future

Quote: My daddy didn't even sign my birth certificate. So I ain't never had his last name.
Author: Future

Quote: I never get starstruck.
Author: Future

Quote: People respond to something melodic.
Author: Future

Quote: I've made a lot of mistakes in my life. I wouldn't say musically, though.
Author: Future

Quote: It's hard to get burned out or uninspired, man.
Author: Future

Quote: I want to keep doing what I'm doing and see how far I can go. See when it stops. See what the end is like. I want to make this moment last as long as I can make it. If I miss a day, I'm afraid I'll miss out on a smash record.
Author: Future

Quote: I want to have bosses around me, 'cause at the end of the day, 10 years from now, 20 years from now, you want to make relationships to keep 'em, you know what I'm saying. So I make my relationships to keep 'em - all my relationships - not try to burn bridges that you may need to cross over one day.
Author: Future

Quote: I like to express myself through the clothes that I wear.
Author: Future

Quote: Jay Z wasn't great when 2pac and Biggie was alive.
Author: Future

Quote: All gigs are good gigs. There's never a bad one. Everything have a reason behind it; you just got to find that reason.
Author: Future

Quote: I just want to be an inspiration. I'm a rock star, I'm Future Hendrix.
Author: Future

Quote: You get inspiration from craziest places. It's just about being creative. You gotta step outside that box, you know what I'm saying, to reach the people. You never know who can feel it; who it can connect to.
Author: Future

Quote: I feel like guys, girls, whatever it is, you just come out hoping to make the best record. You just try to have a conversation and just create what you've talked about. Whatever you find to fit the beat at the time, what the person is down for, wherever the beat takes you towards.
Author: Future

Quote: The hardest part of fame and success is adapting to the people around you that's changing. It changes the way people look at you from how they used to look at you. They listen to you on the radio, they look at you on TV and when people speak on you in a good light, you have a couple people who hold grudges.
Author: Future

Quote: I do everything for my family.
Author: Future

Quote: I wanna be one of those special guys. Jimi Hendrix wasn't afraid of who he was. That's the part I emulate.
Author: Future

Quote: My music is like a diary. I use every experience.
Author: Future

Quote: My style is a part of my music. You can't be an artist and not put any thought or effort into the way you appear.
Author: Future

Quote: People think fashion shows take hours - it's 15 minutes. You walk in, do red carpet, take the pictures, you sit down... and then it's over.
Author: Future

Quote: If I'm the biggest artist in the world, cool, but I want to just be me.
Author: Future

Quote: I gotta have my long trench coats, a nice scarf for the winter time when you're walking around, and some nice fitted jeans to go with the trench coats.
Author: Future

Quote: Where I know I wanna go is being consistent on business, and that's just making another artist, my clothing line - capitalizing off the moment. I wanna be consistently doing that - capitalizing off every move I make.
Author: Future

Quote: I have to go places beyond music.
Author: Future

Quote: Rihanna takes risks, and I love a woman who takes risks. It just goes to show you have your own mind and your own way of thinking.
Author: Future

Quote: I've always been into fashion since I was a kid. I love fashion. I appreciate it.
Author: Future

Quote: I don't take anything for granted. I know there are a million and one dudes who are rapping, wishing they were in my shoes.
Author: Future

Quote: I wouldn't say I'm underrated, but more reserved. Only time will tell, but I've been good so far in being consistent and making hit after hit writing for myself and other artists, from rap to R&B, and being able to make those different records.
Author: Future

Quote: It don't matter who I'm working with. I just feel like I want to make the best record possible.
Author: Future

Quote: The melodies I come up with, they're not normal.
Author: Future

Quote: At times, I think, 'What would I rather be doing than music?' That's what you have to ask yourself, if you feel like you need to be somewhere else... But there's nothing else I want to do more than music. That's why I stay in the booth.
Author: Future

Quote: Sometimes it's hard to open up about your personal life, your relationship because you always want the music to be in the forefront. You want the music to be the biggest carrier of everything that you represent.
Author: Future

Quote: It takes an astronaut so long to get to space - that's how long it takes to catch up on my music.
Author: Future

Quote: My kids gotta understand: they gotta make a sacrifice, having a superstar dad.
Author: Future

Quote: My obsession with outer space is my way of being different. I make astronaut music. It takes an astronaut so long to get to space - that's how long it takes to catch up on my music.
Author: Future

Quote: I was drawn to love songs, but I was just drawn to great music - no matter if it's hip-hop, pop, R&B or whether it's rock n' roll or country. It could be a Garth Brooks song, and if it's a smash, then I'll love the different wordplay and different melodies. That's what I'm a fan of - great music.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm not just a hip-hop artist; I feel like I'm a rock star.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm not for the publicity stunts. Leave my son out of the publicity stunts.
Author: Future

Quote: Everybody wanna be a super dad and the best dad ever, but sometimes, I'm just realizing that I'm not perfect.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm always most comfortable in the studio. It's my comfort zone. I love being there, and I love making records.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm an entrepreneur. This is my life. This my career. This the way I eat.
Author: Future

Quote: I need to let people know who I am and instead of just trying to make great records, just be honest and make it more personal and make it more passionate, to make records with emotion and not be afraid to express that.
Author: Future

Quote: I try to look cool. I strategize. Sometimes it's like - that's part of the strategizing, to make it seem like I don't think about it.
Author: Future

Quote: For me, it's always been one of my pet peeves to keep people engaged and talking, and just always being interested in what I have going on. To keep the level of creativity always turned up to the max.
Author: Future

Quote: If you're doing what you think people might like, rather than doing what you like, people will see through it.
Author: Future

Quote: My fashion sense is relatable but stands out because it's my own.
Author: Future

Quote: I don't just write hits for myself, or for other artists, or to just be writing it. I write it because I was born to do this. I was given this gift, and I'm making the most of my opportunity.
Author: Future

Quote: It takes compromise to raise a child, especially with a schedule like mine.
Author: Future

Quote: Future's not everybody. The people who are taking my style are like my babies. I've got a tribe of kids that want to be like me... But I understand why people want to imitate the things I do. They're dope. It comes naturally to me. My fans can expect greatness. If I wasn't me, I would want to be me.
Author: Future

Quote: It's about being creative and drawing on who you are when you wake up, and expressing yourself through fashion.
Author: Future

Quote: Man, I love being a dad. It's super fun.
Author: Future

Quote: Man, I wanna be there for everybody. I wanna make everybody happy, and I can't... That's why I stay in the studio.
Author: Future

Quote: Artists can most definitely control the culture of fashion. Kids and different fans look up to us for dressing pointers.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm most comfortable when I'm in the studio and music playing.
Author: Future

Quote: The most calmest place I can be is the studio. And like, I stay in there 'cause I know, when I come out, it's back to reality. Man, if you're angry all day, man, stay in the studio.
Author: Future

Quote: You got to make the most of your second life. I was born Nayvadius, but now I'm Future. Should I dwell on what Nayvadius was supposed to be? I get a chance to experience life as something else. I wasn't supposed to be like this.
Author: Future

Quote: 'I Won' is not a love song. It's just me uplifting women in general. I'm giving women the power to treat themselves as a trophy - to show that and know it in yourself and be confident - because when they do that, whoever they're with is winning.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm not trying to feed off of a concept that another artist had - that's not what I do.
Author: Future

Quote: I take a little bit from everybody and add that to my life to make me, me. I wanna be nobody else but Future. When you look at me, I want you to say, 'Future.' The way I talk, the way I dress, there's nobody in the world but me.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm putting everything on the line in being able to express myself in a different way than rappers normally do. They might say, 'It's rap' or 'It's R&B,' but I'm stepping outside the box and making music for me and making music for the fans to understand me. I'm going the extra distance to be able to come across different.
Author: Future

Quote: Big Rube was on my first album and some of my mixtapes. His words are so powerful. I want to speak every word he says into existence. I wanna be a part of that! I wanna be a part of greatness. His wordplay is great to me.
Author: Future

Quote: Jupiter, Pluto, pick a planet: we can go there. I just got a bit more work to do in the music industry, and we're going to space, baby.
Author: Future

Quote: That's that Dungeon Family ethos: being able to reinvent yourself, stand out and stand alone. Having your own character and having your own image, no matter what they say about you. I want to show my versatility and how diverse I am, how I approach the track, my rhythm, my melodies. It's something different.
Author: Future

Quote: I love 'Troy.' I love Brad Pitt's character - when he went to Troy, he just ran over it. Then this particular scene where they made this big old horse or something out of wood, and they hid inside the wood.
Author: Future

Quote: I have a crazy work ethic. I'll do 20 songs a day. I love music that much.
Author: Future

Quote: When I first used Auto-Tune, I never used it to sing. I wasn't using it the way T-Pain was. I used it to rap because it makes my voice sound grittier.
Author: Future

Quote: I feel like I'm doing something in Atlanta that nobody ever did as far as rap. If it happens to end up on the top 40 or the pop charts, it doesn't mean I meant to go pop. It's just where the music took me. It started at the bottom, and it rises.
Author: Future

Quote: At first, Hendrix went and became a superstar in London, but if he walked past the Apollo in Harlem, no one would know who he was. I'm the hip-hop version of him.
Author: Future

Quote: I was shy talking about certain things, and I was shy with being honest because I didn't want people to judge me talking about fatherhood and how somebody should have my child around me.
Author: Future

Quote: I want to judge the nannies that's around my child. I don't want to pay for a nanny that I never met, that I never got a chance to interview. That's not the life I want for my child. I want to be involved 100 percent in all decisions made. This my flesh and blood.
Author: Future

Quote: My kids need to be around me. And the times that I'm out of town, if I'm not too busy, they can come to me.
Author: Future

Quote: I want to show my versatility and how diverse I am, how I approach the track, my rhythm, my melodies. It's something different. Sometimes, the things I do haven't ever been done.
Author: Future

Quote: My favorite designer has to be Louis Vuitton.
Author: Future

Quote: I don't even talk about being locked up in any of my songs.
Author: Future

Quote: I feel like guitar explains a lot. You can just listen to a guitar without any lyrics over it; you can just feel what kind of track it is. If it's pain... you can feel it. It sets the mood.
Author: Future

Quote: I wanna make my imprint in the game as far as music - hip-hop, and just music, period. 'Cause I come from hip-hop, that's my background, but I'm not gonna let that limit me from where I can go.
Author: Future

Quote: G-Rock from the Westside, from Allen Temple. He gave my name, The Future; he was like, 'Man, you the future.' Just stuck with the name.
Author: Future

Quote: I know melody. I know rhythm; I know bass guitar; I know the piano. I know everything about music that helps build the music that go along with creating the whole art form, you know what I'm saying?
Author: Future

Quote: You make music to change the radio, not make music for the radio.
Author: Future

Quote: I can't leave home without certain movies. 'The Godfather' is a big one for me. And I've gotta have my beats so I can write new music.
Author: Future

Quote: In Atlanta, there's no limitation to where you can take your music. You can be as creative as you want to be.
Author: Future

Quote: My day one fans - my fans from my mix tape days - know my life now. They know where I've been. You don't want to have a disconnection with those fans. You have to give them all of you because they feel like they've known you.
Author: Future

Quote: When you're riding with your mom, and you're a kid, you'd listen to 'Dear Mama' and the radio friendly records. I used to sneak and listen to Too $hort.
Author: Future

Quote: I was probably 15 when I started going to the studio with the older cats in my neighborhood. They heard me rap outside one time; I was just freestyling. And they invited me to the studio. It's good when you're accepted, no matter what crowd. That's the first step of believing you can do whatever you feel like putting your mind to.
Author: Future

Quote: I want to let little kids know that no matter what situation they come up in, that they're not exempt from success. All I ever wanted was for people to believe in me and just recognize my potential. I came, I struggled, I made it, I conquered.
Author: Future

Quote: The most fun moments are being on the stage and seeing how the crowd reacts to your music. The energy of the crowd that makes you just want to go in and keep doing it and be a part of this forever.
Author: Future

Quote: My three wishes are just be respected out the game. I want respect from everybody. And just make a successful clothing line and company. I'm not going to put a number on it. Just to have a great career.
Author: Future

Quote: My favorite rappers are, I can't really say. I like Kanye because he's so creative. He'll just do anything. I like what Kanye's bringing to the game. Lil Wayne. I like Wayne.
Author: Future

Quote: For just being a black artist in rock n' roll and be able to step outside and create, and make great music. And just be different. Just a different breed. And that's what I love about Jimi Hendrix's music - the way he plays the guitar is so different. He's just an icon all around.
Author: Future

Quote: If I told a lie, then I got to come back and correct it years later. I hate that I have to be the person that touch on their life and be personal and be direct with certain situations, but man, I'm glad that it's me than them.
Author: Future

Quote: Just understand that the type of music that I make is something special.
Author: Future

Quote: You know that I can make hits. You know I can do all these rap records.
Author: Future

Quote: All I know is record, record, record, record.
Author: Future

Quote: I'm the top rapper in the world.
Author: Future

Quote: My sister wants a Rollie. When I buy one now, I gotta buy like five, ten. It's crazy.
Author: Future

Quote: Jimi Hendrix, he was a rock star. But he played guitar; I don't. I've just found ways to use words to make my mark in this history book.
Author: Future

Quote: I want to be the most melodic artist. 'His music ability, the way he write, his creativity is undeniable.' I want people to say that about me.
Author: Future

Quote: I want people to say, 'He evolved throughout his whole career.' I wanna be able to have the most number one records ever. The most Top 10 records ever.
Author: Future

Quote: Every day, I bring out something new. You got to be prepared - you got to have a few outfits laying out for when you wake up, in case you want to change, to set the mood.
Author: Future

Quote: I want to give the music attention and be in the studio. I want to give all my attention to my music, my kids, my family, so I just wanna focus on certain things besides social media.
Author: Future

Quote: I just enjoy dressing up and getting all the new sneakers and all the hot exclusive clothes - I did even when I was young.
Author: Future

Quote: You have to just do music, and you're becoming this entertainer, and so many people require so much of your time for different things, different obligations you have to make money, or just different obligations you have as a person in whatever the situation may be.
Author: Future

Quote: My career choice is my career choice. Just stepping out of that zone, to be able to be a provider. I understand my position as a provider and my role as a dad also... Just being able to be comfortable with it.
Author: Future

Quote: When I'm in the studio, I stay in the studio, like, sometimes 20 hours out the day.
Author: Future

Quote: I want that longevity in the career, so if you don't know how to get it, you trying to chase that high, you trying to continue to chase your dreams and conquer things you never thought you could get. And you just want to get there too soon, so you taking the wrong moves to try and compensate what's not happening.
Author: Future

Quote: The music I make, I'm different.
Author: Future

Quote: When you mix a record that someone else is on, you've got to send it to them. They've got to like the mix, you got to like the mix, the producer's got to like the mix. Too many people are involved!
Author: Future

Quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I learned long ago, never to wrestle with a pig. You get dirty, and besides, the pig likes it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is no sincerer love than the love of food.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You see things; and you say 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?'
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Democracy is a device that ensures we shall be governed no better than we deserve.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Youth is wasted on the young.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Take care to get what you like or you will be forced to like what you get.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If all the economists were laid end to end, they'd never reach a conclusion.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Silence is the most perfect expression of scorn.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The best place to find God is in a garden. You can dig for him there.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The great advantage of a hotel is that it is a refuge from home life.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A gentleman is one who puts more into the world than he takes out.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The power of accurate observation is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The secret to success is to offend the greatest number of people.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Alcohol is the anesthesia by which we endure the operation of life.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The worst sin toward our fellow creatures is not to hate them, but to be indifferent to them: that's the essence of inhumanity.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: No man ever believes that the Bible means what it says: He is always convinced that it says what he means.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Marriage is an alliance entered into by a man who can't sleep with the window shut, and a woman who can't sleep with the window open.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: All great truths begin as blasphemies.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If history repeats itself, and the unexpected always happens, how incapable must Man be of learning from experience.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness, but it is greatness.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The liar's punishment is not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Youth is a wonderful thing. What a crime to waste it on children.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The people who get on in this world are the people who get up and look for the circumstances they want and if they can't find them, make them.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It is the mark of a truly intelligent person to be moved by statistics.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We should all be obliged to appear before a board every five years and justify our existence... on pain of liquidation.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is nothing more dangerous than the conscience of a bigot.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Democracy substitutes election by the incompetent many for appointment by the corrupt few.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Kings are not born: they are made by artificial hallucination.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The possibilities are numerous once we decide to act and not react.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport; when a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everybody else.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Clever and attractive women do not want to vote; they are willing to let men govern as long as they govern men.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It is dangerous to be sincere unless you are also stupid.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is only one religion, though there are a hundred versions of it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Lack of money is the root of all evil.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I enjoy convalescence. It is the part that makes the illness worth while.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The moment we want to believe something, we suddenly see all the arguments for it, and become blind to the arguments against it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If you're not producing as much as you consume, or perhaps a little more, then clearly we cannot use the big organization of our society for the purpose of keeping you alive, because your life does not benefit us, and it can't be of very much use to yourself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You cannot be a hero without being a coward.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We learn from experience that men never learn anything from experience.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Independence? That's middle class blasphemy. We are all dependent on one another, every soul of us on earth.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: When a man says money can do anything, that settles it: he hasn't got any.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Life contains but two tragedies. One is not to get your heart's desire; the other is to get it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Property is organized robbery.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Every man over forty is a scoundrel.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The perfect love affair is one which is conducted entirely by post.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Use your health, even to the point of wearing it out. That is what it is for. Spend all you have before you die; do not outlive yourself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Old men are dangerous: it doesn't matter to them what is going to happen to the world.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: He knows nothing and thinks he knows everything. That points clearly to a political career.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I'm an atheist and I thank God for it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: When I was young, I observed that nine out of ten things I did were failures. So I did ten times more work.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: An election is a moral horror, as bad as a battle except for the blood; a mud bath for every soul concerned in it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: In socialism, private property is anathema, and equal distribution of income the first consideration. In capitalism, private property is cardinal, and distribution left to ensue from the play of free contract and selfish interest on that basis, no matter what anomalies it may present.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Few people think more than two or three times a year; I have made an international reputation for myself by thinking once or twice a week.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There are no secrets better kept than the secrets everybody guesses.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Power does not corrupt men; fools, however, if they get into a position of power, corrupt power.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The only service a friend can really render is to keep up your courage by holding up to you a mirror in which you can see a noble image of yourself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The only secrets are the secrets that keep themselves.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It is a curious sensation: the sort of pain that goes mercifully beyond our powers of feeling. When your heart is broken, your boats are burned: nothing matters any more. It is the end of happiness and the beginning of peace.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I never resist temptation, because I have found that things that are bad for me do not tempt me.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Peace is not only better than war, but infinitely more arduous.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I dislike feeling at home when I am abroad.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Capitalism has destroyed our belief in any effective power but that of self interest backed by force.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You can always tell an old soldier by the inside of his holsters and cartridge boxes. The young ones carry pistols and cartridges; the old ones, grub.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Virtue is insufficient temptation.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: In heaven an angel is nobody in particular.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If I own a large part of Scotland, I can turn the people off the land practically into the sea or across the sea. I can take women in child-bearing and throw them into the snow and leave them there. That has been done. I can do it for no better reason than I think it is better to shoot deer on the land than allow people to live on it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Socialism is the same as Communism, only better English.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Human beings are the only animals of which I am thoroughly and cravenly afraid.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I often quote myself. It adds spice to my conversation.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Assassination is the extreme form of censorship.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Do not waste your time on Social Questions. What is the matter with the poor is Poverty; what is the matter with the rich is Uselessness.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The man with a toothache thinks everyone happy whose teeth are sound. The poverty-stricken man makes the same mistake about the rich man.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The test of a man or woman's breeding is how they behave in a quarrel.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I am a Christian. That obliges me to be a Communist.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The golden rule is that there are no golden rules.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The love of economy is the root of all virtue.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The first condition of progress is the removal of censorship.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: England and America are two countries separated by the same language.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Life levels all men. Death reveals the eminent.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Man can climb to the highest summits, but he cannot dwell there long.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Dancing is a perpendicular expression of a horizontal desire.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Do not do unto others as you expect they should do unto you. Their tastes may not be the same.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Give a man health and a course to steer, and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: No question is so difficult to answer as that to which the answer is obvious.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If women were particular about men's characters, they would never get married at all.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Everything happens to everybody sooner or later if there is time enough.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The fact that a believer is happier than a skeptic is no more to the point than the fact that a drunken man is happier than a sober one.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We are all dependent on one another, every soul of us on earth.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Syllables govern the world.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The secret of being miserable is to have leisure to bother about whether you are happy or not. The cure for it is occupation.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The minority is sometimes right; the majority always wrong.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Do not try to live forever. You will not succeed.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Reading made Don Quixote a gentleman, but believing what he read made him mad.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The only way to avoid being miserable is not to have enough leisure to wonder whether you are happy or not.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I have to live for others and not for myself: that's middle-class morality.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It is most unwise for people in love to marry.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Find enough clever things to say, and you're a Prime Minister; write them down and you're a Shakespeare.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: What we want is to see the child in pursuit of knowledge, and not knowledge in pursuit of the child.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: People become attached to their burdens sometimes more than the burdens are attached to them.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I would like to take you seriously, but to do so would be an affront to your intelligence.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: In this world there is always danger for those who are afraid of it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Most people do not pray; they only beg.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Statistics show that of those who contract the habit of eating, very few survive.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The fickleness of the women I love is only equalled by the infernal constancy of the women who love me.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I want to destroy ownership in order that possession and enjoyment may be raised to the highest point in every section of the community.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Perhaps the greatest social service that can be rendered by anybody to the country and to mankind is to bring up a family.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Miracles, in the sense of phenomena we cannot explain, surround us on every hand: life itself is the miracle of miracles.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Baseball has the great advantage over cricket of being sooner ended.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Better never than late.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The trouble with her is that she lacks the power of conversation but not the power of speech.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Very few people can afford to be poor.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Marriage is popular because it combines the maximum of temptation with the maximum of opportunity.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A perpetual holiday is a good working definition of hell.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Nothing is ever done in this world until men are prepared to kill one another if it is not done.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Except during the nine months before he draws his first breath, no man manages his affairs as well as a tree does.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Hegel was right when he said that we learn from history that man can never learn anything from history.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I am afraid we must make the world honest before we can honestly say to our children that honesty is the best policy.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Men are wise in proportion, not to their experience, but to their capacity for experience.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Home life is no more natural to us than a cage is natural to a cockatoo.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: One man that has a mind and knows it can always beat ten men who haven't and don't.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I never thought much of the courage of a lion tamer. Inside the cage he is at least safe from people.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is no satisfaction in hanging a man who does not object to it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Self-sacrifice enables us to sacrifice other people without blushing.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You have learnt something. That always feels at first as if you had lost something.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You'll never have a quiet world till you knock the patriotism out of the human race.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Beware of the man who does not return your blow: he neither forgives you nor allows you to forgive yourself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The British soldier can stand up to anything except the British War Office.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If you injure your neighbour, better not do it by halves.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: My reputation grows with every failure.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Beauty is all very well at first sight; but who ever looks at it when it has been in the house three days?
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If there was nothing wrong in the world there wouldn't be anything for us to do.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: All genuinely intellectual work is humorous.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: While we ourselves are the living graves of murdered animals, how can we expect any ideal living conditions on this earth?
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: No man who is occupied in doing a very difficult thing, and doing it very well, ever loses his self-respect.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The things most people want to know about are usually none of their business.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Never fret for an only son, the idea of failure will never occur to him.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Animals are my friends... and I don't eat my friends.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The only fundamental and possible socialism is the socialisation of the selective breeding of man.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: She had lost the art of conversation but not, unfortunately, the power of speech.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: All my life affection has been showered upon me, and every forward step I have made has been taken in spite of it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It's easier to replace a dead man than a good picture.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I want to be all used up when I die.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Only on paper has humanity yet achieved glory, beauty, truth, knowledge, virtue, and abiding love.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The Old Testament God is a person with body parts and passions. The Church of England God has neither body, parts nor passions, and is therefore not a person.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A man who has no office to go, to I don't care who he is, is a trial of which you can have no conception.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Life would be tolerable but for its amusements.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: My method of getting a play across the footlights is like a revolver shooting: every line has a bullet in it and comes with an explosion.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I have a strong feeling that I shall be glad when I am dead and done for - scrapped at last to make room for somebody better, cleverer, more perfect than myself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I want to be thoroughly used up when I die, for the harder I work the more I live. I rejoice in life for its own sake.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If you leave the smallest corner of your head vacant for a moment, other people's opinions will rush in from all quarters.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The faults of the burglar are the qualities of the financier.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Choose silence of all virtues, for by it you hear other men's imperfections, and conceal your own.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The heretic is always better dead. And mortal eyes cannot distinguish the saint from the heretic.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: An asylum for the sane would be empty in America.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Martyrdom: The only way a man can become famous without ability.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You are going to let the fear of poverty govern you life and your reward will be that you will eat, but you will not live.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and about all time.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Men have to do some awfully mean things to keep up their respectability.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Until the men of action clear out the talkers we who have social consciences are at the mercy of those who have none.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The art of government is the organisation of idolatry.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Few of us have vitality enough to make any of our instincts imperious.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: What Englishman will give his mind to politics as long as he can afford to keep a motor car?
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Censorship ends in logical completeness when nobody is allowed to read any books except the books that nobody reads.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If a woman can, by careful selection of a father and nourishment of herself, produce a citizen with efficient senses, sound organs and a good digestion, she should clearly be secured a sufficient reward for that natural service to make her willing to undertake and repeat it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Nothing is worth doing unless the consequences may be serious.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Virtue consists, not in abstaining from vice, but in not desiring it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A fashion is nothing but an induced epidemic.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Those who do not know how to live must make a merit of dying.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Creation is a miracle of daily recurrence. 'A miracle a minute' would not be a bad slogan for God.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Socialism, reduced to its simplest legal and practical expression, means the complete discarding of the institution of private property by transforming it into public property, and the division of the resultant public income equally and indiscriminately among the entire population.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Caesar was a man of great common sense and good taste, meaning thereby a man without originality or moral courage.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Every person who has mastered a profession is a skeptic concerning it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: In a battle all you need to make you fight is a little hot blood and the knowledge that it's more dangerous to lose than to win.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: An Englishman thinks he is moral when he is only uncomfortable.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A veteran journalist has never had time to think twice before he writes.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It's so hard to know what to do when one wishes earnestly to do right.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A broken heart is a very pleasant complaint for a man in London if he has a comfortable income.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A man never tells you anything until you contradict him.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If I were a woman, I'd simply refuse to speak to any man or do anything for men until I'd got the vote.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We are the only real aristocracy in the world: the aristocracy of money.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing, but we must take that risk because a little is as much as our biggest heads can hold.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Americans adore me and will go on adoring me until I say something nice about them.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The frontier between hell and heaven is only the difference between two ways of looking at things.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Parentage is a very important profession, but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Which painting in the National Gallery would I save if there was a fire? The one nearest the door of course.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If you must hold yourself up to your children as an object lesson, hold yourself up as a warning and not as an example.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: General consultant to mankind.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The truth is, hardly any of us have ethical energy enough for more than one really inflexible point of honor.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The natural term of the affection of the human animal for its offspring is six years.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: What a man believes may be ascertained, not from his creed, but from the assumptions on which he habitually acts.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: An index is a great leveller.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: What is virtue but the Trade Unionism of the married?
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is no subject on which more dangerous nonsense is talked and thought than marriage.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The idea of personal salvation is intensely repugnant to me when it is not absurd. Imagine Roosevelt, the big brute, preserving his personality in a future state and swaggering about as a celestial Rough Rider!
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Marriage is good enough for the lower classes: they have facilities for desertion that are denied to us.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Political necessities sometime turn out to be political mistakes.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Why, except as a means of livelihood, a man should desire to act on the stage when he has the whole world to act in, is not clear to me.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We must always think about things, and we must think about things as they are, not as they are said to be.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Cruelty would be delicious if one could only find some sort of cruelty that didn't really hurt.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: What is the use of writing plays, what is the use of writing anything, if there is not a will which finally moulds chaos itself into a race of gods.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Socialism never arises in the earlier phases of capitalism, as, for instance, among the pioneers of civilisation in a country where there is plenty of land available for private appropriation by the last comer.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A statesman who confines himself to popular legislation - or, for the matter of that, a playwright who confines himself to popular plays - is like a blind man's dog who goes wherever the blind man pulls him, on the ground that both of them want to go to the same place.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Death is caused by swallowing small amounts of saliva over a long period of time.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Weather forecast for tonight: dark.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The other night I ate at a real nice family restaurant. Every table had an argument going.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Inside every cynical person, there is a disappointed idealist.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Don't sweat the petty things and don't pet the sweaty things.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Just cause you got the monkey off your back doesn't mean the circus has left town.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: When you're born you get a ticket to the freak show. When you're born in America, you get a front row seat.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Most people work just hard enough not to get fired and get paid just enough money not to quit.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Well, if crime fighters fight crime and fire fighters fight fire, what do freedom fighters fight? They never mention that part to us, do they?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I'm completely in favor of the separation of Church and State. My idea is that these two institutions screw us up enough on their own, so both of them together is certain death.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: One tequila, two tequila, three tequila, floor.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Frisbeetarianism is the belief that when you die, your soul goes up on the roof and gets stuck.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Religion is just mind control.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: By and large, language is a tool for concealing the truth.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The very existence of flame-throwers proves that some time, somewhere, someone said to themselves, You know, I want to set those people over there on fire, but I'm just not close enough to get the job done.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Atheism is a non-prophet organization.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Some people see things that are and ask, Why? Some people dream of things that never were and ask, Why not? Some people have to go to work and don't have time for all that.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Electricity is really just organized lightning.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The reason I talk to myself is that I'm the only one whose answers I accept.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: 'I am' is reportedly the shortest sentence in the English language. Could it be that 'I do' is the longest sentence?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: If it's true that our species is alone in the universe, then I'd have to say the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I was thinking about how people seem to read the Bible a whole lot more as they get older; then it dawned on me - they're cramming for their final exam.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: There's no present. There's only the immediate future and the recent past.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: If you can't beat them, arrange to have them beaten.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Not only do I not know what's going on, I wouldn't know what to do about it if I did.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: What does it mean to pre-board? Do you get on before you get on?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: People who say they don't care what people think are usually desperate to have people think they don't care what people think.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I went to a bookstore and asked the saleswoman, 'Where's the self-help section?' She said if she told me, it would defeat the purpose.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I would never want to be a member of a group whose symbol was a guy nailed to two pieces of wood.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Dusting is a good example of the futility of trying to put things right. As soon as you dust, the fact of your next dusting has already been established.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I'm always relieved when someone is delivering a eulogy and I realize I'm listening to it.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Always do whatever's next.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: In comic strips, the person on the left always speaks first.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: You know the good part about all those executions in Texas? Fewer Texans.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: At a formal dinner party, the person nearest death should always be seated closest to the bathroom.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I'm not concerned about all hell breaking loose, but that a PART of hell will break loose... it'll be much harder to detect.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: When Thomas Edison worked late into the night on the electric light, he had to do it by gas lamp or candle. I'm sure it made the work seem that much more urgent.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: When someone is impatient and says, 'I haven't got all day,' I always wonder, How can that be? How can you not have all day?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I think it would be interesting if old people got anti-Alzheimer's disease where they slowly began to recover other people's lost memories.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I think people should be allowed to do anything they want. We haven't tried that for a while. Maybe this time it'll work.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: You know an odd feeling? Sitting on the toilet eating a chocolate candy bar.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I recently went to a new doctor and noticed he was located in something called the Professional Building. I felt better right away.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: One can never know for sure what a deserted area looks like.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I have as much authority as the Pope, I just don't have as many people who believe it.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The status quo sucks.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Think off-center.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: If we could just find out who's in charge, we could kill him.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: When you step on the brakes your life is in your foot's hands.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Standing ovations have become far too commonplace. What we need are ovations where the audience members all punch and kick one another.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The very concept of objective truth is fading out of the world. Lies will pass into history.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: If you want a vision of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face - forever.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Oceania was at war with Eurasia; therefore Oceania had always been at war with Eurasia.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Those who 'abjure' violence can do so only because others are committing violence on their behalf.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Political language... is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: We sleep safe in our beds because rough men stand ready in the night to visit violence on those who would do us harm.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: All the war-propaganda, all the screaming and lies and hatred, comes invariably from people who are not fighting.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Sometimes the first duty of intelligent men is the restatement of the obvious.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Each generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: So much of left-wing thought is a kind of playing with fire by people who don't even know that fire is hot.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Power is not a means, it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: If liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: In our age there is no such thing as 'keeping out of politics.' All issues are political issues, and politics itself is a mass of lies, evasions, folly, hatred and schizophrenia.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: I'm fat, but I'm thin inside... there's a thin man inside every fat man.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: As with the Christian religion, the worst advertisement for Socialism is its adherents.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: There are some ideas so wrong that only a very intelligent person could believe in them.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The nationalist not only does not disapprove of atrocities committed by his own side, but he has a remarkable capacity for not even hearing about them.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: What can you do against the lunatic who is more intelligent than yourself, who gives your arguments a fair hearing and then simply persists in his lunacy?
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: War is war. The only good human being is a dead one.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns, as it were, instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish squirting out ink.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Patriotism is usually stronger than class hatred, and always stronger than internationalism.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The quickest way of ending a war is to lose it.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Men are only as good as their technical development allows them to be.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: We may find in the long run that tinned food is a deadlier weapon than the machine-gun.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Mankind is not likely to salvage civilization unless he can evolve a system of good and evil which is independent of heaven and hell.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: No advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimeter nearer.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Language ought to be the joint creation of poets and manual workers.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four. If that is granted, all else follows.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Man is the only creature that consumes without producing. He does not give milk, he does not lay eggs, he is too weak to pull the plough, he cannot run fast enough to catch rabbits. Yet he is lord of all the animals.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: War against a foreign country only happens when the moneyed classes think they are going to profit from it.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes a revolution in order to establish a dictatorship.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Progress is not an illusion, it happens, but it is slow and invariably disappointing.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The Catholic and the Communist are alike in assuming that an opponent cannot be both honest and intelligent.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Every war when it comes, or before it comes, is represented not as a war but as an act of self-defense against a homicidal maniac.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: All political thinking for years past has been vitiated in the same way. People can foresee the future only when it coincides with their own wishes, and the most grossly obvious facts can be ignored when they are unwelcome.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: We have now sunk to a depth at which restatement of the obvious is the first duty of intelligent men.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: In our time political speech and writing are largely the defense of the indefensible.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: A family with the wrong members in control; that, perhaps, is as near as one can come to describing England in a phrase.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: On the whole, human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Nationalism is power hunger tempered by self-deception.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Advertising is the rattling of a stick inside a swill bucket.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Good writing is like a windowpane.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: To survive it is often necessary to fight and to fight you have to dirty yourself.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Myths which are believed in tend to become true.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Most people get a fair amount of fun out of their lives, but on balance life is suffering, and only the very young or the very foolish imagine otherwise.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: At fifty everyone has the face he deserves.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Political chaos is connected with the decay of language... one can probably bring about some improvement by starting at the verbal end.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Whoever is winning at the moment will always seem to be invincible.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: But if thought corrupts language, language can also corrupt thought.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Doublethink means the power of holding two contradictory beliefs in one's mind simultaneously, and accepting both of them.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Men can only be happy when they do not assume that the object of life is happiness.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: To walk through the ruined cities of Germany is to feel an actual doubt about the continuity of civilization.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: To an ordinary human being, love means nothing if it does not mean loving some people more than others.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: A tragic situation exists precisely when virtue does not triumph but when it is still felt that man is nobler than the forces which destroy him.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: One cannot really be a Catholic and grown up.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Probably the battle of Waterloo was won on the playing-fields of Eton, but the opening battles of all subsequent wars have been lost there.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Liberal: a power worshipper without power.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: We of the sinking middle class may sink without further struggles into the working class where we belong, and probably when we get there it will not be so dreadful as we feared, for, after all, we have nothing to lose.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The intellectual is different from the ordinary man, but only in certain sections of his personality, and even then not all the time.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: I doubt whether classical education ever has been or can be successfully carried out without corporal punishment.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Early in life I had noticed that no event is ever correctly reported in a newspaper.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Whatever is funny is subversive, every joke is ultimately a custard pie... a dirty joke is a sort of mental rebellion.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: War is evil, but it is often the lesser evil.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: He was an embittered atheist, the sort of atheist who does not so much disbelieve in God as personally dislike Him.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The aim of a joke is not to degrade the human being, but to remind him that he is already degraded.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: As I write, highly civilized human beings are flying overhead, trying to kill me.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: It is almost universally felt that when we call a country democratic we are praising it; consequently, the defenders of every kind of regime claim that it is a democracy, and fear that they might have to stop using the word if it were tied down to any one meaning.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: I sometimes think that the price of liberty is not so much eternal vigilance as eternal dirt.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: When it comes to the pinch, human beings are heroic.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: It is also true that one can write nothing readable unless one constantly struggles to efface one's own personality. Good prose is like a windowpane.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Many people genuinely do not want to be saints, and it is probable that some who achieve or aspire to sainthood have never felt much temptation to be human beings.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Enlightened people seldom or never possess a sense of responsibility.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Society has always to demand a little more from human beings than it will get in practice.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Serious sport is war minus the shooting.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: No one can look back on his schooldays and say with truth that they were altogether unhappy.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: War is a way of shattering to pieces... materials which might otherwise be used to make the masses too comfortable and... too intelligent.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Dickens is one of those authors who are well worth stealing.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Saints should always be judged guilty until they are proved innocent.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Big Brother is watching you.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: One can love a child, perhaps, more deeply than one can love another adult, but it is rash to assume that the child feels any love in return.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Part of the reason for the ugliness of adults, in a child's eyes, is that the child is usually looking upwards, and few faces are at their best when seen from below.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Not to expose your true feelings to an adult seems to be instinctive from the age of seven or eight onwards.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: A dirty joke is a sort of mental rebellion.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Four legs good, two legs bad.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The atom bombs are piling up in the factories, the police are prowling through the cities, the lies are streaming from the loudspeakers, but the earth is still going round the sun.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The atmosphere of orthodoxy is always damaging to prose, and above all it is completely ruinous to the novel, the most anarchical of all forms of literature.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Joyce is a poet and also an elephantine pedant.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The essential act of war is destruction, not necessarily of human lives, but of the products of human labor.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: There is hardly such a thing as a war in which it makes no difference who wins. Nearly always one side stands more or less for progress, the other side more or less for reaction.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Prolonged, indiscriminate reviewing of books is a quite exceptionally thankless, irritating and exhausting job. It not only involves praising trash but constantly inventing reactions towards books about which one has no spontaneous feeling whatever.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: For a creative writer possession of the 'truth' is less important than emotional sincerity.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: If you have embraced a creed which appears to be free from the ordinary dirtiness of politics - a creed from which you yourself cannot expect to draw any material advantage - surely that proves that you are in the right?
Author: George Orwell

Quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
Author: George S. Patton

Quote: The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other bastard die for his.
Author: George S. Patton

Quote: If everyone is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.
Author: George S. Patton

Quote: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.
