Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Modesty forbids what the law does not.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Whatever fortune has raised to a height, she has raised only to cast it down.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: A great mind becomes a great fortune.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Great grief does not of itself put an end to itself.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: The approach of liberty makes even an old man brave.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Night brings our troubles to the light, rather than banishes them.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: The mind unlearns with difficulty what it has long learned.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Wisdom allows nothing to be good that will not be so forever; no man to be happy but he that needs no other happiness than what he has within himself; no man to be great or powerful that is not master of himself.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: It makes a great deal of difference whether one wills not to sin or has not the knowledge to sin.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Slavery takes hold of few, but many take hold of slavery.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Do everything as in the eye of another.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: What is true belongs to me!
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: In war, when a commander becomes so bereft of reason and perspective that he fails to understand the dependence of arms on Divine guidance, he no longer deserves victory.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: There is none made so great, but he may both need the help and service, and stand in fear of the power and unkindness, even of the meanest of mortals.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Our care should not be to have lived long as to have lived enough.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: God is the universal substance in existing things. He comprises all things. He is the fountain of all being. In Him exists everything that is.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: We can be thankful to a friend for a few acres, or a little money; and yet for the freedom and command of the whole earth, and for the great benefits of our being, our life, health, and reason, we look upon ourselves as under no obligation.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: The first and greatest punishment of the sinner is the conscience of sin.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: A quarrel is quickly settled when deserted by one party; there is no battle unless there be two.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Wisdom does not show itself so much in precept as in life - in firmness of mind and a mastery of appetite. It teaches us to do as well as to talk; and to make our words and actions all of a color.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: The heart is great which shows moderation in the midst of prosperity.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: That which is given with pride and ostentation is rather an ambition than a bounty.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Call it Nature, Fate, Fortune; all these are names of the one and selfsame God.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Do not ask for what you will wish you had not got.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Precepts or maxims are of great weight; and a few useful ones on hand do more to produce a happy life than the volumes we can't find.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Success consecrates the most offensive crimes.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: To be able to endure odium is the first art to be learned by those who aspire to power.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: He who dreads hostility too much is unfit to rule.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: The first step in a person's salvation is knowledge of their sin.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Every sin is the result of a collaboration.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: It is the superfluous things for which men sweat, - superfluous things that wear our togas theadbare, that force us to grow old in camp, that dash us upon foreign shores.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: May be is very well, but Must is the master. It is my duty to show justice without recompense.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Believe me, that was a happy age, before the days of architects, before the days of builders.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: When we are well, we all have good advice for those who are ill.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: That is never too often repeated, which is never sufficiently learned.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: If you would judge, understand.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: True praise comes often even to the lowly; false praise only to the strong.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Whatever one of us blames in another, each one will find in his own heart.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: A well governed appetite is the greater part of liberty.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Crime when it succeeds is called virtue.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Consider, when you are enraged at any one, what you would probably think if he should die during the dispute.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: It is the sign of a great mind to dislike greatness, and to prefer things in measure to things in excess.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: One crime has to be concealed by another.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Nothing is void of God, his work is everywhere his full of himself.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Why do I not seek some real good; one which I could feel, not one which I could display?
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: When an author is too meticulous about his style, you may presume that his mind is frivolous and his content flimsy.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Light troubles speak; the weighty are struck dumb.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
Author: Mae West

Quote: When I'm good, I'm very good. But when I'm bad I'm better.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Sex is emotion in motion.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Keep a diary, and someday it'll keep you.
Author: Mae West

Quote: When choosing between two evils, I always like to try the one I've never tried before.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Save a boyfriend for a rainy day - and another, in case it doesn't rain.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I used to be Snow White, but I drifted.
Author: Mae West

Quote: It's not the men in my life that count, it's the life in my men.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.
Author: Mae West

Quote: A hard man is good to find.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Cultivate your curves - they may be dangerous but they won't be avoided.
Author: Mae West

Quote: To err is human, but it feels divine.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Too much of a good thing can be wonderful.
Author: Mae West

Quote: If I asked for a cup of coffee, someone would search for the double meaning.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Marriage is a great institution, but I'm not ready for an institution.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Love conquers all things except poverty and toothache.
Author: Mae West

Quote: A man's kiss is his signature.
Author: Mae West

Quote: A man in the house is worth two in the street.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I believe that it's better to be looked over than it is to be overlooked.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I'm no model lady. A model's just an imitation of the real thing.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Look your best - who said love is blind?
Author: Mae West

Quote: I never worry about diets. The only carrots that interest me are the number you get in a diamond.
Author: Mae West

Quote: An ounce of performance is worth pounds of promises.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Anything worth doing is worth doing slowly.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I never loved another person the way I loved myself.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Ten men waiting for me at the door? Send one of them home, I'm tired.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Whenever I'm caught between two evils, I take the one I've never tried.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often.
Author: Mae West

Quote: He who hesitates is a damned fool.
Author: Mae West

Quote: One and one is two, and two and two is four, and five will get you ten if you know how to work it.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Love thy neighbor - and if he happens to be tall, debonair and devastating, it will be that much easier.
Author: Mae West

Quote: His mother should have thrown him out and kept the stork.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I didn't discover curves; I only uncovered them.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Any time you got nothing to do - and lots of time to do it - come on up.
Author: Mae West

Quote: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I'm a woman of very few words, but lots of action.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Personality is the glitter that sends your little gleam across the footlights and the orchestra pit into that big black space where the audience is.
Author: Mae West

Quote: A dame that knows the ropes isn't likely to get tied up.
Author: Mae West

Quote: A woman in love can't be reasonable - or she probably wouldn't be in love.
Author: Mae West

Quote: It isn't what I do, but how I do it. It isn't what I say, but how I say it, and how I look when I do it and say it.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Too much of a good thing can be taxing.
Author: Mae West

Quote: The score never interested me, only the game.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I always say, keep a diary and someday it'll keep you.
Author: Mae West

Quote: A man can be short and dumpy and getting bald but if he has fire, women will like him.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I only like two kinds of men, domestic and imported.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I believe in censorship. I made a fortune out of it.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Right now I think censorship is necessary; the things they're doing and saying in films right now just shouldn't be allowed. There's no dignity anymore and I think that's very important.
Author: Mae West

Quote: All discarded lovers should be given a second chance, but with somebody else.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Opportunity knocks for every man, but you have to give a woman a ring.
Author: Mae West

Quote: When women go wrong, men go right after them.
Author: Mae West

Quote: When I'm good I'm very, very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Don't keep a man guessing too long - he's sure to find the answer somewhere else.
Author: Mae West

Quote: It ain't no sin if you crack a few laws now and then, just so long as you don't break any.
Author: Mae West

Quote: She's the kind of girl who climbed the ladder of success wrong by wrong.
Author: Mae West

Quote: It's not what I do, but the way I do it. It's not what I say, but the way I say it.
Author: Mae West

Quote: It takes two to get one in trouble.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I only have 'yes' men around me. Who needs 'no' men?
Author: Mae West

Quote: The best way to hold a man is in your arms.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I like a man who's good, but not too good - for the good die young, and I hate a dead one.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I've been things and seen places.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Give a man a free hand and he'll run it all over you.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Personally, I like two types of men - domestic and foreign.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Say what you want about long dresses, but they cover a multitude of shins.
Author: Mae West

Quote: He's the kind of man a woman would have to marry to get rid of.
Author: Mae West

Quote: A man has one hundred dollars and you leave him with two dollars, that's subtraction.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I've been in more laps than a napkin.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Love isn't an emotion or an instinct - it's an art.
Author: Mae West

Quote: It's hard to be funny when you have to be clean.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I see you're a man with ideals. I better be going before you've still got them.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Don't marry a man to reform him - that's what reform schools are for.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I like restraint, if it doesn't go too far.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I enjoyed the courtroom as just another stage but not so amusing as Broadway.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I speak two languages, Body and English.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Virtue has its own reward, but no sale at the box office.
Author: Mae West

Quote: Personality is the most important thing to an actress's success.
Author: Mae West

Quote: First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is better to be violent, if there is violence in our hearts, than to put on the cloak of nonviolence to cover impotence.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Freedom is never dear at any price. It is the breath of life. What would a man not pay for living?
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Where there is love there is life.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Satisfaction lies in the effort, not in the attainment, full effort is full victory.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Power is of two kinds. One is obtained by the fear of punishment and the other by acts of love. Power based on love is a thousand times more effective and permanent then the one derived from fear of punishment.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Even if you are a minority of one, the truth is the truth.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There is a higher court than courts of justice and that is the court of conscience. It supercedes all other courts.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Man becomes great exactly in the degree in which he works for the welfare of his fellow-men.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: An ounce of practice is worth more than tons of preaching.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Action expresses priorities.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There is a sufficiency in the world for man's need but not for man's greed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I suppose leadership at one time meant muscles; but today it means getting along with people.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts what he thinks, he becomes.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The essence of all religions is one. Only their approaches are different.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If I had no sense of humor, I would long ago have committed suicide.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A nation's culture resides in the hearts and in the soul of its people.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A small body of determined spirits fired by an unquenchable faith in their mission can alter the course of history.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Honest disagreement is often a good sign of progress.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Nobody can hurt me without my permission.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The good man is the friend of all living things.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: We may stumble and fall but shall rise again; it should be enough if we did not run away from the battle.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: My life is my message.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Prayer is not asking. It is a longing of the soul. It is daily admission of one's weakness. It is better in prayer to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: To believe in something, and not to live it, is dishonest.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: In matters of conscience, the law of the majority has no place.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A 'No' uttered from the deepest conviction is better than a 'Yes' merely uttered to please, or worse, to avoid trouble.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: All compromise is based on give and take, but there can be no give and take on fundamentals. Any compromise on mere fundamentals is a surrender. For it is all give and no take.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Morality is the basis of things and truth is the substance of all morality.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A man who was completely innocent, offered himself as a sacrifice for the good of others, including his enemies, and became the ransom of the world. It was a perfect act.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If we are to teach real peace in this world, and if we are to carry on a real war against war, we shall have to begin with the children.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The real ornament of woman is her character, her purity.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Whatever you do may seem insignificant to you, but it is most important that you do it.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Those who say religion has nothing to do with politics do not know what religion is.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Peace is its own reward.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There is nothing that wastes the body like worry, and one who has any faith in God should be ashamed to worry about anything whatsoever.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If patience is worth anything, it must endure to the end of time. And a living faith will last in the midst of the blackest storm.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The moment there is suspicion about a person's motives, everything he does becomes tainted.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is the quality of our work which will please God and not the quantity.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Let us all be brave enough to die the death of a martyr, but let no one lust for martyrdom.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: My religion is based on truth and non-violence. Truth is my God. Non-violence is the means of realising Him.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the world's problems.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Jesus is ideal and wonderful, but you Christians - you are not like him.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: What do I think of Western civilization? I think it would be a very good idea.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Man's nature is not essentially evil. Brute nature has been known to yield to the influence of love. You must never despair of human nature.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It has always been a mystery to me how men can feel themselves honoured by the humiliation of their fellow beings.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It may be possible to gild pure gold, but who can make his mother more beautiful?
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If a man reaches the heart of his own religion, he has reached the heart of the others, too. There is only one God, and there are many paths to him.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Self-respect knows no considerations.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Those who know how to think need no teachers.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Non-cooperation with evil is as much a duty as is cooperation with good.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Freedom is not worth having if it does not connote freedom to err.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Poverty is the worst form of violence.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: We should meet abuse by forbearance. Human nature is so constituted that if we take absolutely no notice of anger or abuse, the person indulging in it will soon weary of it and stop.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Always aim at complete harmony of thought and word and deed. Always aim at purifying your thoughts and everything will be well.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Service which is rendered without joy helps neither the servant nor the served. But all other pleasures and possessions pale into nothingness before service which is rendered in a spirit of joy.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: An error does not become truth by reason of multiplied propagation, nor does truth become error because nobody sees it.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The main purpose of life is to live rightly, think rightly, act rightly. The soul must languish when we give all our thought to the body.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The human voice can never reach the distance that is covered by the still small voice of conscience.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Intolerance is itself a form of violence and an obstacle to the growth of a true democratic spirit.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: We may never be strong enough to be entirely nonviolent in thought, word and deed. But we must keep nonviolence as our goal and make strong progress towards it.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: As human beings, our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world - that is the myth of the atomic age - as in being able to remake ourselves.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I am prepared to die, but there is no cause for which I am prepared to kill.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I have nothing new to teach the world. Truth and Non-violence are as old as the hills. All I have done is to try experiments in both on as vast a scale as I could.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Gentleness, self-sacrifice and generosity are the exclusive possession of no one race or religion.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I believe in equality for everyone, except reporters and photographers.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Among the many misdeeds of the British rule in India, history will look upon the act depriving a whole nation of arms as the blackest.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Anger is the enemy of non-violence and pride is a monster that swallows it up.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Confession of errors is like a broom which sweeps away the dirt and leaves the surface brighter and clearer. I feel stronger for confession.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: When restraint and courtesy are added to strength, the latter becomes irresistible.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Faith is not something to grasp, it is a state to grow into.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Non-violence is the greatest force at the disposal of mankind. It is mightier than the mightiest weapon of destruction devised by the ingenuity of man.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The law of sacrifice is uniform throughout the world. To be effective it demands the sacrifice of the bravest and the most spotless.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Rights that do not flow from duty well performed are not worth having.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Fear has its use but cowardice has none.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Faith... must be enforced by reason... when faith becomes blind it dies.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Partition is bad. But whatever is past is past. We have only to look to the future.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans, and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is wrought under the name of totalitarianism or the holy name of liberty or democracy?
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Nearly everything you do is of no importance, but it is important that you do it.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Constant development is the law of life, and a man who always tries to maintain his dogmas in order to appear consistent drives himself into a false position.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is easy enough to be friendly to one's friends. But to befriend the one who regards himself as your enemy is the quintessence of true religion. The other is mere business.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Infinite striving to be the best is man's duty; it is its own reward. Everything else is in God's hands.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Interdependence is and ought to be as much the ideal of man as self-sufficiency. Man is a social being.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Non-violence is not a garment to be put on and off at will. Its seat is in the heart, and it must be an inseparable part of our being.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I think it is the height of ignorance to believe that the sexual act is an independent function necessary like sleeping or eating. Seeing, therefore, that I did not desire more children, I began to strive after self-control. There was endless difficulty in the task.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Truth is by nature self-evident. As soon as you remove the cobwebs of ignorance that surround it, it shines clear.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I do not want to foresee the future. I am concerned with taking care of the present. God has given me no control over the moment following.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The spirit of democracy is not a mechanical thing to be adjusted by abolition of forms. It requires change of heart.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is the duty of every thoughtful Indian not to marry. In case he is helpless in regard to marriage, he should abstain from sexual intercourse with his wife.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Prayer is a confession of one's own unworthiness and weakness.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A policy is a temporary creed liable to be changed, but while it holds good it has got to be pursued with apostolic zeal.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Glory lies in the attempt to reach one's goal and not in reaching it.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Intolerance betrays want of faith in one's cause.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: No culture can live if it attempts to be exclusive.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Healthy discontent is the prelude to progress.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Capital as such is not evil; it is its wrong use that is evil. Capital in some form or other will always be needed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A weak man is just by accident. A strong but non-violent man is unjust by accident.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I have also seen children successfully surmounting the effects of an evil inheritance. That is due to purity being an inherent attribute of the soul.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Each one has to find his peace from within. And peace to be real must be unaffected by outside circumstances.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: God, as Truth, has been for me a treasure beyond price. May He be so to every one of us.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I wear the national dress because it is the most natural and the most becoming for an Indian.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Culture of the mind must be subservient to the heart.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I believe that a man is the strongest soldier for daring to die unarmed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A religion that takes no account of practical affairs and does not help to solve them is no religion.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Justice that love gives is a surrender, justice that law gives is a punishment.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Each one prays to God according to his own light.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The only tyrant I accept in this world is the still voice within.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I do all the evil I can before I learn to shun it? Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: All the religions of the world, while they may differ in other respects, unitedly proclaim that nothing lives in this world but Truth.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Unwearied ceaseless effort is the price that must be paid for turning faith into a rich infallible experience.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: That service is the noblest which is rendered for its own sake.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Morality which depends upon the helplessness of a man or woman has not much to recommend it. Morality is rooted in the purity of our hearts.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Sense perceptions can be and often are false and deceptive, however real they may appear to us. Where there is realization outside the senses, it is infallible. It is proved not by extraneous evidence but in the transformed conduct and character of those who have felt the real presence of God within.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: But for my faith in God, I should have been a raving maniac.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Spiritual relationship is far more precious than physical. Physical relationship divorced from spiritual is body without soul.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There is an orderliness in the universe, there is an unalterable law governing everything and every being that exists or lives. It is no blind law; for no blind law can govern the conduct of living beings.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Before the throne of the Almighty, man will be judged not by his acts but by his intentions. For God alone reads our hearts.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Where love is, there God is also.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Increase of material comforts, it may be generally laid down, does not in any way whatsoever conduce to moral growth.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Violent means will give violent freedom. That would be a menace to the world and to India herself.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: God cannot be realized through the intellect. Intellect can lead one to a certain extent and no further. It is a matter of faith and experience derived from that faith.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Fear of death makes us devoid both of valour and religion. For want of valour is want of religious faith.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I claim to be a simple individual liable to err like any other fellow mortal. I own, however, that I have humility enough to confess my errors and to retrace my steps.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I look only to the good qualities of men. Not being faultless myself, I won't presume to probe into the faults of others.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Measures must always in a progressive society be held superior to men, who are after all imperfect instruments, working for their fulfilment.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Palestine belongs to the Arabs in the same sense that England belongs to the English or France to the French.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I am in the world feeling my way to light 'amid the encircling gloom.'
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Man can never be a woman's equal in the spirit of selfless service with which nature has endowed her.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Ours is one continued struggle against degradation sought to be inflicted upon us by the European, who desire to degrade us to the level of the raw Kaffir, whose occupation is hunting and whose sole ambition is to collect a certain number of cattle to buy a wife with, and then pass his life in indolence and nakedness.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: An unjust law is itself a species of violence. Arrest for its breach is more so.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Non-violence requires a double faith, faith in God and also faith in man.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A principle is the expression of perfection, and as imperfect beings like us cannot practise perfection, we devise every moment limits of its compromise in practice.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: He is lost who is possessed by carnal desire.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I claim that human mind or human society is not divided into watertight compartments called social, political and religious. All act and react upon one another.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Commonsense is the realised sense of proportion.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I know, to banish anger altogether from one's breast is a difficult task. It cannot be achieved through pure personal effort. It can be done only by God's grace.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: We do not need to proselytise either by our speech or by our writing. We can only do so really with our lives. Let our lives be open books for all to study.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Let not the 12 million Negroes be ashamed of the fact that they are the grandchildren of slaves. There is dishonor in being slave-owners.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Prayer is not an old woman's idle amusement. Properly understood and applied, it is the most potent instrument of action.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: What is true of the individual will be tomorrow true of the whole nation if individuals will but refuse to lose heart and hope.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Religion is a matter of the heart. No physical inconvenience can warrant abandonment of one's own religion.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: God sometimes does try to the uttermost those whom he wishes to bless.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Man is supposed to be the maker of his destiny. It is only partly true. He can make his destiny, only in so far as he is allowed by the Great Power.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Religion is more than life. Remember that his own religion is the truest to every man even if it stands low in the scales of philosophical comparison.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Non-violence and truth are inseparable and presuppose one another.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I took the vow of celibacy in 1906. I had not shared my thoughts with my wife until then, but only consulted her at the time of making the vow. She had no objection.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Providence has its appointed hour for everything. We cannot command results, we can only strive.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Non-violence is the article of faith.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Man lives freely only by his readiness to die, if need be, at the hands of his brother, never by killing him.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Non-violence, which is the quality of the heart, cannot come by an appeal to the brain.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I claim to be a simple individual liable to err like any other fellow mortal. I own, however, that I have humility enough in me to confess my errors and to retrace my steps.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is any day better to stand erect with a broken and bandaged head then to crawl on one's belly, in order to be able to save one's head.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Only he can take great resolves who has indomitable faith in God and has fear of God.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: God is, even though the whole world deny him. Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If co-operation is a duty, I hold that non-co-operation also under certain conditions is equally a duty.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Morality is contraband in war.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Nonviolence is the first article of my faith. It is also the last article of my creed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Purity of personal life is the one indispensable condition for building up a sound education.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There is no principle worth the name if it is not wholly good.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: To deprive a man of his natural liberty and to deny to him the ordinary amenities of life is worse then starving the body; it is starvation of the soul, the dweller in the body.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Every formula of every religion has in this age of reason, to submit to the acid test of reason and universal assent.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I did once seriously think of embracing the Christian faith. The gentle figure of Christ, so full of forgiveness that he taught his followers not to retaliate when abused or struck, but to turn the other cheek - I thought it was a beautiful example of the perfect man.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: My religion teaches me that whenever there is distress which one cannot remove, one must fast and pray.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I will far rather see the race of man extinct than that we should become less than beasts by making the noblest of God's creation, woman, the object of our lust.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: We win justice quickest by rendering justice to the other party.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: We may have our private opinions but why should they be a bar to the meeting of hearts?
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: One's own religion is after all a matter between oneself and one's Maker and no one else's.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I am a humble but very earnest seeker after truth.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I reject any religious doctrine that does not appeal to reason and is in conflict with morality.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Man falls from the pursuit of the ideal of plan living and high thinking the moment he wants to multiply his daily wants. Man's happiness really lies in contentment.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I would heartily welcome the union of East and West provided it is not based on brute force.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Moral authority is never retained by any attempt to hold on to it. It comes without seeking and is retained without effort.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The pursuit of truth does not permit violence on one's opponent.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Though we may know Him by a thousand names, He is one and the same to us all.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: For me every ruler is alien that defies public opinion.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Everyone who wills can hear the inner voice. It is within everyone.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Action is no less necessary than thought to the instinctive tendencies of the human frame.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: A vow is a purely religious act which cannot be taken in a fit of passion. It can be taken only with a mind purified and composed and with God as witness.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is my own firm belief that the strength of the soul grows in proportion as you subdue the flesh.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I have worshipped woman as the living embodiment of the spirit of service and sacrifice.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Are creeds such simple things like the clothes which a man can change at will and put on at will? Creeds are such for which people live for ages and ages.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Violent men have not been known in history to die to a man. They die up to a point.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Let everyone try and find that as a result of daily prayer he adds something new to his life, something with which nothing can be compared.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Just as a man would not cherish living in a body other than his own, so do nations not like to live under other nations, however noble and great the latter may be.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The only wealth which you will keep forever is the wealth you have given away.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Each day provides its own gifts.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Time is a sort of river of passing events, and strong is its current; no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place, and this too will be swept away.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Poverty is the mother of crime.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future, too.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: I have often wondered how it is that every man loves himself more than all the rest of men, but yet sets less value on his own opinions of himself than on the opinions of others.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Begin - to begin is half the work, let half still remain; again begin this, and thou wilt have finished.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Here is the rule to remember in the future, When anything tempts you to be bitter: not, 'This is a misfortune' but 'To bear this worthily is good fortune.'
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Everything that happens happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The universe is transformation: life is opinion.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Observe constantly that all things take place by change, and accustom thyself to consider that the nature of the Universe loves nothing so much as to change the things which are, and to make new things like them.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: We ought to do good to others as simply as a horse runs, or a bee makes honey, or a vine bears grapes season after season without thinking of the grapes it has borne.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Tomorrow is nothing, today is too late; the good lived yesterday.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Such as are your habitual thoughts, such also will be the character of your mind; for the soul is dyed by the thoughts.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: To the wise, life is a problem; to the fool, a solution.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Because your own strength is unequal to the task, do not assume that it is beyond the powers of man; but if anything is within the powers and province of man, believe that it is within your own compass also.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Confine yourself to the present.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Let men see, let them know, a real man, who lives as he was meant to live.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Let not your mind run on what you lack as much as on what you have already.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Anything in any way beautiful derives its beauty from itself and asks nothing beyond itself. Praise is no part of it, for nothing is made worse or better by praise.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Be content with what you are, and wish not change; nor dread your last day, nor long for it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: How much time he saves who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Natural ability without education has more often raised a man to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Adapt yourself to the things among which your lot has been cast and love sincerely the fellow creatures with whom destiny has ordained that you shall live.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Anger cannot be dishonest.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Execute every act of thy life as though it were thy last.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Despise not death, but welcome it, for nature wills it like all else.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible for anyone to accomplish.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The act of dying is one of the acts of life.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: We are too much accustomed to attribute to a single cause that which is the product of several, and the majority of our controversies come from that.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Be content to seem what you really are.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: A man should be upright, not be kept upright.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: To refrain from imitation is the best revenge.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: To live happily is an inward power of the soul.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Where a man can live, he can also live well.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Men exist for the sake of one another.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Each thing is of like form from everlasting and comes round again in its cycle.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: What springs from earth dissolves to earth again, and heaven-born things fly to their native seat.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Let it be your constant method to look into the design of people's actions, and see what they would be at, as often as it is practicable; and to make this custom the more significant, practice it first upon yourself.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The universal order and the personal order are nothing but different expressions and manifestations of a common underlying principle.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: To understand the true quality of people, you must look into their minds, and examine their pursuits and aversions.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: There is nothing happens to any person but what was in his power to go through with.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Whatever the universal nature assigns to any man at any time is for the good of that man at that time.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Forward, as occasion offers. Never look round to see whether any shall note it... Be satisfied with success in even the smallest matter, and think that even such a result is no trifle.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Death, like birth, is a secret of Nature.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: When thou art above measure angry, bethink thee how momentary is man's life.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Perhaps there are none more lazy, or more truly ignorant, than your everlasting readers.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Aptitude found in the understanding and is often inherited. Genius coming from reason and imagination, rarely.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: And thou wilt give thyself relief, if thou doest every act of thy life as if it were the last.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: If you want something said, ask a man; if you want something done, ask a woman.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: The problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other peoples' money.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Power is like being a lady... if you have to tell people you are, you aren't.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Plan your work for today and every day, then work your plan.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Europe was created by history. America was created by philosophy.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Standing in the middle of the road is very dangerous; you get knocked down by the traffic from both sides.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Disciplining yourself to do what you know is right and important, although difficult, is the highroad to pride, self-esteem, and personal satisfaction.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I love argument, I love debate. I don't expect anyone just to sit there and agree with me, that's not their job.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: The spirit of envy can destroy; it can never build.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: It may be the cock that crows, but it is the hen that lays the eggs.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Pennies do not come from heaven. They have to be earned here on earth.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: You and I come by road or rail, but economists travel on infrastructure.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: What is success? I think it is a mixture of having a flair for the thing that you are doing; knowing that it is not enough, that you have got to have hard work and a certain sense of purpose.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Any woman who understands the problems of running a home will be nearer to understanding the problems of running a country.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: No one would remember the Good Samaritan if he'd only had good intentions; he had money as well.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: There is no such thing as society: there are individual men and women, and there are families.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: If my critics saw me walking over the Thames they would say it was because I couldn't swim.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: This lady is not for turning.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: It's a funny old world.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I do not know anyone who has got to the top without hard work. That is the recipe. It will not always get you to the top, but should get you pretty near.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: A world without nuclear weapons would be less stable and more dangerous for all of us.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: There can be no liberty unless there is economic liberty.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I seem to smell the stench of appeasement in the air.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: It is not the creation of wealth that is wrong, but the love of money for its own sake.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: To me, consensus seems to be the process of abandoning all beliefs, principles, values and policies. So it is something in which no one believes and to which no one objects.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Of course it's the same old story. Truth usually is the same old story.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: If you lead a country like Britain, a strong country, a country which has taken a lead in world affairs in good times and in bad, a country that is always reliable, then you have to have a touch of iron about you.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: What Britain needs is an iron lady.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: You don't tell deliberate lies, but sometimes you have to be evasive.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I am in politics because of the conflict between good and evil, and I believe that in the end good will triumph.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: No woman in my time will be prime minister or chancellor or foreign secretary - not the top jobs. Anyway, I wouldn't want to be prime minister; you have to give yourself 100 percent.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I've got a woman's ability to stick to a job and get on with it when everyone else walks off and leaves it.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: One of the things being in politics has taught me is that men are not a reasoned or reasonable sex.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: If you want to cut your own throat, don't come to me for a bandage.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Democratic nations must try to find ways to starve the terrorist and the hijacker of the oxygen of publicity on which they depend.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: It's passionately interesting for me that the things that I learned in a small town, in a very modest home, are just the things that I believe have won the election.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I usually make up my mind about a man in ten seconds, and I very rarely change it.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Being prime minister is a lonely job... you cannot lead from the crowd.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: We were told our campaign wasn't sufficiently slick. We regard that as a compliment.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: There are still people in my party who believe in consensus politics. I regard them as Quislings, as traitors... I mean it.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: It pays to know the enemy - not least because at some time you may have the opportunity to turn him into a friend.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Ought we not to ask the media to agree among themselves a voluntary code of conduct, under which they would not say or show anything which could assist the terrorists' morale or their cause while the hijack lasted.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Every family should have the right to spend their money, after tax, as they wish, and not as the government dictates. Let us extend choice, extend the will to choose and the chance to choose.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I like Mr. Gorbachev, we can do business together.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: We Conservatives hate unemployment.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: If... many influential people have failed to understand, or have just forgotten, what we were up against in the Cold War and how we overcame it, they are not going to be capable of securing, let alone enlarging, the gains that liberty has made.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I owe nothing to Women's Lib.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I just owe almost everything to my father and it's passionately interesting for me that the things that I learned in a small town, in a very modest home, are just the things that I believe have won the election.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I don't mind how much my Ministers talk, so long as they do what I say.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: To cure the British disease with socialism was like trying to cure leukaemia with leeches.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Nothing is more obstinate than a fashionable consensus.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: The battle for women's rights has been largely won.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Platitudes? Yes, there are platitudes. Platitudes are there because they are true.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: I restore myself when I'm alone.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I'm selfish, impatient, and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I'm out of control, and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I am good, but not an angel. I do sin, but I am not the devil. I am just a small girl in a big world trying to find someone to love.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Sex is a part of nature. I go along with nature.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: We are all of us stars, and we deserve to twinkle.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A strong man doesn't have to be dominant toward a woman. He doesn't match his strength against a woman weak with love for him. He matches it against the world.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Some of my foster families used to send me to the movies to get me out of the house and there I'd sit all day and way into the night. Up in front, there with the screen so big, a little kid all alone, and I loved it. I loved anything that moved up there and I didn't miss anything that happened and there was no popcorn either.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: If you can make a girl laugh, you can make her do anything.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Fear is stupid. So are regrets.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: It's better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone - so far.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't mind living in a man's world as long as I can be a woman in it.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Sometimes I feel my whole life has been one big rejection.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: If I'd observed all the rules, I'd never have got anywhere.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: It's not true I had nothing on, I had the radio on.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: It's all make believe, isn't it?
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Fame will go by and, so long, I've had you, fame. If it goes by, I've always known it was fickle. So at least it's something I experience, but that's not where I live.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A woman knows by intuition, or instinct, what is best for herself.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't want to make money, I just want to be wonderful.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: The nicest thing for me is sleep, then at least I can dream.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: The real lover is the man who can thrill you just by touching your head or smiling into your eyes - or just by staring into space.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: What do I wear in bed? Why, Chanel No. 5, of course.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: One of the best things that ever happened to me is that I'm a woman. That is the way all females should feel.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: No one ever told me I was pretty when I was a little girl. All little girls should be told they're pretty, even if they aren't.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A smart girl leaves before she is left.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A career is wonderful, but you can't curl up with it on a cold night.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Beauty and femininity are ageless and can't be contrived, and glamour, although the manufacturers won't like this, cannot be manufactured. Not real glamour; it's based on femininity.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Fame is fickle, and I know it. It has its compensations but it also has its drawbacks, and I've experienced them both.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I am trying to find myself. Sometimes that's not easy.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I think that sexuality is only attractive when it's natural and spontaneous.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: The body is meant to be seen, not all covered up.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Sometimes I've been to a party where no one spoke to me for a whole evening. The men, frightened by their wives or sweeties, would give me a wide berth. And the ladies would gang up in a corner to discuss my dangerous character.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Dogs never bite me - just humans.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I have too many fantasies to be a housewife. I guess I am a fantasy.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I knew I belonged to the public and to the world, not because I was talented or even beautiful, but because I had never belonged to anything or anyone else.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I like to feel blonde all over.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I've been on a calendar, but I've never been on time.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Respect is one of life's greatest treasures. I mean, what does it all add up to if you don't have that?
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A career is born in public - talent in privacy.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Hollywood is a place where they'll pay you a thousand dollars for a kiss and fifty cents for your soul.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Men are so willing to respect anything that bores them.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Experts on romance say for a happy marriage there has to be more than a passionate love. For a lasting union, they insist, there must be a genuine liking for each other. Which, in my book, is a good definition for friendship.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Fame is like caviar, you know - it's good to have caviar but not when you have it at every meal.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Arthur Miller wouldn't have married me if I had been nothing but a dumb blonde.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I've never dropped anyone I believed in.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I have feelings too. I am still human. All I want is to be loved, for myself and for my talent.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: First, I'm trying to prove to myself that I'm a person. Then maybe I'll convince myself that I'm an actress.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: We should all start to live before we get too old.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: The trouble with censors is that they worry if a girl has cleavage. They ought to worry if she hasn't any.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I defy gravity.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Fame doesn't fulfill you. It warms you a bit, but that warmth is temporary.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I am alone; I am always alone no matter what.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: If I'm a star, then the people made me a star.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I have always had a talent for irritating women since I was fourteen.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Millions of people live their entire lives without finding themselves. But it is something I must do.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Dreaming about being an actress, is more exciting then being one.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Being a sex symbol is a heavy load to carry, especially when one is tired, hurt and bewildered.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I am involved in a freedom ride protesting the loss of the minority rights belonging to the few remaining earthbound stars. All we demanded was our right to twinkle.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I won't be satisfied until people want to hear me sing without looking at me. Of course, that doesn't mean I want them to stop looking.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: With fame, you know, you can read about yourself, somebody else's ideas about you, but what's important is how you feel about yourself - for survival and living day to day with what comes up.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I am invariably late for appointments - sometimes as much as two hours. I've tried to change my ways but the things that make me late are too strong, and too pleasing.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: If there is only one thing in my life that I am proud of, it's that I've never been a kept woman.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: All my stepchildren carried the burden of my fame. Sometimes they would read terrible things about me, and I'd worry about whether it would hurt them. I would tell them: 'Don't hide these things from me. I'd rather you ask me these things straight out, and I'll answer all your questions.'
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A man makes you feel important - makes you glad you are a woman.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Sometimes, wearing a scarf and a polo coat and no makeup and with a certain attitude of walking, I go shopping or just look at people living. But then, you know, there will be a few teenagers who are kind of sharp, and they'll say, 'Hey, just a minute. You know who I think that is?' And they'll start tailing me. And I don't mind.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: The truth is, I've never fooled anyone. I've let men sometimes fool themselves.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: There is a need for aloneness, which I don't think most people realise for an actor. It's almost having certain kinds of secrets for yourself that you'll let the whole world in on only for a moment, when you're acting. But everybody is always tugging at you. They'd all like sort of a chunk of you.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Depending upon my activities, I sleep between five and ten hours every night. I sleep in an extra-wide single bed, and I use only one heavy down comforter over me, summer or winter. I have never been able to wear pajamas or creepy nightgowns; they disturb my sleep.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I know I will never be happy, but I know I can be gay!
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I read poetry to save time.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't consider myself an intellectual. And this is not one of my aims. But I admire intellectual people.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: In Hollywood a girl's virtue is much less important than her hairdo.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: When it comes to gossip, I have to readily admit men are as guilty as women.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I never wanted to be Marilyn - it just happened. Marilyn's like a veil I wear over Norma Jeane.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I'll think I have a few wonderful friends and all of a sudden, ooh, here it comes. They do a lot of things. They talk about you to the press, to their friends, tell stories, and you know, it's disappointing.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Friends accept you the way you are.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: What good is it being Marilyn Monroe? Why can't I just be an ordinary woman?
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I am not a victim of emotional conflicts. I am human.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: My dinners at home are startlingly simple. Every night, I stop at the market near my hotel and pick up a steak, lamb chops or some liver, which I broil in the electric oven in my room. I usually eat four or five raw carrots with my meat, and that is all. I must be part rabbit; I never get bored with raw carrots.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I remember when I was in high school I didn't have a new dress for each special occasion. The girls would bring the fact to my attention, not always too delicately. The boys, however, never bothered with the subject. They were my friends, not because of the size of my wardrobe but because they liked me.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Naturally, there are times when every woman likes to be flattered... to feel she is the most important thing in someone's world. Only a man can paint this picture.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Black men don't like to be called 'boys,' but women accept being called 'girls.'
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Sometimes I think it would be easier to avoid old age, to die young, but then you'd never complete your life, would you? You'd never wholly know you.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: The public doesn't mind people living together without being married, providing they don't overdo it.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't digest things with my mind.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I was brought up differently than the average American child because the average child is brought up expecting to be happy.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Of course, it does depend on the people, but sometimes I'm invited places to kind of brighten up a dinner table like a musician who'll play the piano after dinner, and I know you're not really invited for yourself. You're just an ornament.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I always have a full-length mirror next to the camera when I'm doing publicity stills. That way, I know how I look.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A woman can't be alone. She needs a man. A man and a woman support and strengthen each other. She just can't do it by herself.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Husbands are chiefly good as lovers when they are betraying their wives.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Like any creative human being, I would like a bit more control so that it would be a little easier for me when the director says, 'One tear, right now,' that one tear would pop out.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: It is wonderful to have someone praise you, to be desired.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: The 'public' scares me, but people I trust.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: What I really want to say: That what the world really needs is a real feeling of kinship. Everybody: stars, laborers, Negroes, Jews, Arabs. We are all brothers.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: An actor is supposed to be a sensitive instrument. Isaac Stern takes good care of his violin. What if everybody jumped on his violin?
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I used to think as I looked out on the Hollywood night, 'There must be thousands of girls sitting alone like me dreaming of being a movie star.' But I'm not going to worry about them. I'm dreaming the hardest.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Designers want me to dress like Spring, in billowing things. I don't feel like Spring. I feel like a warm red Autumn.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Girdles and wire stays should have never been invented. No man wants to hug a padded bird cage.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't know if high society is different in other cities, but in Hollywood, important people can't stand to be invited someplace that isn't full of other important people. They don't mind a few unfamous people being present because they make good listeners.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Someone said to me, 'If fifty percent of the experts in Hollywood said you had no talent and should give up, what would you do?' My answer was then and still is, 'If a hundred percent told me that, all one hundred percent would be wrong.'
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Creativity has got to start with humanity and when you're a human being, you feel, you suffer. You're gay, you're sick, you're nervous or whatever.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: An actress is not a machine, but they treat you like a machine. A money machine.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: It's not to much fun to know yourself too well or think you do - everyone needs a little conceit to carry them through & past the falls.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't want everybody to see exactly where I live, what my sofa or my fireplace looks like.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Confidentially, the type of male I find most enjoyable for a friend is one who has enough fire and assurance to speak up for his convictions.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: It's nice to be included in people's fantasies but you also like to be accepted for your own sake.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I think one of the basic reasons men make good friends is that they can make up their minds quickly.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I want to be an artist, not... a celluloid aphrodisiac.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Someday I want to have children and give them all the love I never had.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I'm one of the world's most self-conscious people. I really have to struggle.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Why is it you always meet people when you look your worst?
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: In fact, my popularity seems almost entirely a masculine phenomenon.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I have evolved my own exercises, for the muscles I wish to keep firm, and I know they are right for me because I can feel them putting the proper muscles into play as I exercise.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: There isn't anybody that looks like me without clothes on.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I have noticed... that men usually leave married women alone and are inclined to treat all wives with respect. This is no great credit to married women.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I think that when you are famous every weakness is exaggerated.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I've found men are less likely to let petty things annoy them.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I'm very definitely a woman and I enjoy it.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: When I was five I think, that's when I started wanting to be an actress.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I'm looking forward to becoming a marvelous - excuse the word marvelous - character actress. like Marie Dressler, like Will Rogers.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Having a child, that's always been my biggest fear. I want a child and I fear a child.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I don't look at myself as a commodity, but I'm sure a lot of people have.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A woman can bring a new love to each man she loves, providing there are not too many.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: We human beings are strange creatures and still reserve the right to think for ourselves.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: What good am I? I can't have kids. I can't cook. I've been divorced three times. Who would want me?
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: A man has a tendency to accept you the way you are, while most women immediately start to pick flaws and want to change you.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I used to get the feeling, and sometimes I still get it, that sometimes I was fooling somebody; I don't know who or what, maybe myself.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I've often stood silent at a party for hours listening to my movie idols turn into dull and little people.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I wish I knew why I am so anguished.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I guess I have always been deeply terrified to really be someone's wife since I know from life one cannot love another, ever, really.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Nothing's ever easy as long as you go on living.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: If a star or studio chief or any other great movie personages find themselves sitting among a lot of nobodies, they get frightened - as if somebody was trying to demote them.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I've always felt toward the slightest scene, even if all I had to do in a scene was just to come in and say, 'Hi,' that the people ought to get their money's worth and that this is an obligation of mine, to give them the best you can get from me.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I often wake up in the night, and I like to have something to think about.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: If your man is a sports enthusiast, you may have to resign yourself to his spouting off in a monotone on a prize fight, football game or pennant race.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I was honoured when they asked me to appear at the president's birthday rally in Madison Square Garden. There was like a hush over the whole place when I came on to sing 'Happy Birthday,' like if I had been wearing a slip, I would have thought it was showing or something. I thought, 'Oh, my gosh, what if no sound comes out!'
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I myself would like to become more disciplined within my work.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: There was my name up in lights. I said, 'God, somebody's made a mistake.' But there it was, in lights. And I sat there and said, 'Remember, you're not a star.' Yet there it was up in lights.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: You know, most people really don't know me.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: To put it bluntly, I seem to have a whole superstructure with no foundation. But I'm working on the foundation.
Author: Marilyn Monroe
