Quote: It is clear to everyone that astronomy at all events compels the soul to look upwards, and draws it from the things of this world to the other.
Author: Plato

Quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Trees are the earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Death is not extinguishing the light; it is only putting out the lamp because the dawn has come.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: What is Art? It is the response of man's creative soul to the call of the Real.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Do not say, 'It is morning,' and dismiss it with a name of yesterday. See it for the first time as a newborn child that has no name.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Love does not claim possession, but gives freedom.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: The flower which is single need not envy the thorns that are numerous.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Age considers; youth ventures.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Life is given to us, we earn it by giving it.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Facts are many, but the truth is one.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Love is an endless mystery, for it has nothing else to explain it.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: We come nearest to the great when we are great in humility.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: We gain freedom when we have paid the full price.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: The water in a vessel is sparkling; the water in the sea is dark. The small truth has words which are clear; the great truth has great silence.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: A mind all logic is like a knife all blade. It makes the hand bleed that uses it.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Music fills the infinite between two souls.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Emancipation from the bondage of the soil is no freedom for the tree.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: I have become my own version of an optimist. If I can't make it through one door, I'll go through another door - or I'll make a door. Something terrific will come no matter how dark the present.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: He who is too busy doing good finds no time to be good.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: We live in the world when we love it.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: If you shut the door to all errors, truth will be shut out.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: The burden of the self is lightened with I laugh at myself.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: To be outspoken is easy when you do not wait to speak the complete truth.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Love is not a mere impulse, it must contain truth, which is law.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Trees are Earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: In Art, man reveals himself and not his objects.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: From the solemn gloom of the temple children run out to sit in the dust, God watches them play and forgets the priest.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Those who own much have much to fear.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Every difficulty slurred over will be a ghost to disturb your repose later on.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Your idol is shattered in the dust to prove that God's dust is greater than your idol.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Bigotry tries to keep truth safe in its hand with a grip that kills it.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Nirvana is not the blowing out of the candle. It is the extinguishing of the flame because day is come.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: With the past, I have nothing to do; nor with the future. I live now.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: People only see what they are prepared to see.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The first wealth is health.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: People do not seem to realize that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and stare.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man is what he thinks about all day long.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Always do what you are afraid to do.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the creator for all I have not seen.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The years teach much which the days never know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The earth laughs in flowers.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Who you are speaks so loudly I can't hear what you're saying.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Our chief want is someone who will inspire us to be what we know we could be.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What is a weed? A plant whose virtues have never been discovered.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The reward of a thing well done is having done it.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly and they will show themselves great.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood. All is riddle, and the key to a riddle is another riddle.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every wall is a door.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: In the morning a man walks with his whole body; in the evening, only with his legs.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nobody can bring you peace but yourself.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: For everything you have missed, you have gained something else, and for everything you gain, you lose something else.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Win as if you were used to it, lose as if you enjoyed it for a change.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The desire of gold is not for gold. It is for the means of freedom and benefit.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: This time, like all times, is a very good one, if we but know what to do with it.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Fear defeats more people than any other one thing in the world.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Flowers... are a proud assertion that a ray of beauty outvalues all the utilities of the world.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The health of the eye seems to demand a horizon. We are never tired, so long as we can see far enough.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Beauty without expression is boring.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man is a god in ruins. When men are innocent, life shall be longer, and shall pass into the immortal, as gently as we awake from dreams.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every particular in nature, a leaf, a drop, a crystal, a moment of time is related to the whole, and partakes of the perfection of the whole.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds, adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Men love to wonder, and that is the seed of science.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Let us be silent, that we may hear the whispers of the gods.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Money often costs too much.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A great man is always willing to be little.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Men are what their mothers made them.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Character is higher than intellect. A great soul will be strong to live as well as think.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Common sense is genius dressed in its working clothes.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is an optical illusion about every person we meet.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Knowledge is knowing that we cannot know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We must be our own before we can be another's.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every man is a quotation from all his ancestors.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every hero becomes a bore at last.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We are always getting ready to live but never living.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nature is the incarnation of thought. The world is the mind precipitated.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Beauty without grace is the hook without the bait.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Curiosity is lying in wait for every secret.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every artist was first an amateur.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Everything in Nature contains all the powers of Nature. Everything is made of one hidden stuff.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: As a cure for worrying, work is better than whiskey.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Society is always taken by surprise at any new example of common sense.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nature is a mutable cloud which is always and never the same.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: In skating over thin ice our safety is in our speed.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Do the thing we fear, and death of fear is certain.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every man has his own courage, and is betrayed because he seeks in himself the courage of other persons.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Great men are they who see that spiritual is stronger than any material force - that thoughts rule the world.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Science does not know its debt to imagination.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man in debt is so far a slave.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The reason why the world lacks unity, and lies broken and in heaps, is, because man is disunited with himself.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Without electricity, the air would rot.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Speak the truth, and all things alive or brute are vouchers, and the very roots of the grass underground there, do seem to stir and move to bear you witness.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What we seek we shall find; what we flee from flees from us.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The world is all gates, all opportunities, strings of tension waiting to be struck.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Men admire the man who can organize their wishes and thoughts in stone and wood and steel and brass.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Children are all foreigners.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: To be great is to be misunderstood.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Life consists in what a man is thinking of all day.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Words are also actions, and actions are a kind of words.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Some books leave us free and some books make us free.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The greatest gift is a portion of thyself.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There was never a child so lovely but his mother was glad to get him to sleep.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Enthusiasm is the mother of effort, and without it nothing great was ever achieved.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: America is another name for opportunity.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every mind must make its choice between truth and repose. It cannot have both.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A good indignation brings out all one's powers.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Make yourself necessary to somebody.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Trust your instinct to the end, though you can render no reason.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Truth is handsomer than the affectation of love. Your goodness must have some edge to it, else it is none.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Reality is a sliding door.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The real and lasting victories are those of peace, and not of war.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Passion rebuilds the world for the youth. It makes all things alive and significant.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What you are comes to you.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: All diseases run into one, old age.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Judge of your natural character by what you do in your dreams.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every man I meet is in some way my superior.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Mysticism is the mistake of an accidental and individual symbol for an universal one.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Good is positive. Evil is merely privative, not absolute: it is like cold, which is the privation of heat. All evil is so much death or nonentity. Benevolence is absolute and real. So much benevolence as a man hath, so much life hath he.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man is usually more careful of his money than he is of his principles.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Good men must not obey the laws too well.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Doing well is the result of doing good. That's what capitalism is all about.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man is a method, a progressive arrangement; a selecting principle, gathering his like to him; wherever he goes.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We find delight in the beauty and happiness of children that makes the heart too big for the body.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: America is a poem in our eyes; its ample geography dazzles the imagination, and it will not wait long for metres.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We see God face to face every hour, and know the savor of Nature.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man builds a fine house; and now he has a master, and a task for life: he is to furnish, watch, show it, and keep it in repair, the rest of his days.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The martyr cannot be dishonored. Every lash inflicted is a tongue of fame; every prison a more illustrious abode.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The faith that stands on authority is not faith.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We acquire the strength we have overcome.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I like the silent church before the service begins, better than any preaching.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The ancestor of every action is a thought.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Our admiration of the antique is not admiration of the old, but of the natural.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: As long as a man stands in his own way, everything seems to be in his way.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What is a farm but a mute gospel?
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The highest revelation is that God is in every man.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Power and speed be hands and feet.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The civilized man has built a coach, but has lost the use of his feet.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: As soon as there is life there is danger.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Manners require time, and nothing is more vulgar than haste.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is the quality of the moment, not the number of days, or events, or of actors, that imports.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The man of genius inspires us with a boundless confidence in our own powers.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We have listened too long to the courtly Muses of Europe.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Great geniuses have the shortest biographies.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Genius always finds itself a century too early.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: All mankind love a lover.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Wherever the invitation of men or your own occasions lead you, speak the very truth, as your life and conscience teach it, and cheer the waiting, fainting hearts of men with new hope and new revelation.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Jesus Christ belonged to the true race of prophets. He saw with open eye the mystery of the soul. Drawn by its severe harmony, ravished with its beauty, he lived in it and had his being there. Alone in all history, he estimated the greatness of man.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The vegetable life does not content itself with casting from the flower or the tree a single seed, but it fills the air and earth with a prodigality of seeds, that, if thousands perish, thousands may plant themselves, that hundreds may come up, that tens may live to maturity; that, at least one may replace the parent.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Truth is the property of no individual but is the treasure of all men.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: If a man can... make a better mousetrap, the world will make a beaten path to his door.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man is relieved and gay when he has put his heart into his work and done his best; but what he has said or done otherwise shall give him no peace.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The value of a principle is the number of things it will explain.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The best effort of a fine person is felt after we have left their presence.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We are rich only through what we give, and poor only through what we refuse.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I think we must get rid of slavery, or we must get rid of freedom.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: When nature has work to be done, she creates a genius to do it.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: People that seem so glorious are all show; underneath they are like everyone else.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I have no hostility to nature, but a child's love to it. I expand and live in the warm day like corn and melons.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Each age, it is found, must write its own books; or rather, each generation for the next succeeding.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: If the tongue had not been framed for articulation, man would still be a beast in the forest.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: People seem not to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Fate is nothing but the deeds committed in a prior state of existence.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: In every society some men are born to rule, and some to advise.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is no chance and anarchy in the universe. All is system and gradation. Every god is there sitting in his sphere.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every natural fact is a symbol of some spiritual fact.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It was high counsel that I once heard given to a young person, 'always do what you are afraid to do.'
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Life is our dictionary.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We are by nature observers, and thereby learners. That is our permanent state.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nothing external to you has any power over you.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every man in his lifetime needs to thank his faults.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Our best thoughts come from others.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Cause and effect are two sides of one fact.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Pictures must not be too picturesque.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is always safety in valor.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Men's actions are too strong for them. Show me a man who has acted, and who has not been the victim and slave of his action.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Great hearts steadily send forth the secret forces that incessantly draw great events.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Use what language you will, you can never say anything but what you are.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We are wiser than we know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Philosophically considered, the universe is composed of Nature and the Soul. Strictly speaking, therefore, all that is separate from us, all which Philosophy distinguishes as the 'Not Me,' that is, both nature and art, all other men and my own body, must be ranked under this name, 'Nature.'
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We are born believing. A man bears beliefs as a tree bears apples.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is said that the world is in a state of bankruptcy, that the world owes the world more than the world can pay.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We are symbols, and inhabit symbols.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every actual State is corrupt. Good men must not obey laws too well.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The intuition of the moral sentiment is an insight of the perfection of the laws of the soul. These laws execute themselves. They are out of time, out of space, and not subject to circumstance.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: For every benefit you receive a tax is levied.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Friendship, like the immortality of the soul, is too good to be believed.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Give a boy address and accomplishments and you give him the mastery of palaces and fortunes where he goes.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Getting old is a fascination thing. The older you get, the older you want to get.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every book is a quotation; and every house is a quotation out of all forests, and mines, and stone quarries; and every man is a quotation from all his ancestors.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Our faith comes in moments; our vice is habitual.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The value of a dollar is social, as it is created by society.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There are other measures of self-respect for a man, than the number of clean shirts he puts on every day.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is a blessed necessity by which the interest of men is always driving them to the right; and, again, making all crime mean and ugly.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: If you would lift me up you must be on higher ground.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is one of the beautiful compensations in this life that no one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I have lost my mental faculties but am perfectly well.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is creative reading as well as creative writing.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Why need I volumes, if one word suffice?
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Character is always known. Thefts never enrich; alms never impoverish; murder will speak out of stone walls.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Build a better mousetrap and the world will beat a path to your door.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A more secret, sweet, and overpowering beauty appears to man when his heart and mind open to the sentiment of virtue.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The wave of evil washes all our institutions alike.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man is the whole encyclopedia of facts.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every man supposes himself not to be fully understood or appreciated.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Nature hates calculators.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: When we quarrel, how we wish we had been blameless.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The reason why men do not obey us, is because they see the mud at the bottom of our eye.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We do not yet possess ourselves, and we know at the same time that we are much more.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: People with great gifts are easy to find, but symmetrical and balanced ones never.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is more difference in the quality of our pleasures than in the amount.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every experiment, by multitudes or by individuals, that has a sensual and selfish aim, will fail.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: God screens us evermore from premature ideas.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every known fact in natural science was divined by the presentiment of somebody, before it was actually verified.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every man is a consumer, and ought to be a producer. He is by constitution expensive, and needs to be rich.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I have thought a sufficient measure of civilization is the influence of good women.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every burned book enlightens the world.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The greatest delight which the fields and woods minister is the suggestion of an occult relation.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The method of nature: who could ever analyze it?
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Before we acquire great power we must acquire wisdom to use it well.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Fine manners need the support of fine manners in others.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Happy is the hearing man; unhappy the speaking man.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is a fact often observed, that men have written good verses under the inspiration of passion, who cannot write well under other circumstances.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The smoothest curled courtier in the boudoirs of a palace has an animal nature, rude and aboriginal as a white bear.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Who hears me, who understands me, becomes mine, a possession for all time.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The secret of ugliness consists not in irregularity, but in being uninteresting.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Only as far as the masters of the world have called in nature to their aid, can they reach the height of magnificence. This is the meaning of their hanging-gardens, villas, garden-houses, islands, parks, and preserves.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: O Day of days when we can read! The reader and the book, either without the other is naught.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Revolutions go not backward.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Beauty is an outward gift, which is seldom despised, except by those to whom it has been refused.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Great men or men of great gifts you shall easily find, but symmetrical men never.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The search after the great men is the dream of youth, and the most serious occupation of manhood.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every spirit makes its house, and we can give a shrewd guess from the house to the inhabitant.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Man is priest, and scholar, and statesman, and producer, and soldier.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We are a puny and fickle folk. Avarice, hesitation, and following are our diseases.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every sentence spoken by Napoleon, and every line of his writing, deserves reading, as it is the sense of France.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A chief event of life is the day in which we have encountered a mind that startled us.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: One must be an inventor to read well. There is then creative reading as well as creative writing.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Preaching is the expression of the moral sentiment in application to the duties of life.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The revelation of thought takes men out of servitude into freedom.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: No man ever prayed heartily without learning something.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: As we are, so we associate. The good, by affinity, seek the good; the vile, by affinity, the vile. Thus of their own volition, souls proceed into Heaven, into Hell.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is a tendency for things to right themselves.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every fact is related on one side to sensation, and, on the other, to morals. The game of thought is, on the appearance of one of these two sides, to find the other: given the upper, to find the under side.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Can anything be so elegant as to have few wants, and to serve them one's self?
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is my desire, in the office of a Christian minister, to do nothing which I cannot do with my whole heart. Having said this, I have said all.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: People disparage knowing and the intellectual life, and urge doing. I am content with knowing, if only I could know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: In all my lectures, I have taught one doctrine, namely, the infinitude of the private man.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I used to think that the worst thing in life was to end up alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel alone.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: You're only given a little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: If women ran the world we wouldn't have wars, just intense negotiations every 28 days.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Never pick a fight with an ugly person, they've got nothing to lose.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Canada is like a loft apartment over a really great party.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Why do they call it rush hour when nothing moves?
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: People say satire is dead. It's not dead; it's alive and living in the White House.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Carpe per diem - seize the check.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: What's right is what's left if you do everything else wrong.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I'm sorry, if you were right, I'd agree with you.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Reality is just a crutch for people who can't cope with drugs.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: For me, comedy starts as a spew, a kind of explosion, and then you sculpt it from there, if at all. It comes out of a deeper, darker side. Maybe it comes from anger, because I'm outraged by cruel absurdities, the hypocrisy that exists everywhere, even within yourself, where it's hardest to see.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Comedy can be a cathartic way to deal with personal trauma.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: If Heaven exists, to know that there's laughter, that would be a great thing.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Reality: What a concept!
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Being in the same room with people and creating something together is a good thing.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Let's party!'
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I like my wine like my women - ready to pass out.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: If it's the Psychic Network why do they need a phone number?
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Comedy is acting out optimism.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: The Second Amendment says we have the right to bear arms, not to bear artillery.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Divorce is expensive. I used to joke they were going to call it 'all the money,' but they changed it to 'alimony.' It's ripping your heart out through your wallet.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Sometimes over things that I did, movies that didn't turn out very well - you go, 'Why did you do that?' But in the end, I can't regret them because I met amazing people. There was always something that was worth it.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: A woman would never make a nuclear bomb. They would never make a weapon that kills - no, no. They'd make a weapon that makes you feel bad for a while.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: The Statue of Liberty is no longer saying, 'Give me your poor, your tired, your huddled masses.' She's got a baseball bat and yelling, 'You want a piece of me?'
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: The idea of having a steady job is appealing.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: When Jonathan Winters died, it was like, 'Oh, man!' I knew he was frail, but I always thought he was going to last longer. I knew him as being really funny, but at the same time, he had a dark side.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Gentiles are people who eat mayonnaise for no reason.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: We had gay burglars the other night. They broke in and rearranged the furniture.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: We've had cloning in the South for years. It's called cousins.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Having George W. Bush giving a lecture on business ethics is like having a leper give you a facial, it just doesn't work!
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I bought one of the first Nintendo systems and brought that home, and we were playing 'Legend of Zelda' at the time, and it was addicting, and I was playing it for hours and hours and hours.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I do believe in love; it's wonderful - especially love third time around, it's even more precious; it's kind of amazing.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I basically started performing for my mother, going, 'Love me!' What drives you to perform is the need for that primal connection. When I was little, my mother was funny with me, and I started to be charming and funny for her, and I learned that by being entertaining, you make a connection with another person.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: It's hard when you read an article saying bad things about you. It is as if someone is sticking a knife on your heart. But I am the harshest critic of my work.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I don't do well with snakes and I can't dance.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Cricket is basically baseball on valium.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: You'll notice that Nancy Reagan never drinks water when Ronnie speaks.
Author: Robin Williams

Author: Robin Williams

Quote: The improv, sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't, but when it does, it's like open-field running.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: When you look at Prince Charles, don't you think that someone in the Royal family knew someone in the Royal family?
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Do I perform sometimes in a manic style? Yes. Am I manic all the time? No. Do I get sad? Oh yeah. Does it hit me hard? Oh yeah.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: You can start any 'Monty Python' routine and people finish it for you. Everyone knows it like shorthand.

Quote: The Russians love Brooke Shields because her eyebrows remind them of Leonid Brezhnev.

Quote: My mother's idea of natural childbirth was giving birth without makeup. She was hyper-positive - the world is a wonderful place, rainbows and unicorns. If you said anything contrary to her, you were basically exiled.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I write on big yellow legal pads - ideas in outline form when I'm doing stand-up and stuff. It's vivid that way. I can't type it into an iPad - I think that would put a filter into the process.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: One of my favourite actors of all time, although he doesn't necessarily play villains, is Peter Lorre.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I think it's great when stories are dark and strange and weirdly personal.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I loved school, maybe too much, really. I was summa cum laude in high school. I was driven that way.

Quote: You have this idea that you'd better keep working otherwise people will forget. And that was dangerous.

Quote: I don't have a college degree, and my father didn't have a college degree, so when my son, Zachary, graduated from college, I said, 'My boy's got learnin'!'

Quote: My style is bad white-boy dancing. I can do swing a little bit, but nothing beyond that. My solo dancing is sad. I use my arms, badly.

Quote: I believe Ronald Reagan can make this country what it once was... a large Arctic region covered with ice.

Quote: I loved running, but all of a sudden everything hurt so much. I started cycling when Zelda was born.

Quote: I left school and couldn't find acting work, so I started going to clubs where you could do stand-up. I've always improvised, and stand-up was this great release. All of a sudden, it was just me and the audience.

Quote: I think 'Dead Poets' was probably my favorite, just to get started with the idea of doing a movie that people treated as more than a movie.

Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I was only a leading man for a minute; now I'm a character actor.

Quote: I've had a lot of people tell me they watched 'Old Dogs' with their kids and had a good time.

Quote: I enjoy performing for heavily armed people. It's easier than going to Georgia.
Author: Robin Williams

Author: Robin Williams

Quote: When the media ask George W. Bush a question, he answers, 'Can I use a lifeline?'

Quote: I have an idea for a movie called 'The Walken Dead' which is about a town where, instead of zombies, everyone becomes Chris Walken.

Quote: I knew Matt Damon and Ben Affleck were really talented. As actors, they were both studly young men, and they had great writers' chops.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Look at the walls of Pompeii. That's what got the internet started.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Performing comedy in San Francisco to begin with is pretty wild. You've got to - you've got the human game preserve to play off of. And it's a lot of great characters everywhere. You work off that, and then you play the rooms, and eventually you get to a point where you're playing a club that is a comedy club, with other comics.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: I started doing comedy because that was the only stage that I could find. It was the pure idea of being on stage. That was the only thing that interested me, along with learning the craft and working, and just being in productions with people.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: The bad thing about being a famous comedian is that every now and then someone approaches me to tell an old joke. Don't tell me jokes - I have that. People also say the weirdest things, sometimes sarcastic things, and even evil things. They like to provoke to get a reaction.

Quote: The 'Aladdin' thing - that's not work; that's just fun. Three days in the recording studio going mad, then the animators do all the work. Not a bad way to cash a large check, my friend.

Quote: I love kids, but they are a tough audience.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Winning an Oscar is an honor, but, between you and me, it does not makes things easier.

Quote: There's a show in America where all these people compete with ferrets, and they don't even do anything. They basically just hold them up, and if they don't bite you, they might win.

Quote: In America they really do mythologise people when they die.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: The essential truth is that sometimes you're worried that they'll find out it's a fluke, that you don't really have it. You've lost the muse or - the worst dread - you never had it at all. I went through all that madness early on.

Quote: I have a difficult time doing an Irish accent; even now, it kind of fades slowly into Scottish.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Acting is different from stand-up. It gives you this ability to enter into another character, to create another person.

Quote: With film roles, it just has to be a character either I haven't done before, or a role with somebody really interesting or with an interesting person or group of people.

Quote: We sleep in separate rooms, we have dinner apart, we take separate vacations - we're doing everything we can to keep our marriage together.

Quote: I told my psychiatrist that everyone hates me. He said I was being ridiculous - everyone hasn't met me yet.

Quote: I looked up my family tree and found out I was the sap.

Quote: I told my dentist my teeth are going yellow. he told me to wear a brown tie.

Quote: I was so ugly my mother used to feed me with a sling shot.

Quote: The way my luck is running, if I was a politician I would be honest.

Quote: My wife met me at the door the other night in a sexy negligee. Unfortunately, she was just coming home.

Quote: We might come closer to balancing the Budget if all of us lived closer to the Commandments and the Golden Rule.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: We're in greater danger today than we were the day after Pearl Harbor. Our military is absolutely incapable of defending this country.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Regimes planted by bayonets do not take root.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: The thought of being President frightens me and I do not think I want the job.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Of the four wars in my lifetime, none came about because the U.S. was too strong.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Pray as though everything depended on God. Work as though everything depended on you.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: It was pride that changed angels into devils; it is humility that makes men as angels.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Resentment is like drinking poison and waiting for the other person to die.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Men go abroad to wonder at the heights of mountains, at the huge waves of the sea, at the long courses of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motions of the stars, and they pass by themselves without wondering.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Give me chastity and continence, but not yet.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: God loves each of us as if there were only one of us.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Oh Lord, give me chastity, but do not give it yet.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: What then is time? If no one asks me, I know what it is. If I wish to explain it to him who asks, I do not know.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: In doing what we ought we deserve no praise, because it is our duty.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Punishment is justice for the unjust.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: He who created us without our help will not save us without our consent.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Humility is the foundation of all the other virtues hence, in the soul in which this virtue does not exist there cannot be any other virtue except in mere appearance.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Complete abstinence is easier than perfect moderation.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: O Lord, help me to be pure, but not yet.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: God had one son on earth without sin, but never one without suffering.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Seek not to understand that you may believe, but believe that you may understand.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: He that is jealous is not in love.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost, and was found, is saved from being lost again.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Thou hast created us for Thyself, and our heart is not quiet until it rests in Thee.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: If you believe what you like in the gospels, and reject what you don't like, it is not the gospel you believe, but yourself.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: In the absence of justice, what is sovereignty but organized robbery?
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The greatest evil is physical pain.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Since you cannot do good to all, you are to pay special attention to those who, by the accidents of time, or place, or circumstances, are brought into closer connection with you.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: O Holy Spirit, descend plentifully into my heart. Enlighten the dark corners of this neglected dwelling and scatter there Thy cheerful beams.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Do you wish to be great? Then begin by being. Do you desire to construct a vast and lofty fabric? Think first about the foundations of humility. The higher your structure is to be, the deeper must be its foundation.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Love is the beauty of the soul.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The same thing which is now called Christian religion existed among the ancients. They have begun to call 'Christian' the true religion which existed before.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Love, and do what you like.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The desire is thy prayers; and if thy desire is without ceasing, thy prayer will also be without ceasing. The continuance of your longing is the continuance of your prayer.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: I have read in Plato and Cicero sayings that are wise and very beautiful; but I have never read in either of them: Come unto me all ye that labor and are heavy laden.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Grant what thou commandest and then command what thou wilt.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: If we live good lives, the times are also good. As we are, such are the times.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: This is the very perfection of a man, to find out his own imperfections.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The purpose of all wars, is peace.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: God judged it better to bring good out of evil than to suffer no evil to exist.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: He fashioned hell for the inquisitive.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Thou must be emptied of that wherewith thou art full, that thou mayest be filled with that whereof thou art empty.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Beauty is indeed a good gift of God; but that the good may not think it a great good, God dispenses it even to the wicked.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Repentant tears wash out the stain of guilt.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Charity is no substitute for justice withheld.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The confession of evil works is the first beginning of good works.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The words printed here are concepts. You must go through the experiences.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Hear the other side.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: There is something in humility which strangely exalts the heart.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: If two friends ask you to judge a dispute, don't accept, because you will lose one friend; on the other hand, if two strangers come with the same request, accept because you will gain one friend.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: He that is kind is free, though he is a slave; he that is evil is a slave, though he be a king.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: God is best known in not knowing him.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: To seek the highest good is to live well.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Passion is the evil in adultery. If a man has no opportunity of living with another man's wife, but if it is obvious for some reason that he would like to do so, and would do so if he could, he is no less guilty than if he was caught in the act.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: It seems to me that an unjust law is no law at all.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: It is not the punishment but the cause that makes the martyr.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Find out how much God has given you and from it take what you need; the remainder is needed by others.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Indeed, man wishes to be happy even when he so lives as to make happiness impossible.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: What I needed most was to love and to be loved, eager to be caught. Happily I wrapped those painful bonds around me; and sure enough, I would be lashed with the red-hot pokers or jealousy, by suspicions and fear, by burst of anger and quarrels.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: I found thee not, O Lord, without, because I erred in seeking thee without that wert within.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: We make ourselves a ladder out of our vices if we trample the vices themselves underfoot.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: We cannot pass our guardian angel's bounds, resigned or sullen, he will hear our sighs.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The soul, which is spirit, can not dwell in dust; it is carried along to dwell in the blood.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: No eulogy is due to him who simply does his duty and nothing more.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: To many, total abstinence is easier than perfect moderation.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The honors of this world, what are they but puff, and emptiness, and peril of falling?
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: By faithfulness we are collected and wound up into unity within ourselves, whereas we had been scattered abroad in multiplicity.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Who can map out the various forces at play in one soul? Man is a great depth, O Lord. The hairs of his head are easier by far to count than his feeling, the movements of his heart.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: He who labours, prays.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Bad company is like a nail driven into a post, which, after the first and second blow, may be drawn out with little difficulty; but being once driven up to the head, the pincers cannot take hold to draw it out, but which can only be done by the destruction of the wood.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: A thing is not necessarily true because badly uttered, nor false because spoken magnificently.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: My mind withdrew its thoughts from experience, extracting itself from the contradictory throng of sensuous images, that it might find out what that light was wherein it was bathed... And thus, with the flash of one hurried glance, it attained to the vision of That Which Is.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The verdict of the world is conclusive.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Blessedness consists in the accomplishment of our desires, and in our having only regular desires.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: This world's a bubble.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: If we did not have rational souls, we would not be able to believe.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: We make a ladder for ourselves of our vices, if we trample those same vices underfoot.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: To abstain from sin when one can no longer sin is to be forsaken by sin, not to forsake it.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Will is to grace as the horse is to the rider.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Custom is second nature.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Don't you believe that there is in man a deep so profound as to be hidden even to him in whom it is?
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The spiritual virtue of a sacrament is like light; although it passes among the impure, it is not polluted.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: There is no possible source of evil except good.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: If I am given a formula, and I am ignorant of its meaning, it cannot teach me anything, but if I already know it what does the formula teach me?
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: We are certainly in a common class with the beasts; every action of animal life is concerned with seeking bodily pleasure and avoiding pain.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: I don't do drugs. I am drugs.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: There is only one difference between a madman and me. The madman thinks he is sane. I know I am mad.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: The only difference between me and a madman is that I'm not mad.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Surrealism is destructive, but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: There are some days when I think I'm going to die from an overdose of satisfaction.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: The secret of my influence has always been that it remained secret.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: The first man to compare the cheeks of a young woman to a rose was obviously a poet; the first to repeat it was possibly an idiot.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Mistakes are almost always of a sacred nature. Never try to correct them. On the contrary: rationalize them, understand them thoroughly. After that, it will be possible for you to sublimate them.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Those who do not want to imitate anything, produce nothing.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: The difference between false memories and true ones is the same as for jewels: it is always the false ones that look the most real, the most brilliant.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Take me, I am the drug; take me, I am hallucinogenic.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Painting is an infinitely minute part of my personality.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Let my enemies devour each other.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: I do not paint a portrait to look like the subject, rather does the person grow to look like his portrait.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: In order to acquire a growing and lasting respect in society, it is a good thing, if you possess great talent, to give, early in your youth, a very hard kick to the right shin of the society that you love. After that, be a snob.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Each morning when I awake, I experience again a supreme pleasure - that of being Salvador Dali.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: I seated ugliness on my knee, and almost immediately grew tired of it.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Don't bother about being modern. Unfortunately it is the one thing that, whatever you do, you cannot avoid.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: At the age of six I wanted to be a cook. At seven I wanted to be Napoleon. And my ambition has been growing steadily ever since.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: What is a television apparatus to man, who has only to shut his eyes to see the most inaccessible regions of the seen and the never seen, who has only to imagine in order to pierce through walls and cause all the planetary Baghdads of his dreams to rise from the dust.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Liking money like I like it, is nothing less than mysticism. Money is a glory.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Wars have never hurt anybody except the people who die.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Progressive art can assist people to learn not only about the objective forces at work in the society in which they live, but also about the intensely social character of their interior lives. Ultimately, it can propel people toward social emancipation.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: I have Dalinian thought: the one thing the world will never have enough of is the outrageous.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Instead of stubbornly attempting to use surrealism for purposes of subversion, it is necessary to try to make of surrealism something as solid, complete and classic as the works of museums.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: It is good taste, and good taste alone, that possesses the power to sterilize and is always the first handicap to any creative functioning.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Democratic societies are unfit for the publication of such thunderous revelations as I am in the habit of making.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: We must always remember that the Chinese revolution was not a peasant's revolution, but one of the extreme Right.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: If it's flipping hamburgers at McDonald's, be the best hamburger flipper in the world. Whatever it is you do you have to master your craft.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: If the ride is more fly, then you must buy.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: Sometimes a loss is the best thing that can happen. It teaches you what you should have done next time.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: What people don't understand is joining a gang ain't bad, it's cool, it's fine. When you in the hood, joining a gang it's cool because all your friends are in the gang, all your family's in the gang. We're not just killing people every night, we're just hanging out, having a good time.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: If you stop at general math, you're only going to make general math money.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: Well, hip-hop is what makes the world go around.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: You've got to always go back in time if you want to move forward.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: When I'm not longer rapping, I want to open up an ice cream parlor and call myself Scoop Dogg.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: Britney would make a better prostitute than Christina. She's thicker.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: It's so easy for a kid to join a gang, to do drugs... we should make it that easy to be involved in football and academics.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: That's how we do it in the black community; we give back to the people who made us who we are. We never forget that.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I like going to areas where the murder rate is high and dropping it.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: The most important decision I've made in business? The choices of people I have around me. When I first started I brought everybody with me, my homies from the neighborhood, criminals. I just said, 'Come on everybody, we made it.' Then I had to realize we didn't make it. I made it.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: To me, the Seventies were very inspirational and very influential... With my whole persona as Snoop Dogg, as a person, as a rapper. I just love the Seventies style, the way all the players dressed nice, you know, kept their hair looking good, drove sharp cars and they talked real slick.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: Snoop Scorsese, that's my director name.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: Barack Obama makes me feel good to be a black man.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I used to get stressed out all the time when I thought winning was important. I wanted to try to win and help my kids win. Once I figured out it wasn't about winning or losing, it was about teaching these kids about being men, that's when I started to relax.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: On 'Old School,' I was not an actor, I was Snoop Dogg, so I came to the set with a whole different vibe, and a different crew of people. And on 'Starsky and Hutch,' I was more of an actor. I wasn't Snoop Dogg, the rapper.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: In the black culture, certain kids are given nicknames that they roll with forever; the nicknames outweigh their real names. I'm one of those scenarios.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: It's hard to say goodbye to the streets. It's all how you do it. You can pass by and say, 'What's happening?' and keep it moving, but it's a certain element that'll never be able to roll with you once you get to this level, because that's the separation of it all.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I just change with the times. I really don't have a say in what's going on. Music was here before me.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: My liberty is about living. It's about spreading more love. Even though I was always a peaceful, loving individual, my music sometimes didn't reflect that. But now it's different. My music is reflecting the way I feel.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I'm looking for a deal from one of you TV networks to give Snoop Dogg his own hood TV show where I can find America's hottest hood artists.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: Women are in a position now to voice their opinion... women are getting empowered. The more power they get, the more voice they get to shift certain things around. Now I have a daughter, I understand. When I didn't have a daughter, I didn't understand.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: An older guy, he's going to show you things that a young man can't show you. He's going to show you how to stay alive. He's going to show you how to turn corners where your young friends will show you how to turn right into that wall, you know what I'm saying?
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I love Benny Hill. He one of my favourites of aaall time. Like, the way Benny did it, he was just amazing. Just seeing how he put songs together and comedy and the timing and the sketches. He was way ahead of his time.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I want to write, direct, produce, but in steps. I want to take steps. I don't want to just jump in because I sold a lot of records and just feel like I can jump into the movie world. Naw, I want to learn the movie world like I learned the music world.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: There's so much that I want to do. I feel like I'm the Magic Johnson of rap. You know, Magic was great on the basketball court, but he's bigger as a businessman.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: When I heard the royal family wanted to have me perform in celebration of Prince William's marriage, I knew I had to give them a little something. 'Wet' is the perfect anthem for Prince William or any playa to get the club smokin'.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: The red carpet is a beautiful situation for people. I think everybody appreciates it and loves it and honors it. Nobody really acts a fool because they know this is a one-time thing.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: The 'American Idol' and 'X Factor' shows, they're great shows. But I think I need to make a show like that, directed straight to the hood, to the artists that don't get the attention, that don't have the money to make themselves representable.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I love making music and I'm falling in love with making records, so it's like having two girlfriends. But I can handle it.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: My younger son, Cordell, aka Lil Snoop, loves me like a fan loves Snoop Dogg. He's inspired by making me happy. My older son, Corde, aka Spank, does everything I say, with effort and determination - but he does it for himself. He gets his thrill out of seeing his own results on the football field.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: A lot of brands, you can't touch them. When you're dealing with Snoop Dogg, he brings you closer to the brand and it feels like it's a part of you.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I was like the class clown in school so I guess I would say I did like the attention. In church I did a lot of plays, my mother made me play characters, do a lot of drama and acting, trying to become someone else. So it helped me create who I am, to create Snoop Dogg.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: Look at music for what it's worth around the world and not just America. In other countries, people are still buying CDs and going to record stores. But in America, it's all about digital. The game is breaking down. But, look at me, you need to know how to play the game the right way.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I learned how to take other people's mechanisms of promoting their stuff through me as opposed to promoting my own stuff, as far as getting Snoop DeVilles, SnoopDeGrills, Snoop Doggy Dogg biscuits, Snoop Dogg record label, Snoop Dogg bubble gum, Snoop Youth Football League.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: I used to be focused on being the dopest rapper in the game, and then once that became what I was, I wanted something different, and I wanted to become the best businessman in the game. I wanted to learn how to master the business like I mastered the rap.
Author: Snoop Dogg

Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Author: Socrates

Quote: By all means, marry. If you get a good wife, you'll become happy; if you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
Author: Socrates

Quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
Author: Socrates

Quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
Author: Socrates

Quote: All men's souls are immortal, but the souls of the righteous are immortal and divine.
Author: Socrates

Quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Be as you wish to seem.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Wisdom begins in wonder.
Author: Socrates

Quote: From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I was really too honest a man to be a politician and live.
Author: Socrates

Quote: A system of morality which is based on relative emotional values is a mere illusion, a thoroughly vulgar conception which has nothing sound in it and nothing true.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings, so that you shall gain easily what others have labored hard for.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I know nothing except the fact of my ignorance.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Once made equal to man, woman becomes his superior.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Worthless people live only to eat and drink; people of worth eat and drink only to live.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Let him that would move the world first move himself.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The end of life is to be like God, and the soul following God will be like Him.
Author: Socrates

Quote: He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.
Author: Socrates

Quote: An honest man is always a child.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
Author: Socrates

Quote: No evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death. He and his are not neglected by the gods.
Author: Socrates

Quote: It is not living that matters, but living rightly.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
Author: Socrates

Quote: One who is injured ought not to return the injury, for on no account can it be right to do an injustice; and it is not right to return an injury, or to do evil to any man, however much we have suffered from him.
Author: Socrates

Quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
Author: Socrates

Quote: As to marriage or celibacy, let a man take which course he will, he will be sure to repent.
Author: Socrates

Quote: If all misfortunes were laid in one common heap whence everyone must take an equal portion, most people would be contented to take their own and depart.
Author: Socrates

Quote: If a man is proud of his wealth, he should not be praised until it is known how he employs it.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Ordinary people seem not to realize that those who really apply themselves in the right way to philosophy are directly and of their own accord preparing themselves for dying and death.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The poets are only the interpreters of the gods.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Beauty is the bait which with delight allures man to enlarge his kind.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I only wish that ordinary people had an unlimited capacity for doing harm; then they might have an unlimited power for doing good.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Where there is reverence there is fear, but there is not reverence everywhere that there is fear, because fear presumably has a wider extension than reverence.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Don't forget to love yourself.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations - one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it - you will regret both.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Once you label me you negate me.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: To dare is to lose one's footing momentarily. Not to dare is to lose oneself.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Our life always expresses the result of our dominant thoughts.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: The tyrant dies and his rule is over, the martyr dies and his rule begins.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Boredom is the root of all evil - the despairing refusal to be oneself.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: The highest and most beautiful things in life are not to be heard about, nor read about, nor seen but, if one will, are to be lived.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: What is a poet? An unhappy person who conceals profound anguish in his heart but whose lips are so formed that as sighs and cries pass over them they sound like beautiful music.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Face the facts of being what you are, for that is what changes what you are.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Patience is necessary, and one cannot reap immediately where one has sown.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Love is all, it gives all, and it takes all.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Personality is only ripe when a man has made the truth his own.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Marriage brings one into fatal connection with custom and tradition, and traditions and customs are like the wind and weather, altogether incalculable.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: It is so hard to believe because it is so hard to obey.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Be that self which one truly is.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Purity of heart is to will one thing.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Life has its own hidden forces which you can only discover by living.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: It belongs to the imperfection of everything human that man can only attain his desire by passing through its opposite.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: It seems essential, in relationships and all tasks, that we concentrate only on what is most significant and important.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: God creates out of nothing. Wonderful you say. Yes, to be sure, but he does what is still more wonderful: he makes saints out of sinners.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: There is nothing with which every man is so afraid as getting to know how enormously much he is capable of doing and becoming.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: People understand me so poorly that they don't even understand my complaint about them not understanding me.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Faith is the highest passion in a human being. Many in every generation may not come that far, but none comes further.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard
