Quote: One of the most pervasive political visions of our time is the vision of liberals as compassionate and conservatives as less caring.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: If you want to get each individual's honest opinion, you don't want that opinion to be influenced by others who are present, much less allow a group to coordinate what they are going to say.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: The time is long overdue to stop looking for progress through racial or ethnic leaders. Such leaders have too many incentives to promote polarizing attitudes and actions that are counterproductive for minorities and disastrous for the country.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Actually lowering the cost of insurance would be accomplished by such things as making it harder for lawyers to win frivolous lawsuits against insurance companies.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Mystical references to society and its programs to help may warm the hearts of the gullible but what it really means is putting more power in the hands of bureaucrats.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Groups that rose from poverty to prosperity seldom did so by having their own racial or ethnic leaders to follow.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Creating whole departments of ethnic, gender, and other 'studies' was part of the price of academic peace. All too often, these 'studies' are about propaganda rather than serious education.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Those parts of history that would undermine the vision of the Left - which prevails in our education system from elementary school to postgraduate study - are not likely to get much attention.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Even the Soviet Union, with its huge nuclear arsenal, was a threat that could be deterred by the prospect of retaliation. But suicide bombers cannot be deterred. They can only be annihilated - preemptively and unilaterally, if necessary.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: All of us should be on guard against beliefs that flatter ourselves. At the very least, we should check such beliefs against facts.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Few professors would dare to publish research or teach a course debunking the claims made in various ethnic, gender, or other 'studies' courses.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Over the generations, black leaders have ranged from noble souls to shameless charlatans.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: There is no question that liberals do an impressive job of expressing concern for blacks. But do the intentions expressed in their words match the actual consequences of their deeds?
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Many people, including some conservatives, have been very impressed with how brainy the president and his advisers are. But that is not quite as reassuring as it might seem.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: The Congressional Budget Office has been embarrassed repeatedly by making projections based on the assumption that tax revenues and tax rates move in the same direction.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: In various countries and times, leaders of groups that lagged behind, economically and educationally, have taught their followers to blame all their problems on other people - and to hate those other people.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: I suspect that even most conservatives would prefer to live in the kind of world conjured up in the liberals' imagination rather than in the kind of world we are in fact stuck with.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: It is hard to read a newspaper or watch a television newscast without encountering someone who has come up with a new 'solution' to society's 'problems.'
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: Just what is it that academics have to fear if they stand up for common decency, instead of letting campus barbarians run amok?
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: For the record, I don't worship the devil. I just hate religion.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I think I'm cool. That's all that matters.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: If the world was ending, I think I would grab some Cinnamon Toast Crunch, a bunch of water, and I'd probably just... I'd probably go crazy.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: Youth is something I never wanna take for granted. I just want to smile and live life.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I don't like people around me sad. I like making people happy.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I never want to grow up.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm an optimistic guy. I'm one of those big dreamers. I'm one of those kids with that annoying imagination.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm not into fashion, but I like design. I wear the same shoes every day.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm a pretty nice dude. I have fun, and people take it the wrong way.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm not hip-hop. I'm Tyler.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: Somebody called me a homophobe. I'm not homophobic.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm not a follower. I'm a leader. And anyone who speaks their mind is always criticised.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I wasn't shy, but I was really hyper. Nobody got my sense of humor. I was a black skater kid.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: My lyrics aren't offensive. Some people find everything offensive.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I don't have a therapist, so I use me as my own therapist when I'm making the music.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I want to take Justin Bieber for a month and just lock him up in a cage where we sit and make music. He's one of the most successful people in the world, but his music could be so much tighter.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I never had a drink in my life. I don't smoke or anything.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I tweet early in the morning when I wake up or late at night just to let you know that I have a show or what's on my mind, and that's it. I hate Snapchat and all of that. It's making kids so stupid.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: To me, Sid Vicious is cool. Super chill.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I don't really listen to rap; I just like to rap.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: The thing is, I make music I like. So it's just weird if someone says they don't like it.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I try to tell all the - not even the kids, even people older than me - to just be themselves. Don't wear what I wear 'cause I wear it; wear what you like.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm a big 'Goosebumps' fan - 'Revenge of the Lawn Gnomes.' My favorites are the pick-your-own-death ones.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I just live life. I grew up in a Christian family, but, you know, the way Mom brought me up is to, you know, do you, to always be yourself.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: Humans have voids, and you need things to fill voids... I didn't have a dad to fill that male model void, so when I heard Eminem or freaking seen Dave Chapelle, that's what I gravitated to.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I like my raps, but I'm never too happy with some of 'em because I feel like they could be better.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I don't like being put in a box. I just make music, you know?
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm like a big 10-year-old when I'm on stage. I just go up there and do whatever I think is cool at the moment.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I want to make as much money as I possibly can so that when my day comes, my mother and sister is fine. My close friends are fine. They don't have to worry about anything ever again.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I want to design jewelry for girls and guys... I'ma spread it out, but I'ma design, probably when I'm just designing furniture and buildings, I'll probably being the jewelry thing, too.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I'm hungry for VMAs and Grammys. That's my main goal.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I really want to sing, but my tone of voice is really too deep to do what I want.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: Rap is really just too conventional. Everybody does the same thing. No one ever pushes the box.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I think, if I had a dad, I would have went the normal college route. I'm so stoked my life panned out how it was.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: Usually, when I'm rappin', I'm creating a big story or a concept song that sounds like a movie to me.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: Hawthorne sucks... It's a crazy place, and I'm happy that I was the weird one that got out.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: I want to do films and have my name mentioned next to Wes Anderson and Quentin Tarantino. I don't want my name mentioned next to other rappers at all.
Author: Tyler, The Creator

Quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt.
Author: Unknown

Quote: In a time of universal deceit - telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.
Author: Unknown

Quote: A picture is worth a thousand words.
Author: Unknown

Quote: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The hottest place in Hell is reserved for those who remain neutral in times of great moral conflict.
Author: Unknown

Quote: You should examine yourself daily. If you find faults, you should correct them. When you find none, you should try even harder.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
Author: Unknown

Quote: A man who stands for nothing will fall for anything.
Author: Unknown

Quote: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
Author: Unknown

Quote: A true conservationist is a man who knows that the world is not given by his fathers, but borrowed from his children.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Never ascribe to malice that which is adequately explained by incompetence.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
Author: Unknown

Quote: There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Life is tough, but it's tougher if you're stupid.
Author: Unknown

Quote: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Women are like teabags. We don't know our true strength until we are in hot water!
Author: Unknown

Quote: Anytime you see a turtle up on top of a fence post, you know he had some help.
Author: Unknown

Quote: I never drink water because of the disgusting things that fish do in it.
Author: Unknown

Quote: True change takes place in the imagination.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Time spent with cats is never wasted.
Author: Unknown

Quote: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
Author: Unknown

Quote: However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.
Author: Unknown

Quote: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
Author: Unknown

Quote: All warfare is based on deception.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words.
Author: Unknown

Quote: I freed a thousand slaves I could have freed a thousand more if only they knew they were slaves.
Author: Unknown

Quote: When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when a son gives to his father, both cry.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources.
Author: Unknown

Quote: If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough, it will be believed.
Author: Unknown

Quote: It's a damn poor mind that can only think of one way to spell a word.
Author: Unknown

Quote: He was a wise man who invented beer.
Author: Unknown

Quote: If you bring forth what is within you, what you bring forth will save you. If you do not bring forth what is within you, what you do not bring forth will destroy you.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Character is the result of a system of stereotyped principles.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Large skepticism leads to large understanding. Small skepticism leads to small understanding. No skepticism leads to no understanding.
Author: Unknown

Quote: If you're not first, you're last.
Author: Unknown

Quote: There is no such thing as a good tax.
Author: Unknown

Quote: If you done it, it ain't bragging.
Author: Unknown

Quote: It is a damn poor mind indeed which can't think of at least two ways to spell any word.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Less is more, unless you're Al Gore.
Author: Unknown

Quote: I wish I could write as mysterious as a cat.
Author: Unknown

Quote: As long as you live keep smiling because it brightens everybody's day.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Statistics are used much like a drunk uses a lamppost: for support, not illumination.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Don't let the winds blow your dreams away... or steal your faith in God.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Losing feels worse than winning feels good.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Good is not good when better is expected.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Andre Dawson has a bruised knee and is listed as day-to-day. Aren't we all?
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: The game is just one long conversation, and I'm anticipating that, and I will say things like 'Did you know that?' or 'You're probably wondering why.' I'm really just conversing rather than just doing play-by-play. I never thought of myself as having a style. I don't use key words. And the best thing I do? I shut up.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: The roar of the crowd has always been the sweetest music. It's intoxicating.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: It's a wonderful feeling to be a bridge to the past and to unite generations. The sport of baseball does that, and I am just a part of it.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Be a bobbed cork: When you are pushed down, bob up.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I've told several writers this, and, again, I get back to it, but if you want to make God smile, tell him your plans.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Thank you for sneaking your transistor under the pillow as you grew up loving the Tigers. God has a new adventure for me.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: A man really determines himself by what he does.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: That really is my trademark. Day to day, week in, week out. If something happens and the crowd roars, I shut up.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I'm going to sit back, light up, and hope I don't chew the cigarette to pieces.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Almost all of us growing up have played baseball on some level. It has an inside track with people. It has a unifying effect.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: It's easier to pick off a fast runner than to pick off a lazy runner.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I guess my thermometer for my baseball fever is still a goose bump.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: It's a wonderful feeling being a bridge to the past and unite generations.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I try to call the play as quickly as I possibly can and then shut up and let the crowd roar because, to me, the crowd is the most wonderful thing in the whole world when it's making noise.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: To be honest, I've never been interested in how many games I've done and seen. It doesn't mean anything to anybody. All I know is I'm eternally grateful for having been allowed to work so many games.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: In all honesty, once you become a professional, number one, you're no longer a fan. I don't root for the Dodgers, really. I just try to do the game as best I can. And the winning and the losing will take care of itself.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: You can almost taste the pressure now.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: It's a great time of the year... if you can stand it.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I think when I first started, I tried to make believe I was in the ballpark, sitting next to somebody and just talking. And if you go to a ballgame, and you sit there, you're not going to talk pitches for three hours.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: One of my favorite expressions ever uttered by a player is Roy Campanella's line about how, in order to be a major-league player, you have to have a lot of little boy in you.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I really love baseball. The guys and the game, and I love the challenge of describing things. The only thing I hate - and I know you have to be realistic and pay the bills in this life - is the loneliness on the road.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: When I was very small, maybe 8 years old, we had a big radio that stood on four legs, and it had a cross piece underneath it, and I used to take a pillow and crawl under the radio.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I'm not a military general, a business guru, not a philosopher or author. It's only me.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: If I can get a story about a player, I would give you a ship load of numbers, batting averages and all just for that one precious story. That's the kind of thing that I love to do.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: If I categorized home runs that I've seen, without a doubt the monumental one is Henry's... but I've seen a lot of classic, great home runs. Gibson's was probably the most theatrical home run I've ever seen.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I don't like to be alone, but I do cherish the moments that I'm alone with a good book.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: On radio, you're in your own little world. Every time I'd be doing a possible no-hitter - I think I've done something like 25 no-hitters and a couple of perfect games - I would always put the date on the tape. Not for me, but for the player, so that 25 or 30 years later when he's playing it for his kids or grandkids, you have that date.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Practice does not make perfect. Only perfect practice makes perfect.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Individual commitment to a group effort - that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Show me a good loser, and I'll show you a loser.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Leaders are made, they are not born. They are made by hard effort, which is the price which all of us must pay to achieve any goal that is worthwhile.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The achievements of an organization are the results of the combined effort of each individual.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Fatigue makes cowards of us all.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Winning is not a sometime thing; it's an all the time thing. You don't win once in a while... you don't do things right once in a while... you do them right all the time. Winning is habit.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Football is like life - it requires perseverance, self-denial, hard work, sacrifice, dedication and respect for authority.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: We didn't lose the game; we just ran out of time.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The quality of a person's life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Winning is habit. Unfortunately, so is losing.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Winning isn't everything, it's the only thing.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The greatest accomplishment is not in never falling, but in rising again after you fall.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: If you aren't fired with enthusiasm, you will be fired with enthusiasm.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: If it doesn't matter who wins or loses, then why do they keep score?
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Success demands singleness of purpose.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: There is no room for second place. There is only one place in my game and that is first place. I have finished second twice in my time at Green Bay and I never want to finish second again.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Once you agree upon the price you and your family must pay for success, it enables you to ignore the minor hurts, the opponent's pressure, and the temporary failures.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: It's easy to have faith in yourself and have discipline when you're a winner, when you're number one. What you got to have is faith and discipline when you're not a winner.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: If you can accept losing, you can't win.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The real glory is being knocked to your knees and then coming back. That's real glory. That's the essence of it.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: People who work together will win, whether it be against complex football defenses, or the problems of modern society.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Battles are won in the hearts of men.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: We run to win, not just to be in the race.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: You don't do things right once in a while. You do things right all the time.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Coaches who can outline plays on a black board are a dime a dozen. The ones who win get inside their player and motivate.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Mental toughness is spartanism with qualities of sacrifice, self-denial, dedication. It is fearlessness, and it is love.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Football is a great deal like life in that it teaches that work, sacrifice, perseverance, competitive drive, selflessness and respect for authority is the price that each and every one of us must pay to achieve any goal that is worthwhile.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Teamwork is what the Green Bay Packers were all about. They didn't do it for individual glory. They did it because they loved one another.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Some people try to find things in this game that don't exist but football is only two things - blocking and tackling.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The leader can never close the gap between himself and the group. If he does, he is no longer what he must be. He must walk a tightrope between the consent he must win and the control he must exert.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Character is just another word for having a perfectly disciplined and educated will. A person can make his own character by blending these elements with an intense desire to achieve excellence. Everyone is different in what I will call magnitude, but the capacity to achieve character is still the same.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: A school without football is in danger of deteriorating into a medieval study hall.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The difference between men is in energy, in the strong will, in the settled purpose and in the invincible determination.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: I have finished second twice in my time at Green Bay, and I don't ever want to finish second again. There is a second place bowl game, but it is a game for losers played by losers. It is and always has been an American zeal to be first in anything we do, and to win, and to win, and to win.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: A disciplined person is one who follows the will of the one who gives the orders.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Some of us will do our jobs well and some will not, but we will be judged by only one thing-the result.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: There is something good in men that really yearn for discipline.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Unless a man believes in himself and makes a total commitment to his career and puts everything he has into it - his mind, his body, his heart - what's life worth to him?
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: If you can shrug off a loss, you can't be a winner.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The will to win is the only thing.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: I've never been with a losing team in my life, and I don't think I'll start now.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Every time a football player goes to ply his trade, he's got to play from the ground up - from the soles of his feet right up to his head. Every inch of him has to play.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: I'll put the Packers' best players on defense. It's best for a team and good for its morale.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Why did I choose Washington among offers from other cities? Because it is the capital of the world.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: If you're lucky enough to find a guy with a lot of head and a lot of heart, he's never going to come off the field second.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Nobody wants to give up good players.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: I don't think there's a punch-line scheduled, is there?
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: I'm not afraid to die - it's just that I had so much left to do in this world.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Some guys play with their heads. That's okay. You've got to be smart to be number one in any business. But more importantly, you've got to play with your heart, with every fiber of your body.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Go back through football, and you will see that the team with the best defense wins.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: They'd better be physically tough when they start pulling on their football pants.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: At many a moment on many a day, I am convinced that pro football must be a game for madmen, and I must be one of them.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I put my heart and my soul into my work, and have lost my mind in the process.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I feel that there is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I dream of painting and then I paint my dream.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: The fishermen know that the sea is dangerous and the storm terrible, but they have never found these dangers sufficient reason for remaining ashore.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I am still far from being what I want to be, but with God's help I shall succeed.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: The way to know life is to love many things.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: There may be a great fire in our hearts, yet no one ever comes to warm himself at it, and the passers-by see only a wisp of smoke.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: There is no blue without yellow and without orange.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: As we advance in life it becomes more and more difficult, but in fighting the difficulties the inmost strength of the heart is developed.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: The more I think about it, the more I realize there is nothing more artistic than to love others.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I wish they would only take me as I am.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Paintings have a life of their own that derives from the painter's soul.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Even the knowledge of my own fallibility cannot keep me from making mistakes. Only when I fall do I get up again.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Conscience is a man's compass.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: In spite of everything I shall rise again: I will take up my pencil, which I have forsaken in my great discouragement, and I will go on with my drawing.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: One must work and dare if one really wants to live.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Poetry surrounds us everywhere, but putting it on paper is, alas, not so easy as looking at it.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Do not quench your inspiration and your imagination; do not become the slave of your model.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: A good picture is equivalent to a good deed.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: The best way to know God is to love many things.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: One may have a blazing hearth in one's soul and yet no one ever came to sit by it. Passers-by see only a wisp of smoke from the chimney and continue on their way.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: But I always think that the best way to know God is to love many things.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: It is not the language of painters but the language of nature which one should listen to, the feeling for the things themselves, for reality is more important than the feeling for pictures.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Love always brings difficulties, that is true, but the good side of it is that it gives energy.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: How can I be useful, of what service can I be? There is something inside me, what can it be?
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: When I have a terrible need of - shall I say the word - religion. Then I go out and paint the stars.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I can very well do without God both in my life and in my painting, but I cannot, suffering as I am, do without something which is greater than I am, which is my life, the power to create.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Painting is a faith, and it imposes the duty to disregard public opinion.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I experience a period of frightening clarity in those moments when nature is so beautiful. I am no longer sure of myself, and the paintings appear as in a dream.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: If one is master of one thing and understands one thing well, one has at the same time, insight into and understanding of many things.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: It is better to be high-spirited even though one makes more mistakes, than to be narrow-minded and all too prudent.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: If boyhood and youth are but vanity, must it not be our ambition to become men?
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: An artist needn't be a clergyman or a churchwarden, but he certainly must have a warm heart for his fellow men.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: I see drawings and pictures in the poorest of huts and the dirtiest of corners.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Those Dutchmen had hardly any imagination or fantasy, but their good taste and their scientific knowledge of composition were enormous.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Give me four years to teach the children and the seed I have sown will never be uprooted.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The way to crush the bourgeoisie is to grind them between the millstones of taxation and inflation.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The goal of socialism is communism.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: One man with a gun can control 100 without one.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: There are no morals in politics; there is only expedience. A scoundrel may be of use to us just because he is a scoundrel.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Give us the child for 8 years and it will be a Bolshevik forever.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Sometimes - history needs a push.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them in parliament.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Democracy is indispensable to socialism.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Despair is typical of those who do not understand the causes of evil, see no way out, and are incapable of struggle. The modern industrial proletariat does not belong to the category of such classes.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The best way to destroy the capitalist system is to debauch the currency.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Fascism is capitalism in decay.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Without revolutionary theory there can be no revolutionary movement.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: It is true that liberty is precious; so precious that it must be carefully rationed.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: No amount of political freedom will satisfy the hungry masses.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The press should be not only a collective propagandist and a collective agitator, but also a collective organizer of the masses.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The most important thing when ill is to never lose heart.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: It is impossible to predict the time and progress of revolution. It is governed by its own more or less mysterious laws.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: A revolution is impossible without a revolutionary situation; furthermore, not every revolutionary situation leads to revolution.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Freedom in capitalist society always remains about the same as it was in ancient Greek republics: Freedom for slave owners.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: When there is state there can be no freedom, but when there is freedom there will be no state.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: While the State exists there can be no freedom; when there is freedom there will be no State.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Our program necessarily includes the propaganda of atheism.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Politics begin where the masses are, not where there are thousands, but where there are millions, that is where serious politics begin.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Crime is a product of social excess.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Any cook should be able to run the country.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Capitalists are no more capable of self-sacrifice than a man is capable of lifting himself up by his own bootstraps.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Every cook has to learn how to govern the state.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: When one makes a Revolution, one cannot mark time; one must always go forward - or go back. He who now talks about the 'freedom of the press' goes backward, and halts our headlong course towards Socialism.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: If it were necessary to give the briefest possible definition of imperialism, we should have to say that imperialism is the monopoly stage of capitalism.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Can a nation be free if it oppresses other nations? It cannot.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The government is tottering. We must deal it the death blow an any cost. To delay action is the same as death.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: If Socialism can only be realized when the intellectual development of all the people permits it, then we shall not see Socialism for at least five hundred years.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Under socialism all will govern in turn and will soon become accustomed to no one governing.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: To rely upon conviction, devotion, and other excellent spiritual qualities; that is not to be taken seriously in politics.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Without a revolutionary theory there cannot be a revolutionary movement.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Communism is Soviet power plus the electrification of the whole country.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: The history of all countries shows that the working class exclusively by its own effort is able to develop only trade-union consciousness.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Common sense is not so common.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Appreciation is a wonderful thing: It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To the living we owe respect, but to the dead we owe only the truth.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Faith consists in believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: No problem can withstand the assault of sustained thinking.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: My life is a struggle.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Illusion is the first of all pleasures.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: God is not on the side of the big battalions, but on the side of those who shoot best.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: When it is a question of money, everybody is of the same religion.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The Holy Roman Empire is neither Holy, nor Roman, nor an Empire.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We must cultivate our own garden. When man was put in the garden of Eden he was put there so that he should work, which proves that man was not born to rest.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Optimism is the madness of insisting that all is well when we are miserable.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The best government is a benevolent tyranny tempered by an occasional assassination.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent Him.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The husband who decides to surprise his wife is often very much surprised himself.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is lamentable, that to be a good patriot one must become the enemy of the rest of mankind.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her: but once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Injustice in the end produces independence.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: What is tolerance? It is the consequence of humanity. We are all formed of frailty and error; let us pardon reciprocally each other's folly - that is the first law of nature.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Better is the enemy of good.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Perfection is attained by slow degrees; it requires the hand of time.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Opinion has caused more trouble on this little earth than plagues or earthquakes.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Is there anyone so wise as to learn by the experience of others?
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To hold a pen is to be at war.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: 'O Lord make my enemies ridiculous.' And God granted it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Man is free at the moment he wishes to be.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is said that the present is pregnant with the future.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The secret of being a bore... is to tell everything.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy the mad daughter of a wise mother. These daughters have too long dominated the earth.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: There are truths which are not for all men, nor for all times.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The best is the enemy of the good.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Tyrants have always some slight shade of virtue; they support the laws before destroying them.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Ice-cream is exquisite - what a pity it isn't illegal.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: One great use of words is to hide our thoughts.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so, too.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is not enough to conquer; one must learn to seduce.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I am very fond of truth, but not at all of martyrdom.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We are rarely proud when we are alone.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: What most persons consider as virtue, after the age of 40 is simply a loss of energy.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: History is only the register of crimes and misfortunes.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Chance is a word void of sense; nothing can exist without a cause.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Originality is nothing but judicious imitation. The most original writers borrowed one from another.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: In general, the art of government consists of taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To the wicked, everything serves as pretext.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: All the reasonings of men are not worth one sentiment of women.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The ancient Romans built their greatest masterpieces of architecture, their amphitheaters, for wild beasts to fight in.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Nothing would be more tiresome than eating and drinking if God had not made them a pleasure as well as a necessity.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: By appreciation, we make excellence in others our own property.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To succeed in the world it is not enough to be stupid, you must also be well-mannered.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: If God created us in his own image, we have more than reciprocated.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The true triumph of reason is that it enables us to get along with those who do not possess it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is vain for the coward to flee; death follows close behind; it is only by defying it that the brave escape.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Let us read and let us dance - two amusements that will never do any harm to the world.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We are all full of weakness and errors; let us mutually pardon each other our follies - it is the first law of nature.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The ear is the avenue to the heart.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Clever tyrants are never punished.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Let the punishments of criminals be useful. A hanged man is good for nothing; a man condemned to public works still serves the country, and is a living lesson.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The safest course is to do nothing against one's conscience. With this secret, we can enjoy life and have no fear from death.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Everything's fine today, that is our illusion.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: He shines in the second rank, who is eclipsed in the first.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To believe in God is impossible not to believe in Him is absurd.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Paradise was made for tender hearts; hell, for loveless hearts.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Of all religions, the Christian should of course inspire the most tolerance, but until now Christians have been the most intolerant of all men.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The mouth obeys poorly when the heart murmurs.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We have a natural right to make use of our pens as of our tongue, at our peril, risk and hazard.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The sovereign is called a tyrant who knows no laws but his caprice.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Every one goes astray, but the least imprudent are they who repent the soonest.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Use, do not abuse... neither abstinence nor excess ever renders man happy.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The progress of rivers to the ocean is not so rapid as that of man to error.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Wherever there is a settled society, religion is necessary; the laws cover manifest crimes, and religion covers secret crimes.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The instruction we find in books is like fire. We fetch it from our neighbours, kindle it at home, communicate it to others, and it becomes the property of all.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: In the case of news, we should always wait for the sacrament of confirmation.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The first step, my son, which one makes in the world, is the one on which depends the rest of our days.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: This self-love is the instrument of our preservation; it resembles the provision for the perpetuity of mankind: it is necessary, it is dear to us, it gives us pleasure, and we must conceal it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is not love that should be depicted as blind, but self-love.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: One merit of poetry few persons will deny: it says more and in fewer words than prose.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The truths of religion are never so well understood as by those who have lost the power of reason.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We must distinguish between speaking to deceive and being silent to be reserved.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The superfluous, a very necessary thing.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Governments need to have both shepherds and butchers.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: All men are born with a nose and five fingers, but no one is born with a knowledge of God.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Time, which alone makes the reputation of men, ends by making their defects respectable.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The public is a ferocious beast; one must either chain it or flee from it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Very learned women are to be found, in the same manner as female warriors; but they are seldom or ever inventors.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I should like to lie at your feet and die in your arms.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Our country is that spot to which our heart is bound.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I have lived eighty years of life and know nothing for it, but to be resigned and tell myself that flies are born to be eaten by spiders and man to be devoured by sorrow.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The world embarrasses me, and I cannot dream that this watch exists and has no watchmaker.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Satire lies about literary men while they live and eulogy lies about them when they die.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We never live; we are always in the expectation of living.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I die adoring God, loving my friends, not hating my enemies, and detesting superstition.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Nature has always had more force than education.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is one of the superstitions of the human mind to have imagined that virginity could be a virtue.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The infinitely little have a pride infinitely great.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: He who has not the spirit of this age, has all the misery of it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: He was a great patriot, a humanitarian, a loyal friend; provided, of course, he really is dead.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Indeed, history is nothing more than a tableau of crimes and misfortunes.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Anyone who seeks to destroy the passions instead of controlling them is trying to play the angel.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Religion was instituted to make us happy in this life and in the other. What must we do to be happy in the life to come? Be just.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The flowery style is not unsuitable to public speeches or addresses, which amount only to compliment. The lighter beauties are in their place when there is nothing more solid to say; but the flowery style ought to be banished from a pleading, a sermon, or a didactic work.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Very often, say what you will, a knave is only a fool.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is not known precisely where angels dwell whether in the air, the void, or the planets. It has not been God's pleasure that we should be informed of their abode.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: When he to whom one speaks does not understand, and he who speaks himself does not understand, that is metaphysics.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: In every author let us distinguish the man from his works.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is the flash which appears, the thunderbolt will follow.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Let us work without theorizing, tis the only way to make life endurable.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We cannot wish for that we know not.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The little may contrast with the great, in painting, but cannot be said to be contrary to it. Oppositions of colors contrast; but there are also colors contrary to each other, that is, which produce an ill effect because they shock the eye when brought very near it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: What then do you call your soul? What idea have you of it? You cannot of yourselves, without revelation, admit the existence within you of anything but a power unknown to you of feeling and thinking.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Divorce is probably of nearly the same date as marriage. I believe, however, that marriage is some weeks the more ancient.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Woe to the makers of literal translations, who by rendering every word weaken the meaning! It is indeed by so doing that we can say the letter kills and the spirit gives life.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We cannot always oblige; but we can always speak obligingly.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Men use thought only as authority for their injustice, and employ speech only to conceal their thoughts.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Men hate the individual whom they call avaricious only because nothing can be gained from him.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: He is a hard man who is only just, and a sad one who is only wise.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Who serves his country well has no need of ancestors.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: He who is not just is severe, he who is not wise is sad.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Love has features which pierce all hearts, he wears a bandage which conceals the faults of those beloved. He has wings, he comes quickly and flies away the same.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Froth at the top, dregs at bottom, but the middle excellent.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The opportunity for doing mischief is found a hundred times a day, and of doing good once in a year.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Weakness on both sides is, as we know, the motto of all quarrels.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The multitude of books is making us ignorant.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Such is the feebleness of humanity, such is its perversity, that doubtless it is better for it to be subject to all possible superstitions, as long as they are not murderous, than to live without religion.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I know many books which have bored their readers, but I know of none which has done real evil.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Society therefore is as ancient as the world.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: When men do not have healthy notions of the Divinity, false ideas supplant them, just as in bad times one uses counterfeit money when there is no good money.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The ancients recommended us to sacrifice to the Graces, but Milton sacrificed to the Devil.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: All styles are good except the tiresome kind.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: History should be written as philosophy.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Always carry a flagon of whiskey in case of snakebite and furthermore always carry a small snake.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There's no point in being a damn fool about it.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I once spent a year in Philadelphia, I think it was on a Sunday.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: If you can't dazzle them with brilliance, baffle them with bull.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I am free of all prejudices. I hate everyone equally.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: It's morally wrong to allow a sucker to keep his money.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: A woman drove me to drink and I didn't even have the decency to thank her.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Anyone who hates children and animals can't be all bad.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: No doubt exists that all women are crazy; it's only a question of degree.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Last week, I went to Philadelphia, but it was closed.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Reminds me of my safari in Africa. Somebody forgot the corkscrew and for several days we had to live on nothing but food and water.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Remember, a dead fish can float downstream, but it takes a live one to swim upstream.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: There comes a time in the affairs of man when he must take the bull by the tail and face the situation.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Hell, I never vote for anybody, I always vote against.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Once, during Prohibition, I was forced to live for days on nothing but food and water.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: The best cure for insomnia is to get a lot of sleep.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Horse sense is the thing a horse has which keeps it from betting on people.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Women are like elephants. I like to look at 'em, but I wouldn't want to own one.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: The clever cat eats cheese and breathes down rat holes with baited breath.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: It was a woman who drove me to drink, and I never had the courtesy to thank her for it.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I like children - fried.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I always keep a supply of stimulant handy in case I see a snake, which I also keep handy.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Drown in a cold vat of whiskey? Death, where is thy sting?
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: The world is getting to be such a dangerous place, a man is lucky to get out of it alive.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: You can't trust water: Even a straight stick turns crooked in it.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I never drink water; that is the stuff that rusts pipes.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I was in love with a beautiful blonde once. She drove me to drink. That's the one thing I'm indebted to her for.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I must have a drink of breakfast.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Some weasel took the cork out of my lunch.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I am an expert of electricity. My father occupied the chair of applied electricity at the state prison.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Ah, the patter of little feet around the house. There's nothing like having a midget for a butler.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Never cry over spilt milk, because it may have been poisoned.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Set up another case bartender! The best thing for a case of nerves is a case of Scotch.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Sleep - the most beautiful experience in life - except drink.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I'd like to see Paris before I die... Philadelphia will do.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: If I had to live my life over, I'd live over a saloon.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I never drink water. I'm afraid it will become habit-forming.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Some things are better than sex, and some are worse, but there's nothing exactly like it.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I never met a kid I liked.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I never vote for anyone. I always vote against.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Never give a sucker an even break.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Show me a great actor and I'll show you a lousy husband. Show me a great actress, and you've seen the devil.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: There are only two real ways to get ahead today - sell liquor or drink it.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: The laziest man I ever met put popcorn in his pancakes so they would turn over by themselves.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I never worry about being driven to drink; I just worry about being driven home.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Now don't say you can't swear off drinking; it's easy. I've done it a thousand times.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: On the whole, I'd rather be in Philidelphia.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Marry an outdoors woman. Then if you throw her out into the yard on a cold night, she can still survive.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Here lies W. C. Fields. I would rather be living in Philadelphia.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Don't worry about your heart, it will last you as long as you live.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I like to keep a bottle of stimulant handy in case I see a snake, which I also keep handy.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: If there's a will, prosperity can't be far behind.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: The cost of living has gone up another dollar a quart.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I drink therefore I am.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Children should neither be seen or heard from - ever again.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: All the men in my family were bearded, and most of the women.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Abstaining is favorable both to the head and the pocket.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I don't know why I ever come in here. The flies get the best of everything.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make the dream a reality.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: You're dead if you aim only for kids. Adults are only kids grown up, anyway.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: There is more treasure in books than in all the pirate's loot on Treasure Island.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Animation can explain whatever the mind of man can conceive. This facility makes it the most versatile and explicit means of communication yet devised for quick mass appreciation.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Our heritage and ideals, our code and standards - the things we live by and teach our children - are preserved or diminished by how freely we exchange ideas and feelings.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Disneyland will never be completed. It will continue to grow as long as there is imagination left in the world.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I have been up against tough competition all my life. I wouldn't know how to get along without it.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I don't like formal gardens. I like wild nature. It's just the wilderness instinct in me, I guess.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: A man should never neglect his family for business.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: We believed in our idea - a family park where parents and children could have fun- together.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Of all the things I've done, the most vital is coordinating those who work with me and aiming their efforts at a certain goal.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: There's nothing funnier than the human animal.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I'd say it's been my biggest problem all my life... it's money. It takes a lot of money to make these dreams come true.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: You reach a point where you don't work for money.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Disneyland is a work of love. We didn't go into Disneyland just with the idea of making money.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Mickey Mouse is, to me, a symbol of independence. He was a means to an end.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: We are not trying to entertain the critics. I'll take my chances with the public.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: You can't just let nature run wild.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Laughter is America's most important export.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I never called my work an 'art'. It's part of show business, the business of building entertainment.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I have no use for people who throw their weight around as celebrities, or for those who fawn over you just because you are famous.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Whenever I go on a ride, I'm always thinking of what's wrong with the thing and how it can be improved.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: We have created characters and animated them in the dimension of depth, revealing through them to our perturbed world that the things we have in common far outnumber and outweigh those that divide us.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: When people laugh at Mickey Mouse, it's because he's so human; and that is the secret of his popularity.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: We did it Disneyland, in the knowledge that most of the people I talked to thought it would be a financial disaster - closed and forgotten within the first year.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: We allow no geniuses around our Studio.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: People still think of me as a cartoonist, but the only thing I lift a pen or pencil for these days is to sign a contract, a check, or an autograph.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Disneyland is the star, everything else is in the supporting role.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: All cartoon characters and fables must be exaggeration, caricatures. It is the very nature of fantasy and fable.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Mickey Mouse popped out of my mind onto a drawing pad 20 years ago on a train ride from Manhattan to Hollywood at a time when business fortunes of my brother Roy and myself were at lowest ebb and disaster seemed right around the corner.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Crowded classrooms and half-day sessions are a tragic waste of our greatest national resource - the minds of our children.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I believe in being an innovator.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I try to build a full personality for each of our cartoon characters - to make them personalities.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Animation is different from other parts. Its language is the language of caricature. Our most difficult job was to develop the cartoon's unnatural but seemingly natural anatomy for humans and animals.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: It's no secret that we were sticking just about every nickel we had on the chance that people would really be interested in something totally new and unique in the field of entertainment.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Disneyland is a show.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I am not influenced by the techniques or fashions of any other motion picture company.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: I started, actually, to make my first animated cartoon in 1920. Of course, they were very crude things then and I used sort of little puppet things.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Let your soul stand cool and composed before a million universes.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Be curious, not judgmental.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then I contradict myself, I am large, I contain multitudes.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: To me, every hour of the day and night is an unspeakably perfect miracle.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I exist as I am, that is enough.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Oh while I live, to be the ruler of life, not a slave, to meet life as a powerful conqueror, and nothing exterior to me will ever take command of me.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: When I give I give myself.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Henceforth I ask not good fortune. I myself am good fortune.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Every moment of light and dark is a miracle.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: We convince by our presence.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Simplicity is the glory of expression.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Now I see the secret of making the best person: it is to grow in the open air and to eat and sleep with the earth.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Stranger, if you passing meet me and desire to speak to me, why should you not speak to me? And why should I not speak to you?
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Nothing endures but personal qualities.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Viewed freely, the English language is the accretion and growth of every dialect, race, and range of time, and is both the free and compacted composition of all.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Have you learned the lessons only of those who admired you, and were tender with you, and stood aside for you? Have you not learned great lessons from those who braced themselves against you, and disputed passage with you?
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Freedom - to walk free and own no superior.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: There is no week nor day nor hour when tyranny may not enter upon this country, if the people lose their roughness and spirit of defiance.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The genius of the United States is not best or most in its executives or legislatures, nor in its ambassadors or authors or colleges, or churches, or parlors, nor even in its newspapers or inventors, but always most in the common people.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: And your very flesh shall be a great poem.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: In the confusion we stay with each other, happy to be together, speaking without uttering a single word.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: To die is different from what any one supposed, and luckier.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Judging from the main portions of the history of the world, so far, justice is always in jeopardy.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: If any thing is sacred, the human body is sacred.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I say that democracy can never prove itself beyond cavil, until it founds and luxuriantly grows its own forms of art, poems, schools, theology, displacing all that exists, or that has been produced anywhere in the past, under opposite influences.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The whole theory of the universe is directed unerringly to one single individual.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The shallow consider liberty a release from all law, from every constraint. The wise man sees in it, on the contrary, the potent Law of Laws.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The dirtiest book of all is the expurgated book.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: After you have exhausted what there is in business, politics, conviviality, and so on - have found that none of these finally satisfy, or permanently wear - what remains? Nature remains.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Have you heard that it was good to gain the day? I also say it is good to fall, battles are lost in the same spirit in which they are won.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I accept reality and dare not question it.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The great city is that which has the greatest man or woman: if it be a few ragged huts, it is still the greatest city in the whole world.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I cannot be awake for nothing looks to me as it did before, Or else I am awake for the first time, and all before has been a mean sleep.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: All faults may be forgiven of him who has perfect candor.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Behold I do not give lectures or a little charity, When I give I give myself.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The beauty of independence, departure, actions that rely on themselves.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: To have great poets, there must be great audiences.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Produce great men, the rest follows.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: There is that indescribable freshness and unconsciousness about an illiterate person that humbles and mocks the power of the noblest expressive genius.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: And whoever walks a furlong without sympathy walks to his own funeral drest in his shroud.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Seeing, hearing, feeling, are miracles, and each part and tag of me is a miracle.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The beautiful uncut hair of graves.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I see great things in baseball. It's our game - the American game.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: A great city is that which has the greatest men and women.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Other lands have their vitality in a few, a class, but we have it in the bulk of our people.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The real war will never get in the books.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: He most honors my style who learns under it to destroy the teacher.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: And I will show that nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Whoever degrades another degrades me, And whatever is done or said returns at last to me.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I find no sweeter fat than sticks to my own bones.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The proof of a poet is that his country absorbs him as affectionately as he has absorbed it.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The United States themselves are essentially the greatest poem.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: O public road, I say back I am not afraid to leave you, yet I love you, you express me better than I can express myself.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Why are there trees I never walk under but large and melodious thoughts descend upon me?
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: There is no object so soft but it makes a hub for the wheeled universe.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: The words of my book nothing, the drift of it everything.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I heard what was said of the universe, heard it and heard it of several thousand years; it is middling well as far as it goes - but is that all?
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Here or henceforward it is all the same to me, I accept Time absolutely.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: To the real artist in humanity, what are called bad manners are often the most picturesque and significant of all.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Speech is the twin of my vision, it is unequal to measure itself, it provokes me forever, it says sarcastically, Walt you contain enough, why don't you let it out then?
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Let that which stood in front go behind, let that which was behind advance to the front, let bigots, fools, unclean persons, offer new propositions, let the old propositions be postponed.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: And there is no trade or employment but the young man following it may become a hero.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I say to mankind, Be not curious about God. For I, who am curious about each, am not curious about God - I hear and behold God in every object, yet understand God not in the least.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Only when the tide goes out do you discover who's been swimming naked.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you'll do things differently.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: It's far better to buy a wonderful company at a fair price than a fair company at a wonderful price.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Rule No.1: Never lose money. Rule No.2: Never forget rule No.1.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Predicting rain doesn't count. Building arks does.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: I don't look to jump over 7-foot bars: I look around for 1-foot bars that I can step over.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Wall Street is the only place that people ride to in a Rolls Royce to get advice from those who take the subway.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: I always knew I was going to be rich. I don't think I ever doubted it for a minute.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: When a management with a reputation for brilliance tackles a business with a reputation for bad economics, it is the reputation of the business that remains intact.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Should you find yourself in a chronically leaking boat, energy devoted to changing vessels is likely to be more productive than energy devoted to patching leaks.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: We simply attempt to be fearful when others are greedy and to be greedy only when others are fearful.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: In the business world, the rearview mirror is always clearer than the windshield.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: The only way to get love is to be lovable. It's very irritating if you have a lot of money. You'd like to think you could write a check: 'I'll buy a million dollars' worth of love.' But it doesn't work that way. The more you give love away, the more you get.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: It's better to hang out with people better than you. Pick out associates whose behavior is better than yours and you'll drift in that direction.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Only buy something that you'd be perfectly happy to hold if the market shut down for 10 years.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Basically, when you get to my age, you'll really measure your success in life by how many of the people you want to have love you actually do love you.
